#  move (mv)

Moves an object and all connected features on that object, e.g. PointLoad, Plate. 

## Signature
    
    
    move [pt_obj] | [ln_obj] | [polyc_obj] | [tn_obj] | [srf_obj] | [vol_obj]... <x y z>

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Name of the point that should be moved   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Name of the line that should be moved   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Name of the polycurve that should be moved   
tn_obj  | obj  | Name of the tunnel that should be moved   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which a line feature should be added   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference, Name of the volume to which a line feature should be added   
x  | float  | x-value   
y  | float  | y-value   
z  | float  | z-value   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures, Flow conditions |  Global | Geometric object | Borehole | Water level   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Moves one or more objects in a specified direction. 

_Example:_
    
    
    move line_1 (2 3 4)

Moves Line_1 in direction (2, 3, 4). 

_Example:_
    
    
    move (Line_1 Points[2]) (7 5 4)

Moves Line_1 and the third point from the list of points in direction (7, 5, 4). 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Moves an object in a specified direction. 

_Example:_
    
    
    move Point_1 (2 3 4)

Moves Point_1 in direction (2, 3, 4). 

_Example:_
    
    
    move UserWaterLevel_1 1 2 3

Moves UserWaterLevel_1 in the (x, y, z) over a specified distance. 

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Moves a borehole in the x-y plane over a specified distance. 

_Example:_
    
    
    move Borehole_1 3 7

Moves Borehole_1 along the x-axis with a distance of 3 and along the y-axis with a distance of 7. 

## See also

[movepoint](GUID-BD6D83FA-FD49-4A93-A025-081068B6A766.html)

# deletepoint ()

Deletes a point of a polygon or water level. 

## Signature
    
    
    deletepoint <pt_num>

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_num  | int  |  Point number. Number of the point that should be deleted. The numbering of points is 0-based, so the first point has number 0.   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Polygon | Water level   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Deletes a point of a polygon. 

_Example:_
    
    
    deletepoint Polygon_1 1

Deletes the point at index 1 of Polygon_1. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Deletes a point of a water level. 

_Example:_
    
    
    deletepoint UserWaterLevel_1 1

Deletes the point at index 1 of UserWaterLevel_1. 

## See also

[addpoint](GUID-28FC204C-9A94-4B53-8630-C356010C2793.html), [insertpoint](GUID-9B27B028-581D-442B-B2AC-F573D38FDA25.html), [movepoint](GUID-BD6D83FA-FD49-4A93-A025-081068B6A766.html)

#  retrievesuggestedparameters (rsp)

Retrieves suggested parameters for a phase which involves a time-dependent analysis. 

## Signature
    
    
     retrievesuggestedparameters <ph_obj>

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
ph_obj  | obj  |  Phase object reference. Name of the phase of which parameters are to be retrieved   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Flow conditions, Staged construction |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Retrieves suggested parameters for a phase which involves a time-dependent analysis. This is relevant to calculation types that allow for manual time step determination. 

_Example:_
    
    
    retrievesuggestedparameters Phase_1

Retrieves suggested parameters for Phase_1.

#  addcurvepoint (adc)

Preselection of stress points or nodes for calculation results, with an indication of a preferred direction. 

## Signature
    
    
    addcurvepoint <S> [plx_obj] <(x y z)> [(dirx diry dirz)]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
S  | str  |  Type of point to be selected, i.e., "Node" or "Stress point" or "Rigid body"  
plx_obj  | obj  |  The object from which the node or stress point must be selected, e.g., Soil_1_2 or Plate_2_1   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
dirx  | float  |  x-component of vector   
diry  | float  |  y-component of vector   
dirz  | float  |  z-component of vector   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Output  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[CurvePoint](GUID-DA418937-DE6A-4161-9215-4BBFE962B9E7.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Preselection of stress points or nodes for calculation results. 

_Example:_
    
    
    addcurvepoint "Node" (3 5 7)

Preselects a node that is closest to the coordinates (3, 5, 7). 

_Example:_
    
    
    addcurvepoint "Rigid body" (0 1 2)

Finds the rigid body closest to the coordinates (0, 1, 2).

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Preselection of stress points or nodes that belong to a specific object for calculation results. 

_Example:_
    
    
    addcurvepoint "Node" Soil_1_1 (3 5 7)

Preselects a node from the soil cluster Soil_1_1 that is closest to the coordinates (3 5 7). 

_Example:_
    
    
    addcurvepoint "Stress point" Soil_1_1 (3 5 7)

Preselects a stress point from the soil cluster Soil_1_1 that is closest to the coordinates (3 5 7). 

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Preselection of stress points or nodes for calculation results with an indication of a preferred direction for cases with multiple points near the specified coordinates. 

_Example:_
    
    
    addcurvepoint "Node" (3 5 7) (0 1 0)

Preselects a node that is closest to the coordinates (3 5 7) in the direction of vector (0 1 0). 

_Example:_
    
    
    addcurvepoint "Node" Soil_1_1 (3 5 7) (0 1 0)

Preselects a node from the soil cluster Soil_1_1 that is closest to the coordinates (3 5 7) in the direction of vector (0 1 0). 

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Preselection of the rigid body for calculation results. 

_Example:_
    
    
    addcurvepoint RigidBody_1_2

Preselects node from the RigidBody_1_2. 

## See also

[clearcurvepoints](GUID-4B311B67-E0FE-4057-A694-48C3E9854D4D.html)

#  Breadth

Tunnel/rock bolts breadth dimension object.

---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the breadth.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the breadth.

Parent  |  Parent  |  \-  |  Name of the parent object of the breadth.

#  multiply (mul)

Multiplies properties of objects with a specified factor. 

## Signature
    
    
     multiply [mul_obj] <Num>
    	mul_obj: {prop_ref | obj_ref | list_ref}
    		prop_ref: <PropName>... [ph_obj]
    		obj_ref: <plx_obj>... <Param>
    		list_ref: <lst_obj> [Param]...
    

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
Num  | float  |  Number. Factor by which the values of the object properties should be multiplied   
PropName  | str  |  Property name. Name of property that should be multiplied   
ph_obj  | obj  |  Phase object reference. Name of the phase in which the object is to be multiplied   
plx_obj  | obj  | PLAXIS object reference. PLAXIS object to be multiplied   
Param  | str  | Parameter. One or more parameters for the command that should be applied   
lst_obj  | obj  | Listable object reference. Name of the listable to which the command should be applied   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
SoilTest  |  Object | Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Multiplies properties of objects with a specified factor. 

_Example:_
    
    
    multiply General.Phases[0].Duration 2

Multiplies the value of Duration of the first phase of a General soil test with a factor of 2. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Multiplies properties of objects with a specified factor. 

_Example:_
    
    
    multiply General.Phases[1] "Epsxxinc" 2

Multiplies the value of Epsxxinc of the second phase of a General soil test with a factor of 2. 

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Multiplies properties of several objects with a specified factor. 

_Example:_
    
    
    multiply (General.Phases[0].Duration General.Phases[0].Epsxxinc) 2

Multiplies the values of Duration and Epsxxinc of the first phase of a General soil test with a factor of 2. 

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Multiplies all properties of an object with a specified factor. 

_Example:_
    
    
    multiply (General.Phases[-1]) 3

Multiplies all the values of the last phase of a General soil test with a factor of 3. 

## See also

[set](GUID-32CF272F-16AC-46A5-AB41-1AB04CD41DB0.html), [setproperties](GUID-45853B0C-FF95-46EF-A9E8-C6E5FD8F30C5.html)

**Parent topic:** [ Soiltest command reference ](GUID-07D4ED2F-DA46-4459-8032-95205D8918A6.html)

#  __getvalue (__gv)

Displays the value of a surface load or displacement at a specified location. 

## Signature
    
    
    __getvalue <(x y z)> 

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Surface | Polygon   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays the value of a surface load or displacement at a specified location (x, y, z). 

_Example:_
    
    
    __getvalue SurfaceLoad_1 (9.1 3.4 2.1)

Displays the value of the stresses at coordinates (9.1, 3.4, 2.1). 

_Example:_
    
    
    __getvalue SurfaceDisplacement_1 (1 2 3)

Displays the value of the displacement at coordinates (1 2 3).

## GUID-064F8245-0453-4B36-B7F1-2D912DEAF9B3.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

#  Surface

Surface object in the geometry. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the surface.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the surface.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the surface.   
x  |  x  |  Length  |  x-coordinate.   
y  |  y  |  Length  |  y-coordinate.   
z  |  z  |  Length  |  z-coordinate.   
Area  |  Area  |  Length 2 |  Area of the surface object.   
AxisFunction  |  AxisFunction  |  \-  | 

  * Automatic  The first, second and third axis of the local coordinate system of the surface are defined automatically. The first axis is according to the global coordinate system and lies with the second axis in the plane of the surface. The third axis is perpendicular to the plane of the surface. 
  * Manual  The first axis of the local coordinate system of the surface is defined manually, the third axis is perpendicular to the plane of the surface and the second axis is determined automatically from the first- and third axis. 

  
AxisVectorx  |  Axis1 x |  \-  |  x-component of the vector defining the first axis of the surface.   
AxisVectory  |  Axis1 y |  \-  |  y-component of the vector defining the first axis of the surface.   
AxisVectorz  |  Axis1 z |  \-  |  z-component of the vector defining the first axis of the surface.   
PlaneDefinition  |  Plane definition  |  \-  | 

  * First points  The first three points of the surface are used to define the plane of the surface. 
  * Best fit  All points of the surface are used to define the plane of the surface using the least squares method.

## GUID-066C160B-A6D9-4F3B-86EF-70FEF398C635.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  export (exp)

Exports 3D models, structural entities, geometries, cutobjects, as CAD file formats (.step, .stp, .dxf, .brep) 

## Signature
    
    
    export <path> [obj_ref]...
    	obj_ref: {pt_obj | ln_obj | polyc_obj | tn_obj | srf_obj | vol_obj | bhvol_obj} | plx_obj
    

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
path  | str  | Save location. Location to save an output CAD file   
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference. Name of a point that should be exported   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference. Name of a line that should be exported   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Polycurve object reference. Name of a polycurve that should be exported   
tn_obj  | obj  | Tunnel object reference. Name of a tunnel object that should be exported   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference. Name of a structural surface that should be exported   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference. Name of a volume that should be exported   
bhvol_obj  | obj  | Borehole volume object reference. Name of a borehole volume that should be exported   
plx_obj  | obj  |  Object reference. Name of the object of which the source entities should be displayed   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Exports selected geometric objects to a specified location in a specified file format. 

_Example:_
    
    
    export "C:\data\CADgeometry.step"

Exports the geometry as "step" CAD file format to a specified location. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Exports a defined 3D model to a specified location in a specified file format 

_Example:_
    
    
    export "C:\data\CADgeometry.brep" Volume_1

Exports the specified volume as "brep" CAD file format to a specified location

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Exports cut objects to a specified location in a specified file format 

_Example:_
    
    
    export "C:\data\CADgeometry.brep" Surface_Volume_1_1_1

Exports the specified polygon as "brep" CAD file format to a specified location

  * Infiltration  The well adds water to its environment.

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

#  calculate (ca)

Calculates all phases that are currently marked for calculation. 

## Signature
    
    
    calculate [{ph_obj... | B}]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
ph_obj  | obj  |  Phase object reference, name of the phase that should be calculated   
B  | bool  |  Boolean; True calculates all phases regardless of whether they are currently marked for calculation, False only calculates the phases that are currently marked for calculation   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Flow conditions, Staged construction |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Calculates all phases that are currently marked for calculation. 

_Example:_
    
    
    calculate

Calculates all phases that are currently marked for calculation.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Calculates one or more explicitly specified phases, regardless of whether they are currently marked for calculation. 

_Example:_
    
    
    calculate Phase_1 Phase_6

Calculates Phase_1 and Phase_6.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Calculates all phases that are currently marked for calculation with the possibility to also calculate the phases that are currently not marked for calculation. 

_Example:_
    
    
    calculate True

Calculates all phases regardless of whether they are currently marked for calculation.

## See also

[phase](GUID-3B4FEA05-9544-4360-AA95-14EE8C6217DE.html), [preview](GUID-7A191525-5A12-435C-A144-420B24BCDC6C.html), [view](GUID-89C0B274-CF9C-4F20-BA8E-6086ADFCD625.html)

#  geogridmat (mgm)

Creates a geogrid material set. 

## Signature
    
    
    geogridmat [{PropName PropValue}]...
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [GeogridMat](GUID-594A7B53-B995-4E73-A51D-5E33F33C26A2.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
PropName  | str  |  Property name. Details on the available properties at object [GeogridMat](GUID-594A7B53-B995-4E73-A51D-5E33F33C26A2.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  |  Property value. Details on the available properties at object [GeogridMat](GUID-594A7B53-B995-4E73-A51D-5E33F33C26A2.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[GeogridMat](GUID-594A7B53-B995-4E73-A51D-5E33F33C26A2.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a geogrid material set with no specified properties. It is not possible to calculate with this material before editing it to make its properties valid. 

_Example:_
    
    
    geogridmat

Creates a new geogrid material set.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a geogrid material set with specified properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    geogridmat "Identification" "Geomembrane" "MaterialType" "Elastic" "EA1" 585

Creates a geogrid material set with specified properties.

## See also

[geogrid](GUID-6B33756A-BD25-43AC-B88F-566AFC325A91.html)

#  setwaterlevel (swl)

Assigns a water level to one or more objects. 

## Signature
    
    
    setwaterlevel <OptA> | <OptB>
    	OptA: <plx_ref>... <ph_obj>
    	OptB: <ph_obj>... <wl_obj>

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  Name of the object to which a water level should be assigned   
oh_obj  | obj  |  Name of the phase in which a water level should be assigned   
wl_obj  | obj  |  Name of the water level that should be assigned to the object   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Flow conditions, Staged construction |  Object | Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Assigns a water level to one or more objects in a phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    setwaterlevel (Soil_1 Soil_2) (InitialPhase Phase_1) UserWaterLevel_1

Assigns UserWaterLevel_1 to Soil_1 and Soil_2 in the initial phase and Phase_1.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Assigns a water level to one or more objects in a phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    setwaterlevel Soil_2 (Phase_1 Phase_3) UserWaterlevel_4

Assigns UserWaterLevel_4 to Soil_2 in Phase_1 and Phase_3.

## See also

[setwaterinterpolate](GUID-8F146C20-61AF-415F-AFED-BC965D0947A5.html), [setwaterdry](GUID-EE786935-8CD0-426F-92CC-D8482F867185.html)

NodeCount  |  NodeCount  |  \-  |  Number of nodes in the entire mesh.   
InterfaceCount  |  InterfaceCount  |  \-  |  Number of interfaces in the entire mesh.   
SoilElementCount  |  SoilElementCount  |  \-  |  Number of soil elements in the entire mesh.   
NodesPerSoilElement  |  NodesPerSoilElement  |  \-  |  Number of nodes in a soil element.   
SmallestElementSize  |  SmallestElementSize  |  \-  |  Area of the smallest soil element in the mesh.   
SideNodeCount  |  SideNodeCount  |  \-  |  Number of nodes on the side of a soil element.   
SideStressPointCount  |  SideStressPointCount  |  \-  |  Number of stress points at the side of an element.   
HasEffectiveSaturation  |  HasEffectiveSaturation  |  \-  |  Checks whether the model has effective saturation values.   
AnalysisType  |  AnalysisType  |  \-  |  Checks which type of analysis was used during the calculation.   
Axisymmetric  |  Axisymmetric  |  \-  |  Checks whether the calculation was axisymmetric. Relevant to PLAXIS 2D.

SoilElementType  |  SoilElementType  |  \-  |  Checks which type of soil element is used. Such as 'Triangle15Nodes'

#  setproperties (sps)

Changes properties of objects. 

## Signature
    
    
    setproperties {<PropName> [ph_obj] <PropValue>}...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
PropName  | str  |  Property name   
ph_obj  | obj  |  Name of the phase in which the property of an object should be changed   
PropValue  | str | float  |  Property value   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Any   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Changes several properties of an object at once. 

_Example:_
    
    
    setproperties Polygon_1 "x" 4 "Name" "small_surface"

Changes the x-coordinate of Polygon_1 to 4 and renames it to "small_polygon" "small_surface"). 

_Example:_
    
    
    setproperties Sand "gammaUnsat" 18 "cRef" 5 "phi" 30

Changes the material properties of Sand to the ones specified in pairs of parameter name - parameter value. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Changes the properties of a material set in a certain phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    setproperties NodeToNodeAnchor_2_1 "AdjustPrestress" Phase_1 True

Sets the option to adjust the prestress force for NodeToNodeAnchor_2_1 in Phase_1 to True. 

_Example:_
    
    
    setproperties PointLoad_1_1 "Fx" Phase_1 -10 "Fy" Phase_1 -150 

Sets the Fx property of the PointLoad_1_1 in Phase_1 to -10, and the Fy property in Phase_1 to -150. 

_Example:_
    
    
    setproperties PointLoad_1_1 "Fy" Phase_1 -100 "Fy" Phase_2 -150 "Fy" Phase_3 -200 

Sets the Fy property of the PointLoad_1_1 in Phase_1 to -100, in Phase_2 to -150 and in Phase_3 to -200. 

## See also

[set](GUID-7CCCA1E8-2744-47CE-A26A-A82D1D55245E.html)

#  cylinder (cyl)

Creates a cylinder. 

## Signature
    
    
    cylinder <Radius> <Height> [Coords]
    		Coords: (x y z) | {(x y z) (dirx diry dirz)} 

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
Radius  | float  |  Desired radius of the cylinder   
Height  | float  |  Desired height of the cylinder   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
dirx  | float  |  x-value of the vector giving the direction in which the cylinder should be pointing   
diry  | float  | y-value of the vector giving the direction in which the cylinder should be pointing   
dirz  | float  | z-value of the vector giving the direction in which the cone should be pointing   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Volume](GUID-CDDE333E-8922-4FF5-B2DB-4B6B31644557.html), [Soil](GUID-12538F90-AAA2-4AE4-841C-1390CE850761.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a cylinder with a specified radius and a specified height at the origin (0, 0, 0). 

_Example:_
    
    
    cylinder 2 5

Creates a cylinder with a radius of 2 and a height of 5 at the origin (0, 0, 0).

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a cylinder with a specified radius and height at a specified location (x, y, z). 

_Example:_
    
    
    cylinder 2 5 (1 2 3)

Creates a cylinder with a radius of 2 and a height of 5 at coordinates (1, 2, 3).

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Creates a cylinder with a specified radius and height at a location (x, y, z) in a specified direction described by a vector. 

_Example:_
    
    
    cylinder 2 5 (1 2 3) (5 7 12)

Creates a cylinder with a radius of 2 and a height of 5 at coordinates (1, 2, 3) pointing in direction (5, 7, 12).

## See also

[cone](GUID-4D1F32CF-5EEF-4049-AD1A-C5D83F1A31F0.html), [cuboid](GUID-BA74E3B7-898B-412C-B289-779F6CC06C81.html)

#  SoilMat

Material set that can be assigned to a soil or rock. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the soil material.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the soil material.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the soil material.   
Identification  |  Identification  |  \-  |  Identification of the soil material.   
Colour  |  Colour  |  \-  |  Colour of the soil material.   
SoilModel  |  Material model  |  \-  | 

  * None  No material model is selected. 
  * Linear Elastic  Use the Linear Elastic model. This model is generally too crude to capture essential features of soil and rock behaviour, but for modelling massive structural elements and bedrock layers it tends to be appropriate. 
  * Mohr-Coulomb  Use the Mohr-Coulomb model. This model represents a 'first-order' approximation of soil or rock behaviour. 
  * Hardening Soil  Use the Hardening Soil model. This model is an advanced model for the simulation of soil behaviour. 
  * HS small  Use the Hardening Soil model with small-strain stiffness. This model is the same as the Hardening Soil model, but also accounts for the increased stiffness of soils at small strains. 
  * Soft Soil  Use the Soft Soil model. This model is a Cam-Clay type model especially meant for primary compression of near normally-consolidated clay-type soils. 
  * Soft Soil Creep  Use the Soft Soil Creep model. This model is the same as the Soft Soil model, but also accounts for viscous effects, i.e. creep and stress relaxation. 
  * Jointed Rock  Use the Jointed Rock model. This model is an anisotropic elastic-plastic model, especially meant to simulate the behaviour of rock layers involving a stratification and particular fault directions. 
  * Modified Cam-Clay  Use the Modified Cam-Clay model. This model is meant primarily for the modelling of near normally-consolidated clay-type soils. 
  * NGI-ADP  Use the NGI-ADP model. This model may be used for capacity, deformation and soil-structure interaction analyses involving undrained loading of clay. 
  * Hoek-Brown  Use the Hoek-Brown model. This model is a better non-linear approximation of the strength of rocks. It involves shear strength as well as tensile strength in a continuous formulation. 
  * Sekiguchi-Ohta Inviscid  Use the Sekiguchi-Ohta Inviscid model. This model has been developed to formulate a constitutive law for normally consolidated clay. Particular emphasis is placed on taking the effect of time and stress-induced anisotropy into consideration. 
  * Sekiguchi-Ohta Viscid  Use the Sekiguchi-Ohta Viscid model. This model has been developed to formulate a constitutive law for normally consolidated clay. Particular emphasis is placed on taking the effect of time and stress-induced anisotropy into consideration. 
  * Concrete  Use the Concrete model. This model is an elastoplastic model for simulating the time-dependent strength and stiffness of concrete, strain hardening-softening in compression and tension as well as creep and shrinkage. 
  * UBC3D-PLM  Use the UBC3D-PLM model. This model is an effective stress elasto-plastic model which is capable of simulating the liquefaction behaviour of sands and silty sands under seismic loading. 
  * UDCAM-S  Use the UDCAM-S model. This model is an advanced model to deal with undrained soil behaviour and degradation of the strength and stiffness in cyclic loading of clay or low permeable silty soils. 
  * User-defined  Use User-defined soil models. A DLL file containing one or more user-defined soil models must be in the directory of PLAXIS in order for this to work. 

  
DrainageType  |  Drainage type  |  \-  | 

  * Drained  Drained or long-term material behaviour in which stiffness and strength are defined in terms of effective properties. 
  * Undrained (A)  Undrained or short-term material behaviour in which stiffness and strength are defined in terms of effective properties. 
  * Undrained (B)  Undrained or short-term material behaviour in which stiffness is defined in terms of effective properties and strength is defined as undrained shear strength. 
  * Undrained (C)  Undrained or short-term material behaviour in which stiffness and strength are defined in terms of undrained properties. 
  * Non-porous  Material behaviour in which pore pressures cannot occur. 

  
gammaUnsat  |  γ unsat |  Force/Length 3 |  Unit soil weight above phreatic level.   
gammaSat  |  γ sat |  Force/Length 3 |  Unit soil weight below phreatic level.   
eInit  |  e init |  \-  |  Initial void ratio.   
nInit  |  n init |  \-  |  Initial porosity.   
RayleighDampingInputMethod  |  Rayleigh Damping input method  |  \-  | 

  * Direct  Allows to specify Rayleigh alpha and beta. 
  * SDOF equivalence  Single Degree of Freedom equivalent values. 

  
RayleighAlpha  |  Rayleigh alpha  |  \-  |  Rayleigh alpha value.   
RayleighBeta  |  Rayleigh beta  |  \-  |  Rayleigh beta value.   
TargetDamping1  |  ξ 2 |  %  |  Damping target value 1.   
TargetDamping2  |  ξ 2 |  %  |  Damping target value 2.   
TargetFrequency1  |  f 1 |  Hz  |  Damping target frequency value 1.   
TargetFrequency2  |  f 2 |  Hz  |  Damping target frequency value 2.   
ERef  |  E ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Reference Young's modulus.   
ERef  |  E u,ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Reference Young's modulus for Undrained C.   
nu  |  ν  |  \-  |  Poisson's ratio.   
GRef  |  G ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Reference value of the shear modulus.   
EOed  |  E eod |  Force/Length 2 |  Oedometer modulus.   
EInc  |  E inc |  Force/Length 2 /Length  |  Increment of the Young's modulus.   
verticalRef  |  vertical ref |  Length  |  Reference elevation on the vertical axis above which the Young's modulus is equal to the reference value.   
Vs  |  V s |  Length/Time  |  Shear wave velocity.   
Vp  |  V p |  Length/Time  |  Compression wave velocity.   
cRef  |  c ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Reference value of the cohesion.   
sURef  |  s u,ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Reference value of the undrained shear strength for Undrained B and C.   
phi  |  φ  |  °  |  Friction angle of the soil material.   
phiU  |  φ u (phi)  |  °  |  Friction angle of the soil material for Undrained B and C.   
psi  |  ψ  |  °  |  Dilatancy angle of the soil material.   
cInc  |  c increment |  Force/Length 2 /Length  |  Increment of cohesion.   
sUInc  |  s u,inc |  Force/Length 2 /Length  |  Increment of undrained shear strength.   
TensionCutOff  |  Tension cut-off  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the use of the tension cut-off procedure. 
  * False  Disables the use of the tension cut-off procedure. 

  
TensileStrength  |  Tensile strength  |  Force/Length 2 |  Allowable tensile strength in the soil.   
E50ref  |  E 50 ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Secant stiffness in standard drained triaxial test.   
EOedRef  |  E oed ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Tangent stiffness for primary oedometer loading.   
EURRef  |  E ur ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Unloading/reloading stiffness at engineering strains.   
nuUR  |  ν  |  \-  |  Poisson's ratio for unloading/reloading.   
UseAlternatives  |  Use alternatives  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the option to define the stiffness of the soil material by giving the C c , C s and e init . 
  * False  False Disables the option to define the stiffness of the soil material by giving the C c , C s and e init . 

  
Cc  |  C c |  \-  |  Compression index.   
Cs  |  C s |  \-  |  Swelling- or reloading index.   
PowerM  |  power (m)  |  \-  |  Power for stress-level dependency of stiffness.   
pRef  |  p ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Reference stress for stiffnesses.   
DilatancyCutOff  |  Dilatancy cut-off  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the use of the dilatancy cut-off.

## GUID-0FD3164F-7D6D-4F9B-BAD1-5B9ABF6F84F8.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

#  n2nanchor (nna)

Adds node-to-node anchor features to lines. 

## Signature
    
    
    n2nanchor   <line> [line]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
     line:{<startpoint> <point> <point> |  ln_obj |  polyc_obj}
    	startpoint: (x y z) | pt_obj
    	point:	{"absolute" {(x y z) | pt_obj}} | {"relative" (x y z)} | {"angles" (Ang Ang) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj }} | {"vector" (dirx diry dirz) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj}}
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [NodeToNodeAnchor](GUID-98C932E3-CBFD-4C72-98E5-7E9DE218D959.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point(s) for which a NodeToNodeAnchor object should start or end   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference, Name of the line to which a NodeToNodeAnchor object should be added   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which a NodeToNodeAnchor object should be added   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or angle ("angles")   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
z  | float  | z-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
dirx  | float  |  Vector component ("vector")   
diry  | float  |  Vector component ("vector")   
dirz  | float  | Vector component ("vector")   
Ang  | float  | Angle of the line with respect to the reference axis  
Len  | float  |  Vector length ("vector")   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [NodeToNodeAnchor](GUID-98C932E3-CBFD-4C72-98E5-7E9DE218D959.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [NodeToNodeAnchor](GUID-98C932E3-CBFD-4C72-98E5-7E9DE218D959.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[NodeToNodeAnchor](GUID-98C932E3-CBFD-4C72-98E5-7E9DE218D959.html), [Point](GUID-B66BC755-E798-4237-AA8F-FC607481D430.html), [Line](GUID-EA175FC9-E4E6-4FD3-97C0-4F1F3624D025.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds node-to-node anchor features to one or more lines in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    n2nanchor Line_1

Adds a node-to-node anchor feature to Line_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    n2nanchor (Line_6 Line 4)

Adds node-to-node anchor features to Line_6 and Line_4.

_Example:_
    
    
    n2nanchor (1 4 0) (2 3 0)

Creates a new line between three points with coordinates (1, 4, 0)and (2, 3, 0)  and adds a line load feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    n2nanchor Point_1 Point_2 (4 5 0)

Creates a new line between Point_1, Point_2 and a point with coordinates (4, 5, 0) and adds a node-to-node anchor feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    n2nanchor Polycurve_1

Adds a node-to-node anchor feature to closed Polycurve_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    n2nanchor 1 2 0 "relative" 3 4 8

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 0) to another new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y- and 8 in the z-direction from the first point at (4, 6, 8). Creates a line from coordinates (1, 2, 0) to (4, 6, 8) and adds a node-to-node anchor feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    n2nanchor Point_1 "relative" 3 4 8 -5 -9 10 "angles" 0 30 16

Creates a line from Point_1 (1, 2, 0) to a new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y-, and 8 in the z-direction from the first point at (4, 6, 8). From that new point a line is created to another new point which is -5 in the x-, -9 in the y-  and 10 in the z-direction from the previous point at (-1, -3, 18). From that point a new line is created which has an angle of 0 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 30 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 16. This line ends at coordinates (12.86, -3, 26). Adds node-to-node anchor features to all lines.

_Example:_
    
    
    n2nanchor (1 2 3) "angles" 45 50 10 "absolute" (4 5 6)

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 3) which has an angle of 45 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 50 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 10. Then creates a line from the end point of the first line to a new point with coordinates (4, 5, 6) and adds node-to-node anchor features to all lines.

_Example:_
    
    
    n2nanchor Group_1

Adds node-to-node anchor features to all structural surfaces in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only surfaces.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds node-to-node anchor features to one or more existing lines in the geometry and directly set their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    n2nanchor Line_1 "Material" Footing

Adds a node-to-node anchor feature to Line_1 and sets the material to Footing.

_Example:_
    
    
    n2nanchor (Line_1 Line_3) "Material" Anchor

Adds a node-to-node anchor feature to Line_1 and Line_3 and sets the material to Anchor for both node-to-node anchors.

_Example:_
    
    
    n2nanchor Point_1 (5 6 0) "Material" Anchor

Creates a new line between Point_1 and a new point with coordinates (5, 6, 0), adds a node-to-node anchor feature to it and sets the material to Anchor.

_Example:_
    
    
    n2nanchor 1 2 0 "relative" 3 4 8 "Material" Anchor

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 0) to another new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y- and 8 in the z-direction from the first point at (4, 6, 8). Creates a line from coordinates (1, 2, 0) to (4, 6, 8), adds a node-to-node anchor feature to it and sets the material to Anchor.

## See also

[line](GUID-A7671899-36CF-4CF1-B1EA-D8C754F013BB.html), [fixedendanchor](GUID-25B2292C-0C50-4E9A-AADE-91D0F766F142.html)

# InputSettings

This object represents the input settings for the calculation of a phase. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
TimeInterval  |  Time interval  |  Time  |  Time   
TimeIntervalSeconds  |  Time interval seconds  |  Time  |  Dynamic time   
UseTensionCutoff  |  Use tension cutoff  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the use of tension cut-off. 
  * False  Disables the use of tension cut-off. 

  
TensionCutOff  |  Tension cut-off  |  \-  |  The value at which the tension is maxed out   
UseCavitationCutOff  |  Use cavitation cut-off  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the use of cavitation cut-off. 
  * False  Disables the use of cavitation cut-off. 

  
CavitationCutOff  |  Cavitation cut-off  |  \-  |  The value at which the cavitation is maxed out   
IgnoreSuction  |  Ignore suction  |  \-  | 

  * True  Ignores the use of suction. 
  * False  Suction is taken into account. 

  
UseUpdatedWaterPressures  |  Use updated water pressures  |  \-  | 

  * True  Updated water pressures are taken into account. 
  * False  Updated water pressures are not taken into account. 

  
IgnoreUndrainedBehaviour  |  Ignore undrained behaviour  |  \-  | 

  * True  Undrained behaviour will be ignored in this phase. 
  * False  Undrained behaviour is taken into account. 

  
Is3D  |  Is3D  |  \-  |  To check if the project is 3D or not.   
Is64Bits  |  Is64Bits  |  \-  |  To check if the calculation was performed in 64bit mode   
DeformCalcType  |  Deformation calculation type  |  \-  | 

  * For InitialPhase: 
  * K0 procedure (1)  This calculation type can be used to define the initial stresses for the model, taking into account the loading history of the soil. 
  * Field stress (2)  This calculation type can be used to set up a homogeneous initial stress state in the model, taking into account a rotation of principal stresses. 
  * Gravity loading (3)  The phase will be calculated using a plastic calculation, in which initial stresses are generated based on the volumetric weight of the soil. 
  * Flow only (9)  The phase will be calculated using no effective stresses. The pore pressure calculation type needs to be defined for the flow calculation. 
  * For the non initial phases: 
  * Plastic (4)  The phase will be calculated using an elastic-plastic deformation analysis according to small deformation theory where undrained behaviour is considered. 
  * Consolidation (6)  This calculation type can be used to analyse the development and dissipation of excess pore pressures in a saturated clay-type soil as a function of time. 
  * Safety (7)  A global safety factor will be calculated for the phase. 
  * Dynamics (8)  Dynamics analysis in the time domain. Use non-zero time interval. 
  * Fully coupled flow-deformation (10)  Time-dependent analysis of deformation and (total) pore pressures. Input of soil permeabilities is required for this calculation. It uses non-zero time interval. 
  * Dynamics with consolidation (12)  Dynamics analysis with pore pressure dissipation. Input of soil permeability required. Use non-zero time interval. 

  
LoadingType  |  Loading type  |  \-  | 

  * Staged construction  Consolidation and simultaneous loading in the sense of changing the load combination, stress state, weight, strength or stiffness of the elements, activated by changing the load and geometry configuration or pore pressure distribution by means of staged construction. 
  * Minimum excess pore pressure  Consolidation without additional loading, until all excess pore pressures have decreased below a certain minimum value, specified by the minimum pore pressure parameter. 
  * Degree of consolidation  Consolidation without additional loading, until a desired degree of consolidation, specified by the degree of consolidation parameter, is reached. 
  * Target SumMsf  Reduction of the soil and interface strength towards a target value of the total multiplier ΣMsf. The program first performs a full safety analysis until failure and then it recalculates the last step before the target value of ΣMsf in order to reach the target exactly. 
  * Incremental Multipliers  Reduction of the soil interface strength parameters by using Incremental Multipliers option. 

  
UseUpdatedMesh  |  Use updated mesh  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the use of an updated mesh. 
  * False  Disables the use of an updated mesh. 

  
MaxStepCount  |  Max step count  |  \-  |  The maximum number of steps for a phase   
SubStepCount  |  Sub step count  |  \-  |  The number of sub-steps used for a phase   
ArcLengthControl  |  Arc length control  |  \-  |  1 if arc-length control is used, 0 if not and -1 if unavailable   
MinIterations  |  Min iterations  |  \-  |  The desired minimum number of iterations. -1 if unavailable.   
MaxIterations  |  Max iterations  |  \-  |  The desired maximum number of iterations. -1 if unavailable.   
ToleratedError  |  Tolerated error  |  \-  |  The tolerated error. -1 if unavailable.   
OverRelaxation  |  Over relaxation  |  \-  |  The over relaxation factor. -1 if unavailable.   
DesignApproachID  |  Design approach ID  |  \-  |  Design approach name for materials   
Solver  |  Solver  |  \-  |  The solver used in a calculation   
MaxCores  |  Max cores  |  \-  |  The number of CPU cores used in a calculation   
UseSubspaceAccelerator  |  UseSubspaceAccelerator  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the use of subspace accelerator for the calculation. 
  * False  Disables the use of subspace accelerator for the calculation. 

  
SubspaceSize  |  SubspaceSize  |  \-  |  Value of the subspace size for subspace accelerator. Default value is 3.   
ReferenceFlowAnalysis  | Include reference flow analysis  | \-  | 

  * True  Includes a reference groundwater flow analysis. This considers a steady state ground water flow analysis. 
  * False  No steady state ground water flow analysis is included in the results. This is the default behaviour. 

  
ReferenceFlowCondition  | Reference flow condition  | \-  | When selected to include reference flow analysis (ReferenceFlowAnalysis = True), a steady state ground water flow analysis is included in the results by default.

# export ()

Exports a plot. 

## Signature
    
    
    export <path> [W H]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
path  | str  |  Save location. Location to save the plot   
W  | int  |  Width of the plot   
H  | int  |  Height of the plot   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Output  |  ObservablePlot   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Exports the last created plot to a specified location. 

_Example:_
    
    
    export Plots[-1] "C:\data\image.png"

Exports a plot to a specified location.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Exports a plot to a specified location and with a specific size. 

_Example:_
    
    
    export Plots[-1] "C:\data\image.png" 800 600

Exports a plot to a specified location with a width of 800 and a height of 600 pixels.

## GUID-13A3B1EA-7EFF-4646-840D-705BE7A4205B.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  linedrain (ldr)

Adds line drain features to lines. 

## Signature
    
    
    linedrain <line> [line]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
     line:{<startpoint> <point> <point> |  ln_obj |  polyc_obj}
    	startpoint: (x y z) | pt_obj
    	point:	{"absolute" {(x y z) | pt_obj}} | {"relative" (x y z)} | {"angles" (Ang Ang) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj }} | {"vector" (dirx diry dirz) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj}}
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [LineDrain](GUID-0E382614-6868-48F8-BFB5-682731D8188E.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point(s) for which a LineDrain object should start or end   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference, Name of the line to which a LineDrain object should be added   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which the created LineDrain should snap   
slvol_obj  | obj  | Soil volume object reference, Name of the soil volume to which the created LineDrain should snap   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference, Name of the volume to which the created line LineDrain should snap   
"absolute" | str  |  The following 2 numbers are absolute coordinates (default)   
"relative" | str  |  The following 2 numbers are coordinates are relative with respect to the previous coordinates   
"angles" | str  |  The following 2 numbers are angle (in degrees ) and vector length from the previous coordinates   
"vector" | str  |  The following 3 numbers are a vector direction (in x-, y- direction ) and a vector length   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate ("absolute"), horizontal distance ("relative") or angle ("angles")   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate ("absolute"), vertical distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
dirx  | float  |  Vector component in horizontal direction ("vector")   
diry  | float  |  Vector component in vertical direction ("vector")   
Ang  | float  | Angle of the line with respect to the xy-plane  
Len  | float  |  Vector length ("vector")   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [LineDrain](GUID-0E382614-6868-48F8-BFB5-682731D8188E.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [LineDrain](GUID-0E382614-6868-48F8-BFB5-682731D8188E.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[LineDrain](GUID-0E382614-6868-48F8-BFB5-682731D8188E.html), [Point](GUID-B66BC755-E798-4237-AA8F-FC607481D430.html), [Line](GUID-EA175FC9-E4E6-4FD3-97C0-4F1F3624D025.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds line drain features to one or more lines in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    linedrain Line_1

Adds a line drain feature to Line_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedrain (Line_6 Line 4)

Adds line drain features to Line_6 and Line_4.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedrain (1 4 0) (2 3 0)

Creates a new line between three points with coordinates (1, 4, 0) and (2, 3, 0) and adds a line drain feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedrain Point_1 Point_2 (4 5 0)

Creates a new line between Point_1, Point_2 and a point with coordinates (2, 3, 0) and adds a line drain feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedrain Polycurve_1

Adds a line drain feature to closed Polycurve_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedrain 1 2 0 "relative" 3 4 0

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 0) to another new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y-direction and 0 in the z-direction relatively to the previous point and adds a line drain feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedrain Point_1 "relative" 3 4 0 -5 -9 0 "angles" 30 45 16

Creates a line from Point_1 to a new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y-direction and 0 in the z-direction from the location of Point_1. From that new point a line is created to another new point which is -5 in the x-, -9 in the y-direction and 0 in the z-direction relatively to the previous point. From that point a new line is created which has an angle of 30 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 45 degrees with respect to the xz-plane degrees with respect to the xy-plane and a length of 16. Adds line drain features to all lines.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedrain (1 2 0) "angles" 45 50 10 "absolute" (4 5 0)

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2) which has an angle of 45 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 50 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 10. Then creates a line from the end point of the first line to a new point with coordinates (4, 5, 0) and adds line drain features to all lines.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedrain Group_1

Adds line drain features to all lines in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only lines.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds line drain features to one or more existing lines in the geometry and directly set their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    linedrain Line_1 "Behaviour" "Normal"

Adds a line drain feature to Line_1 and sets the behaviour to normal.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedrain (Line_1 Line_3) "Behaviour" "Vacuum"

Adds a line drain to Line_1 and Line_3 and sets the behaviour to vacuum for both line drains.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedrain Point_1 (5 6 0) "Behaviour" Vacuum

Creates a new line between Point_1 and a new point with coordinates (5, 6, 0), adds a line drain feature to it and sets the behaviour to vacuum.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedrain 1 2 0 "relative" 3 4 0 "h" 1.5

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2) to another new point which is 3 in the x- and 4 in the y-direction relatively to the first point, adds a line drain feature to it and sets the head to 1.5 units of length.

## See also

[line](GUID-A7671899-36CF-4CF1-B1EA-D8C754F013BB.html), [surfdrain](GUID-26106C4C-AEB9-46E5-BCEA-80917523BBF1.html)

#  getsingleresult (gsre)

Gives the result at the specified coordinate or a specific node/stress point with or without result smoothing. 

## Signature
    
    
    getsingleresult <{ph_obj | step_obj}> <ResultType> <Point> [B] [(x2 y2 z2)] 
    	Point: {pt_obj | (x1 y1 z1)}

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
ph_obj  | obj  | Phase object reference, the phase for which the calculation results should be displayed   
step_obj  | obj  | Step object reference, the step for which the calculation results should be displayed   
ResultType  | str  | Result type for which the calculation results should be displayed   
pt_obj  | obj  | Point object reference, name of the point object   
x1  | float  | x-coordinate   
y1  | float  | y-coordinate   
z1  | float  | z-coordinate   
x2  | float  | x component of vector   
y2  | float  | y component of vector   
z2  | float  | z component of vector   
B  | bool  | Boolean, enables or disables the use of result smoothing   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
\-  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Gives the result at a specific node or stress point or at a specified coordinate. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getsingleresult Phase_1 ResultTypes.Soil.Suction CN_1
    
    
    getsingleresult Phase_1 ResultTypes.Soil.Suction 0 1 7

Gives the result for suction at a specific soil node CN_1 or at specific coordinate (0 1 7) for Phase_1.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Gives the result at a specific node or stress point or at a specified coordinate with or without result smoothing. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getsingleresult Phase_1 ResultTypes.Soil.Suction CN_1 True
    
    
    getsingleresult Phase_1 ResultTypes.Soil.Suction 3 5 7 False

Gives the result for suction at a specific soil node CN_1 or at specific coordinate (0 1 7) for Phase_1 by considering the result smoothing parameter.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Gives the result at a specified coordinate with or without result smoothing along a preferred direction. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getsingleresult Phase_1 ResultTypes.Soil.Suction (3 5 7) True (1 0 0)

Gives the result for suction at a specific point (3 5 7) for Phase_1 with result smoothing in the direction of (1 0 0).

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Gives the result at a specified coordinate on the update geometry of the mesh with or without result smoothing along a preferred direction. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getsingleresult Phase_1 ResultTypes.Soil.Suction (3 5 7) True (1 0 0) True

Gives the result for suction a specific point (3 5 7) correspondent to the updated geometry of the mesh for Phase_1 with result smoothing in the direction of (1 0 0).

#  EmbeddedBeamMat

Material set that can be assigned to an embedded beam. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the embedded beam material.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the embedded beam material.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the embedded beam material.   
Identification  |  Identification  |  \-  |  Identification of the embedded beam material.   
Colour  |  Colour  |  \-  |  Colour of the embedded beam material.   
MaterialType  |  Material type  |  \-  | 

  * None  No material type selected. 
  * Elastic  Sets the embedded beam material behaviour to elastic. 
  * Elastoplastic  Sets the embedded beam material behaviour to elastic. 

  
Gamma  |  γ  |  Force/Length 3 |  Unit weight of the embedded beam material.   
DampingMethod  |  Damping method  |  \-  | 

  * Direct  Allows to specify Rayleigh alpha and beta. 
  * SDOF equivalence  Single Degree of Freedom equivalent values. 

  
RayleighAlpha  |  Rayleigh alpha  |  \-  |  Rayleigh alpha value.   
RayleighBeta  |  Rayleigh beta  |  \-  |  Rayleigh beta value.   
TargetDamping1  |  ξ 2 |  %  |  Damping target value 1.   
TargetDamping2  |  ξ 2 |  %  |  Damping target value 2.   
TargetFrequency1  |  f 1 |  Hz  |  Damping target frequency value 1.   
TargetFrequency2  |  f 2 |  Hz  |  Damping target frequency value 2.   
CrossSectionType  |  Cross section type  |  \-  | 

  * Predefined  Use one of the predefined cross section types. 
  * User-defined  Define a cross section by giving geometric values. 

  
PredefinedCrossSectionType  |  Predefined cross section type  |  \-  | 

  * Solid circular beam  Use a solid circular beam. 
  * Circular tube  Use a circular tube. 
  * Solid square beam  Use a solid square beam. 

  
Diameter  |  Diameter  |  Length  |  Diameter of a circular tube or solid circular beam.   
Thickness  |  Thickness  |  Length  |  Thickness of the wall of a circular tube.   
Width  |  Width  |  Length  |  Width of a solid square beam.   
A  |  Area  |  Length 2 |  Area of the cross-section of the embedded beam.   
I2  |  I  2 | Length 4 |  Moment of inertia of the embedded beam over the second axis.   
I3  |  I  3 | Length 4 |  Moment of inertia of the embedded beam over the third axis.   
E  |  Young's modulus  |  Force/Length 2 |  Young's modulus of the embedded beam material.   
YieldStress  |  YieldStress σ  y | Force/Length 2 |  Yield stress parameter for a beam.   
CriticalDirection  |  Critical yield local direction  | Force/Length 2 | 

  * Local direction 2  Local axis direction 2. 
  * Local direction 3  Local axis direction 3. 

  
AxialSkinResistance  |  Axial skin resistance  |  \-  | 

  * Linear  The skin resistance is linearly distributed. 
  * Multi-linear  The skin resistance is multi-linearly distributed. 
  * Layer dependent  The skin resistance is layer dependent. 

  
TSkinStartMax  |  Max skin resistance start value  |  Force/Length  |  Max skin resistance value at the start of the embedded beam.   
TSkinEndMax  |  Max skin resistance end value  |  Force/Length  |  Max skin resistance value at the end of the embedded beam.   
MultiLinearAxialSkinResistance  |  Axial skin resistance multi linear  |  \-  |  Table showing variation of axial skin resistance with length for the embedded beam.   
TMax  |  Max skin resistance value layer dependent  |  Force/Length  |  Max skin resistance value for the layer dependent option of the embedded beam.   
Tmax  |  Max skin resistance value layer dependent  |  Force/Length  |  Max skin resistance value for the layer dependent option of the embedded beam.   
Fmax  |  F max base resistance  |  Force  |  Maximum force allowed at the base of the embedded beam.

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

#  __exportparaview ()

Tests the export of Output data to ParaView application. 

## Signature
    
    
    __exportparaview <Dir> <Opt> <Database>
    	Opt: "all" | "meshonly" | "meshentities"

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
Dir  | str  |  Directory in which the files should be exported   
Opt  | str  |  Exports all data ("all"). Exports all geometry that is activated or deactivated in the specific phase ("meshonly"). Exports only the activated geometry in the specific phase ("meshentities").   
Database  | str  |  Directory of a custom database for debugging purposes   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Output  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Exports Output data to be imported to ParaView application. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __exportparaview "C:\PLAXIS_to_ParaView\paraview_all" "all"

Exports all data to be imported to ParaView application.

_Example:_
    
    
    __exportparaview "C:\PLAXIS_to_ParaView\paraview_meshentities" "meshentities" "D\PLAXIS_to_ParaView\database\data.db"

Exports only the geometry that is activated in the specific phase to import to ParaView application.

#  __saveobjects (__so)

Saves objects in the geometry to a file. 

## Signature
    
    
    __saveobjects <File_Ext> <File>
    	File_Ext: "step" | "brep" | "dxf"

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
"step" | str  |  Type of file extension that the objects should be saved in   
"brep" | str  |  Type of file extension that the objects should be saved in   
"dxf" | str  |  Type of file extension that the objects should be saved in   
File  | str  |  Location where the objects should be saved   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Saves the objects in the geometry to a file. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __saveobjects "step" "C:\PLAXIS3D\Objects"

Saves the objects in the geometry at location C:\PLAXIS3D\Objects in a binary format which means that every object is saved in a separate file.

#  RigidBody

Rigid body in geometry. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the rigid body.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the rigid body.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the rigid body.   
xref  |  xref  |  Length  |  xref-coordinate.   
yref  |  yref  |  Length  |  yref-coordinate.   
zref  |  zref  |  Length  |  zref-coordinate.   
Translation conditionx  |  Translation condition x |  \-  | 

  * Force  The translation condition in the x direction is set to force. 
  * Displacement  The translation condition in the x direction is set to displacement. 

  
Translation conditiony  |  Translation condition y |  \-  | 

  * Force  The translation condition in the y direction is set to force. 
  * Displacement  The translation condition in the y direction is set to displacement. 

  
Translation conditionz  |  Translation condition z |  \-  | 

  * Force  The translation condition in the z direction is set to force. 
  * Displacement  The translation condition in the z direction is set to displacement. 

  
Rotation conditionx  |  Rotation condition x |  \-  | 

  * Moment  The rotation condition in the x direction is set to moment. 
  * Rotation  The rotation condition in the x direction is set to rotation. 

  
Rotation conditiony  |  Rotation condition y |  \-  | 

  * Moment  The rotation condition in the y direction is set to moment. 
  * Rotation  The rotation condition in the y direction is set to rotation. 

  
Rotation conditionz  |  Rotation condition z |  \-  | 

  * Moment  The rotation condition in the z direction is set to moment. 
  * Rotation  The rotation condition in the z direction is set to rotation. 

  
Ux  |  u x |  Length  |  Total displacement in x direction   
Uy  |  u y |  Length  |  Total displacement in y direction   
Uz  |  u z |  Length  |  Total displacement in z direction   
Fx  |  Fx  |  Force  |  Point load in the x direction   
Fy  |  Fy  |  Force  |  Point load in the y direction   
Fz  |  Fz  |  Force  |  Point load in the z direction   
Mx  |  Mx  |  Force·Length  |  Bending moment around x axis   
My  |  My  |  Force·Length  |  Bending moment around y axis   
Mz  |  Mz  |  Force·Length  |  Bending moment around z axis   
phix  |  φ x |  °  |  X-component of the rotation angle for the rigid body when the rotation condition is set to rotation   
phiy  |  φ y |  °  |  Y-component of the rotation angle for the rigid body when the rotation condition is set to rotation   
phiz  |  φ z |  °  |  Z-component of the rotation angle for the rigid body when the rotation condition is set to rotation   
Multiplierx  |  Multiplier x |  °  |  X-component of the multiplier   
Multipliery  |  Multiplier y |  °  |  Y-component of the multiplier   
Multiplierz  |  Multiplier z |  °  |  Z-component of the multiplier

#  SurfaceGWFlowBC

Surface groundwater flow boundary condition of a surface. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the surface groundwater flow boundary condition.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the surface groundwater flow boundary condition.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the surface groundwater flow boundary condition.   
Parent  |  Parent  |  \-  |  Name of the surface where the surface groundwater flow boundary condition is applied to.   
Behaviour  |  Behaviour  |  \-  | 

  * Seepage  Allows groundwater flow through this boundary. 
  * Closed  Prevents groundwater flow through this boundary. 
  * Head  Prescribes a certain head in this boundary. 
  * Inflow  Allows inflow through this boundary. 
  * Outflow  Allows outflow through this boundary. 
  * Infiltration  Allows infiltration through this boundary. 
  * Constant value from previous phase  The boundary condition is set to the same value as the previous phase. 
  * Maintain function from previous phase  The boundary condition continues calculating with the same function as the previous phase. 

  
Distribution  |  Distribution  |  \-  | 

  * Constant  The distribution is set to constant. 
  * Linear  The distribution is set to linear. 

  
Time dependency  |  Time dependency  |  \-  | 

  * Constant  The time dependency is set to constant. 
  * Time dependent  The time dependency is set to time dependent. 

  
Href  |  h ref |  Length  |  Reference value of the groundwater head.   
Pref  |  p ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Reference value of the pore pressure.   
|Qref|  |  |q ref |  |  Force/Length 2 |  Absolute value of discharge when surface groundwater flow boundary condition is set to inflow or outflow.   
q_inc,z  |  q inc,z |  Length 3 /Time/Length  |  Incremental discharge when the groundwater flow boundary condition is set to inflow or outflow with linear distribution.   
psi_min  |  {ψ} min |  Length  |  The minimum head value when the groundwater flow boundary condition is set to infiltration.   
psi_max  |  {ψ} max |  Length  |  The maximum head value when the groundwater flow boundary condition is set to infiltration.   
P_ref  |  p ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Reference value of the pore pressure.   
  
## See also

[Surface](GUID-064F8245-0453-4B36-B7F1-2D912DEAF9B3.html)

#  PhasesDefinition

Phase definition feature describing sequencing for tunnels. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the phases definition feature.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the phases definition feature.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the phases definition feature.   
Parent  |  Parent  |  \-  |  Name of the parent tunnel object of the phases definition feature.   
ExcavationMethod  |  Excavation method  |  \-  | 

  * TBM  Front of the tunnel moves forward during each advancement step. 
  * NATM  Front of the tunnel can be fixed or delayed for a specified number of steps. 

  
SlicesInActiveScope  |  Slices in active scope  |  \-  |  Allows to fix the front of the tunnel for the defined number of slices while the back moves forward.   
DelayedSteps  |  Delayed steps  |  \-  |  Allows to delay the advancement from moving into the next slice for the defined number of steps.   
PhasesDefinitionNeedsRegeneration  |  Phases definition needs regeneration  |  \-  |  Internal property.

# BeamMat

Material set that can be assigned to a beam. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the beam material.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the beam material.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the beam material object.   
Identification  |  Identification  |  \-  |  Identification of the beam material.   
Colour  |  Colour  |  \-  |  Colour of the beam material.   
MaterialType  |  Material type  |  \-  | 

  * None  No material type selected. 
  * Elastic  Sets beam material behaviour to elastic. 
  * Elastoplastic  Sets beam material behaviour to elastoplastic. 

  
Gamma  |  γ  |  Force/Length 3 |  Unit weight of the embedded beam material.   
DampingMethod  |  Damping method  |  \-  | 

  * Direct  Allows to specify Rayleigh alpha and beta. 
  * SDOF equivalence  Single Degree of Freedom equivalent values. 

  
RayleighAlpha  |  Rayleigh alpha  |  \-  |  Rayleigh alpha value.   
RayleighBeta  |  Rayleigh beta  |  \-  |  Rayleigh beta value.   
TargetDamping1  |  ξ 2 |  %  |  Damping target value 1.   
TargetDamping2  |  ξ 2 |  %  |  Damping target value 2.   
TargetFrequency1  |  f 1 |  Hz  |  Damping target frequency value 1.   
TargetFrequency2  |  f 2 |  Hz  |  Damping target frequency value 2.   
CrossSectionType  |  Cross section type  |  \-  | 

  * Predefined  Use one of the predefined cross section types. 
  * User-defined  Define a cross section by giving geometric values. 

  
PredefinedCrossSectionType  |  Predefined cross section type  |  \-  | 

  * Solid circular beam  Use a solid circular beam. 
  * Circular tube  Use a circular tube. 
  * Solid rectangular beam  Use a solid rectangular beam. 

  
Diameter  |  Diameter  |  Length  |  Diameter of a circular tube or solid circular beam.   
Thickness  |  Thickness  |  Length  |  Thickness of the wall of a circular tube.   
Height  |  Height  |  Length  |  Height of a solid rectangular beam.   
Width  |  Width  |  Length  |  Width of a solid square beam.   
A  |  Area  |  Length 2 |  Area of the cross-section of the beam.   
I2  |  I 2 |  Length 4 |  Moment of inertia of the beam over the second axis.   
I3  |  I 3 |  Length 4 |  Moment of inertia of the beam over the third axis.   
E  |  Young's modulus  |  Force/Length 2 |  Young's modulus of the beam material.   
YieldStress  |  Yield Stress σ y |  Force/Length 2 |  Yield stress parameter for a beam.   
CriticalDirection  |  Critical yield local direction  |  Force/Length 2 | 

  * Local direction 2  Local axis direction 2. 
  * Local direction 3  Local axis direction 3. 

  
W2  |  W 2 |  Length 3 |  Plastic section modulus when the Yield direction is in local direction 2.   
W3  |  W 3 |  Length 3 |  Plastic section modulus when the Yield direction is in local direction 3.

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

#  filter (fi)

Filters a list of specified objects. 

## Signature
    
    
    filter <plx_obj...> [I] [I] [S]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  PLAXIS object reference, objects to be shown   
I  | int  |  Integer, start or end index of the item to be shown   
S  | str  | Specified criterion, e.g. "min" for minimum value, "max" for maximum value, "last" for last result value.   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
\-  |  Listables | PlxValues   
  
## Objects created

PlxValues 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Shows the contents of a list of objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    filter Phases

Shows all phases available for the project.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Shows the item at the specified index in a listable. 

_Example:_
    
    
    filter Phases 1

Shows the phase with the index 1.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Shows a list of objects that fulfill a specified criterion. 

_Example:_
    
    
    filter Phases 2 5

Shows the phase from the index 2 to 5.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Shows filtered results that fulfill a specified criterion. 

_Example:_
    
    
    filter Results[-1] "max"

Shows the maximum value of the lastly created results list. For example, this can follow the getresults command.

_Example:_
    
    
    filter Phases "Info.MaxCores=4"

Shows the available phases with 4 maximum cores.

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14).

#  PositiveInterface

Positive interface feature of a surface. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the positive interface.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the positive interface.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the positive interface.   
Parent  |  Parent  |  \-  |  Name of the surface where the positive interface feature is applied to.   
MaterialMode  |  Material mode  |  \-  | 

  * From adjacent soil  The positive interface uses the same material as the soil next to which it is located. 
  * Custom  The positive interface has its own material assigned. 

  
Material  |  Material  |  \-  |  Material that is assigned to the positive interface.   
ApplyStrengthReduction  |  Apply strength reduction  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the option to apply strength reduction for safety calculations that is applied to the positive interface. 
  * False  Disables the option to apply strength reduction for safety calculations that is applied to the positive interface. 

  
VirtualThicknessFactor  | Virtual thickness factor  |  \-  |  Virtual thickness factor of 0.1 is assigned to the positive by default. Value must be in between 0.1 and 1.

# gotostages (gts)

Switches to Staged construction mode. 

## Signature
    
    
    gotostages [B]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
B  | bool  |  Boolean, true creates a new intersection even if not necessary, false does not create an intersection unless necessary   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Switches from the current working mode to Staged construction mode. There has to be at least one volume or surface in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    gotostages

Switches from the current working mode to Staged construction mode.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Switches from the current working mode to Staged construction mode with the possibility to create a new intersection regardless of whether there are any geometric changes. There has to be at least one volume or surface in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    gotostages true

Switches from the current working mode to Staged construction mode and creates a new intersection.

## See also

[gotomesh](GUID-AB747571-E828-46E6-A61C-0A272607711F.html), [gotosoil](GUID-C2B37282-D2E9-4F51-98D4-A0384519D230.html), [gotostructures](GUID-2D2D4A90-8C0E-466E-B975-1D60CA11C77E.html), [gotowater](GUID-963CE5B1-B438-4646-97BF-AD5EA511D96D.html)

#  importifc ()

Imports IFC data. 

## Signature
    
    
    importifc <IFC_Obj_Type> <File> [IFC_Type]...
    	IFC_Obj_Type: object | object_combi
    		object: "point" | "polycurve" | "structuresurface" | "structurevolume" | "structures" | "soilvolume" | "soilsurfacetop" | "soilsurfacebottom"
    		object_combi: "point|polycurve" | "point|surface" | "polycurve|surface" | "point|polycurve|surface" | "point|volume" | "polycurve|volume" | "point|polycurve|volume" | "surface|volume" | "point|surface|volume" | "polycurve|surface|volume"
    	IFC_Type: "" | "ifcbeam" | "ifccolumn" | "ifcfooting" | "ifcpile" | "ifcplate" | "ifcroof" | "ifcslab" | "ifcwall" | any combination as one string

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
"point" | str  |  Imports points   
" polycurve" | str  |  Imports polycurves   
"structuresurface" | str  |  Imports structural surfaces   
"structurevolume" | str  |  Imports structural volumes   
"structures" | str  |  Imports structures   
"soilvolume" | str  |  Imports soil volumes   
"soilsurfacetop" | str  |  Imports top surface of a soil layer   
"soilsurfacebottom" | str  |  Imports bottom surface of a soil layer   
"point|polycurve" | str  |  Imports points and polygons at the same time   
"point|surface" | str  |  Imports points and surfaces at the same time   
"polycurve|surface" | str  |  Imports points, polycurves and surfaces at the same time   
"point|polycurve|surface" | str  |  Imports points, polycurves and surfaces at the same time   
"point|volume" | str  |  Imports points and volumes at the same time   
"polycurve|volume" | str  |  Imports polycurves and volumes at the same time   
"point|polycurve|volume" | str  |  Imports points, polycurves and volumes at the same time   
"surface|volume" | str  |  Imports surfaces and volumes at the same time   
"point|surface|volume" | str  |  Imports points, surfaces and volumes at the same time   
"polycurve|surface|volume" | str  |  Imports polycurves, surfaces and volumes at the same time   
File  | str  |  File name of the object that is to be imported   
"" | str  | Type of IFC data to be imported. Imports all supported IFC structures   
"ifcbeam" | str  |  Type of IFC data to be imported. Imports beams   
"ifccolumn" | str  |  Type of IFC data to be imported. Imports columns   
"ifcfooting" | str  |  Type of IFC data to be imported. Imports footings   
"ifcpile" | str  |  Type of IFC data to be imported. Imports piles   
"ifcplate" | str  |  Type of IFC data to be imported. Imports plates   
"ifcroof" | str  |  Type of IFC data to be imported. Imports roofs   
"ifcslab" | str  |  Type of IFC data to be imported. Imports slabs   
"ifcwall" | str  |  Type of IFC data to be imported. Imports walls   
"ifcslab" | str  |  Type of IFC data to be imported. Imports slabs   
"ifcwall ifcroof ifcslab" | str  | Type of IFC data to be imported. Example that imports walls, roofs and slabs at the same time   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Surface](GUID-064F8245-0453-4B36-B7F1-2D912DEAF9B3.html), [Volume](GUID-CDDE333E-8922-4FF5-B2DB-4B6B31644557.html), [Soil](GUID-12538F90-AAA2-4AE4-841C-1390CE850761.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Imports geometric information from IFC. 

_Example:_
    
    
    importifc "structures" "C:\directory\project.ifc" ""

Imports all supported IFC structures from the project.ifc file. 

_Example:_
    
    
    importifc "structures" "C:\directory\project.ifc" "ifcslab"

Imports slab structures data from the project.ifc file. 

_Example:_
    
    
    importifc "structures" "C:\directory\project.ifc" "ifcwall ifcroof ifcslab"

Imports walls, roof, and slab data from the project.ifc file. 

## See also

[import](GUID-BF60F423-93C6-4891-8BBD-6A036B1B4153.html)
