#  surfdispl (spd)

Adds prescribed displacement features to surfaces. 

## Signature
    
    
    surfdispl <surface> [surface]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
     surface: {<startpoint> <point> <point> [point]...} | polyc_obj | srf_obj}
    	startpoint: {(x y z)} | pt_obj
    	point:	{(x y z)} | pt_obj	
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [SurfaceDisplacement](GUID-61B0D548-3D3A-45CD-8F04-415AFF2A2A87.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point(s) for which a SurfaceDisplacement object should start or end   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Polycurve object reference, Name of the polycurve to which a SurfaceDisplacement object should created   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which a SurfaceDisplacement object should be added   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [SurfaceDisplacement](GUID-61B0D548-3D3A-45CD-8F04-415AFF2A2A87.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [SurfaceDisplacement](GUID-61B0D548-3D3A-45CD-8F04-415AFF2A2A87.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[SurfaceDisplacement](GUID-61B0D548-3D3A-45CD-8F04-415AFF2A2A87.html), [Surface](GUID-064F8245-0453-4B36-B7F1-2D912DEAF9B3.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds surface prescribed displacement features to one or more existing structural surfaces in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdispl Polygon_1

Adds a surface prescribed displacement feature to Polygon_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdispl Polygon_2 Polygon_3

Adds surface prescribed displacement features to Polygon_2 and Polygon_3. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdispl (Polygon_6 Polygon_4)

Adds surface prescribed displacement features to Polygon_6 and Polygon_4. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdispl Group_1

Adds surface prescribed displacement features to all structural surfaces in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only structural surfaces. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface between three or more points (which may either exist or will be created) and adds a surface prescribed displacement feature to it. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdispl Point_1 Point_2 (1 0 5)

Creates a structural surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a new point with coordinates (0, 0, 5) and adds a surface prescribed displacement feature to it. 

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface from a polycurve and adds a surface prescribed displacement feature to it. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdispl Polycurve_3

Creates a structural surface from Polycurve_3 and adds a surface prescribed displacement feature to it. 

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Adds surface prescribed displacement features to one or more existing structural surfaces in the geometry and directly sets their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdispl Polygon_1 "Displacement_x" "Fixed" "Displacement_y" "Prescribed"

Adds a surface prescribed displacement feature to Polygon_1, sets the Displacementx to "Fixed" and the Displacementy  to "Prescribed". 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdispl (Polygon_2 Polygon_3) "Displacement_x" "Fixed" "Displacement_y" "Prescribed"

Adds surface prescribed displacement features to Polygon_2 and Polygon_3, sets the Displacementx to "Fixed" and the Displacementy to "Prescribed" for both surface prescribed displacements. 

## Alternative 5

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface between three or more points (which may either exist or will be created) or a polycurve, adds a surface prescribed displacement feature to it and directly sets its properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdispl Point_1 Point_2 (1 0 5) "Displacement_x" "Fixed" "Displacement_y" "Prescribed"

Creates a structural surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a new point with coordinates (1, 0, 5), adds a surface prescribed displacement feature to it, sets the Displacementx to "Fixed" and the Displacementy to "Prescribed". 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdispl Polycurve_8 "Displacement_x" "Fixed" "Displacement_y" "Prescribed"

Creates a structural surface from Polycurve_8, adds a surface prescribed displacement feature to it, sets the Displacementx to "Fixed" and the Displacementy to "Prescribed". 

## See also

## GUID-2480B8E0-547B-4F67-A6EA-3DA0649F7C30.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  rotateline (rotl)

Rotates objects around a line. 

## Signature
    
    
    rotateline <plx_obj>... <points | ln_obj> <Ang>
    	plx_obj: point | ln_obj | polyc_obj | tnl_obj | srf_obj | vol_obj
    	points: {point point}
    		point:	{(x y z)} | pt_obj	
    

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point that should be rotated or starting|ending point of the line around which should be rotated   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference, Name of the line that should be rotated or line around which the objects should be rotated   
polyc_obj  | obj  |  Polycurve object reference, Name of the polycurve that should be rotated   
tn_obj  | obj  | Tunnel object reference, Name of the tunnel that should be rotated   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface that should be rotated   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference, Name of the volume that should be rotated   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate of starting|ending point   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate of starting|ending point   
z  | float  | z-coordinate of starting|ending point   
Ang  | float  |  Degrees of rotation   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None | Line 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Rotates one or more objects around a specified line. 

_Example:_
    
    
    rotateline (Line_1 Line_2) (4 5 6) (7 8 9) 45

Rotates Line_1 and Line_2 around an imaginary line between coordinates (4, 5, 6) respectively (7, 8, 9) with an angle of 45 degrees.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Rotates one or more objects around a specified line. 

_Example:_
    
    
    rotateline (Point_1 Points[-2]) Line_1 45

Rotates Point_1 and the penultimate point from the list of points around Line_1 with an angle of 45 degrees.

## See also

[revolve](GUID-6360FBAB-FEF9-485E-B78B-389597D4A78B.html), [rotate](GUID-69B3BEEB-E27E-413B-A884-62F9AD4BA5A2.html)

**Parent topic:** [ Input commands reference ](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html)

## GUID-24A1FE60-435E-48CE-90FF-9355CD8EF775.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  filter (fi)

Displays a list of specified objects. 

## Signature
    
    
    filter <OptA> | <OptB> | <OptC>
    	OptA: {<plx_obj>... [Index] [SubList_Len]} | {<plx_obj>... [Criterion]} 
    	OptB: {<sc_Option> <ph_obj> [Index] [SubList_Len]} | {<sc_Option> <ph_obj> [Criterion]}
    	OptC: {<sc_feat> <ph_Option> [Index] [SubList_Len]} | {<sc_feat> <ph_Option> [Criterion]}
    		sc_Option: <sc_obj>... | <sc_feat_list> 
    		ph_Option: {<ph_obj> <ph_obj>...} | <ph_obj_list 

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  Objects to be displayed   
Index  | int  |  Number of the object that should be displayed or number of the starting object. The numbering of objects is 0-based, so the first object has number 0.   
Criterion  | str  |  Criterion that the objects that should be displayed have to fulfill   
sc_feat  | obj  |  List of the staged construction features from which the features should be displayed   
sc_feat_list  | list  |  The name of the staged construction features list from which the features should be displayed   
ph_obj  | obj  |  Name of the phase from which the features should be displayed   
ph_obj_list  | list  |  The name of the phase list from which the features should be displayed   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays a list of specified objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    filter Lines

Displays a list of line objects.

_Example:_
    
    
    filter Phases

Displays a list of phases.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Displays an object with a specified index from a list of objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    filter Lines 2

Displays the line at index 2 from the list of lines.

_Example:_
    
    
    filter Phases 3

Displays the phase at index 3 from the list of phases.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Displays a number of objects from a specified list of objects starting from a specified object. 

_Example:_
    
    
    filter Line_1 Line_3 Line_4 Line_6 2 5

Displays five lines from the list of lines starting from the line at index 2.

_Example:_
    
    
    filter Lines 2 5

Displays five lines from the list of lines starting from the line at index 2.

_Example:_
    
    
    filter Phases 1 4

Displays four phases from the list of phases starting from the phase at index 1.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Displays a list of objects that fulfill a specified criterion. 

_Example:_
    
    
    filter Points "x<2"

Displays a list of all points that have an x-coordinate with a value lesser than 2.

_Example:_
    
    
    filter Lines "Length<=1"

Displays a list of all lines that have a length less or equal to 1.

_Example:_
    
    
    filter Plates "Material!="

Displays a list of all plates that have a material assigned to them.

_Example:_
    
    
    filter Materials "SoilMat"

Displays a list of all soil materials.

_Example:_
    
    
    filter Lines "LineLoad<>"

Displays a list of all lines that have a line load assigned to them.

_Example:_
    
    
    filter Phases "ShouldCalculate=False"

Displays a list of all phases that are not to be calculated.

## Alternative 5

_Purpose:_

Displays a list of specified staged construction features in a specified phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    filter EmbeddedBeam_2_1 EmbeddedBeam_1_1 Phase_2

Displays a list of embedded beams that are in Phase_2.

## Alternative 6

_Purpose:_

Displays a list of staged construction features at a specified index in a specified phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    filter (EmbeddedBeam_2_1 EmbeddedBeam_1_1) Phase_1 0

Displays the embedded beams at index 0 from the specified list of embedded beams that are in Phase_1.

## Alternative 7

_Purpose:_

Displays a specified number of staged construction features in a specified phase starting from a specified index. 

_Example:_
    
    
    filter (EmbeddedBeam_2_1 EmbeddedBeam_1_1 EmbeddedBeam_3_1 EmbeddedBeam_4_1 EmbeddedBeam_5_1 EmbeddedBeam_6_1) Phase_1 0 3

Displays three embedded beams starting from index 0 from the specified list of embedded beams that is in Phase_1.

## Alternative 8

_Purpose:_

Displays a list of staged construction features that fulfil a condition in a specified phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    filter (EmbeddedBeam_2_1 EmbeddedBeam_1_1 EmbeddedBeam_3_1 EmbeddedBeam_4_1 EmbeddedBeam_5_1 EmbeddedBeam_6_1) Phase_1 "Active=True"

Displays embedded beams from the list of embedded beams that are active in Phase_1.

## Alternative 9

_Purpose:_

Displays a list of phases, in which is the specified staged construction feature. 

_Example:_
    
    
    filter PointLoad_1_1 Phase_1 Phase_2

Displays phases, in which is PointLoad_1_1.

## Alternative 10

_Purpose:_

Displays a phase with the specified index, in which is the staged construction feature. 

_Example:_
    
    
    filter PointLoad_1_1 Phase_1 Phase_2 1

Displays a phase at index 1, in which is PointLoad_1_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    filter PointLoad_1_1 Phases 2

Displays phases, in which PointLoad_1_1 is present starting from index 2.

## Alternative 11

_Purpose:_

Displays a list of phases, in which is the staged construction feature fulfil the specified criterion. 

_Example:_
    
    
    filter PointLoad_1_1 Phase_1 Phase_2 Phase_3 Phase_4 Phase_5 0 3

Displays three phases starting from the phase at index 0, in which is PointLoad_1_1.

## Alternative 12

_Purpose:_

Displays phases, in which staged construction features fulfil the specified criterion. 

_Example:_
    
    
    filter PointLoad_1_1 Phase_1 Phase_2 Phase_3 "Active=True"

Displays phases, in which PointLoad_1_1 is active.

## See also

[count](GUID-B8D39E79-5481-4635-BA6E-4A855C509720.html), [echo](GUID-4705E5FE-361C-46CF-AD52-4B7F134430F6.html), [groupfiltered](GUID-2DC88566-CB97-4417-8D16-CA6D05A0E98C.html), [tabulate](GUID-66D40011-D90C-40FB-975C-766676D853ED.html)

#  fixedendanchor (pld)

Adds fixed-end anchor features to points. 

## Signature
    
    
    fixedendanchor <point> [point]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
    	point: (x y z) | pt_obj
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [FixedEndAnchor](GUID-7A14A89C-4203-4FC8-B749-7E92FB1EB665.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Name of the point to which a FixedEndAnchor object should be added   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [FixedEndAnchor](GUID-7A14A89C-4203-4FC8-B749-7E92FB1EB665.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [FixedEndAnchor](GUID-7A14A89C-4203-4FC8-B749-7E92FB1EB665.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[FixedEndAnchor](GUID-7A14A89C-4203-4FC8-B749-7E92FB1EB665.html), [Point](GUID-B66BC755-E798-4237-AA8F-FC607481D430.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds fixed-end anchor features to one or more existing points in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    fixedendanchor (5 6 7)

Creates a new point at (5, 6, 7) and adds a fixed-end anchor feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    fixedendanchor Point_1

Adds a fixed-end anchor feature to Point_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    fixedendanchor Point_2 Point_3

Adds fixed-end anchor features to Point_2 and Point_3. 

_Example:_
    
    
    fixedendanchor Group_1

Adds fixed-end anchor features to all points in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only points.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds fixed-end anchor features to one or more existing points in the geometry and directly set their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    fixedendanchor (5 6 7) "Direction_x" 3 "Direction_y" 7 "Direction_z" 2

Creates a new point at (5, 6, 7), adds a fixed-end anchor feature to Point_1 and sets the Direction_x to 3, the Direction_y to 7 and the Direction_z to 2.

_Example:_
    
    
    fixedendanchor Point_1 "Direction_x" 3 "Direction_y" 7 "Direction_z" 2

Adds a fixed-end anchor feature to Point_1, sets the Direction_x to 3, the Direction_y to 7 and the Direction_z to 2

_Example:_
    
    
    fixedendanchor (Point_1 Point_2) "Direction_x" 3 "Direction_y" 7 "Direction_z" 2

Adds fixed-end anchor features to Point_1 and Point_2, sets the Direction_x to 3, the Direction_y to 7 and the Direction_z to 2 for both fixed-end anchors.

## See also

[point](GUID-24E81355-9B0D-4CCF-AA5B-B50FDB985916.html)

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  surfdrain (sdr)

Adds drain features to surfaces. 

## Signature
    
    
    surfdrain <surface> [surface]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
     surface: {<startpoint> <point> <point> [point]...} | polyc_obj | srf_obj}
    	startpoint: {(x y z)} | pt_obj
    	point:	{(x y z)} | pt_obj	
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [SurfaceDrain](GUID-16FE3B96-E862-4186-BD01-98CB8C557A08.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point(s) for which a SurfaceDrain object should start or end   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Polycurve object reference, Name of the polycurve to which a SurfaceDrain object should created   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which a SurfaceDrain object should be added   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [SurfaceDrain](GUID-16FE3B96-E862-4186-BD01-98CB8C557A08.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [SurfaceDrain](GUID-16FE3B96-E862-4186-BD01-98CB8C557A08.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[SurfaceDrain](GUID-16FE3B96-E862-4186-BD01-98CB8C557A08.html), [Surface](GUID-064F8245-0453-4B36-B7F1-2D912DEAF9B3.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds surface drain features to one or more existing structural surfaces in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdrain Polygon_1

Adds a surface drain feature to Polygon_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdrain Polygon_2 Polygon_3

Adds surface drain features to Polygon_2 and Polygon_3. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdrain (Polygon_6 Polygon_4)

Adds surface drain features to Polygon_6 and Polygon_4. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdrain Group 1

Adds surface drain features to all structural surfaces in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only structural surfaces. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface between three or more points (which may either exist or will be created) and adds a surface drain feature to it. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdrain Point_1 Point_2 (1 0 5)

Creates a structural surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a new point with coordinates (1, 0, 5) and adds a surface drain feature to it. 

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface from a polycurve and adds a surface drain feature to it. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdrain Polycurve_3

Creates a structural surface from Polycurve_3 and adds a surface drain feature to it. 

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface from a polycurve and adds a surface drain feature to it. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdrain Polygon_1 "h" 1.2

Adds a surface drain feature to Polygon_1 and sets the head to 1.2. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdrain (Polygon_2 Polygon_3) "h" 1.2

Adds surface drain features to Polygon_2 and Polygon_3 and sets the head to 1.2 for both surface drains. 

## Alternative 5

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface between three or more points (which may either exist or will be created), adds a surface drain feature to it and directly sets its properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdrain Point_1 Point_2 (1 0 5) "h" 1.2

Creates a structural surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a new point with coordinates (1, 0, 5), adds a surface drain feature to it and sets the head to 1.2. 

## Alternative 6

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface from a polycurve and adds a surface drain feature to it and directly sets its properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfdrain Polycurve_8 "h" 1.2

Creates a structural surface from Polycurve_8, adds a surface drain feature to it and sets the head to 1.2. 

## See also

[ __getvalue (__gv)](GUID-03C8E30A-BED2-4A3C-9DA0-234107CED2E8.html), [surface (srf)](GUID-60600C86-7D70-4160-997A-A81DB39A36DB.html)

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

#  reset ()

Clears the contents of a polycurve with the option to add one or more new sections. 

## Signature
    
    
    reset [Polycurve]...
    	Polycurve: {"line" Ang1 Len} | {"arc" Ang2 Ang3 R}

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
Ang1  | float  |  Increment of the slope of the new line section   
Ang2  | float  |  Increment of the slope of the new arc section   
Ang3  | float  | Central angle of the new arc section   
Len  | float  |  Length of the new line section   
R  | float  | Radius of the new arc section   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Polycurve   
  
## Objects created

None, Segment 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Clears the contents of a polycurve. 

_Example:_
    
    
    reset Polycurve_1

Clears the contents of Polycurve_1.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Clears the contents of a polycurve and add one or more new sections. 

_Example:_
    
    
    reset Polycurve_2 "arc" 0 45 1 "line" 90 2

Clears the contents of Polycurve_2 and adds an arc section with an increment of the slope of 0°, a central angle of 45° and a radius of 1, followed by a line section with an increment of the slope of 90° and a length of 2.

## See also

[add](GUID-AC7505C5-468F-4CD8-AA35-1914733B4B80.html), [insert](GUID-459B7791-2B87-4746-946E-511420D77945.html), [polycurve](GUID-D7BBD382-3935-4DBC-A019-11A7CE5413DB.html), [symmetricclose](GUID-BB96CF95-505C-4C0F-80FE-42752865EF4B.html), [close](GUID-C3151C98-F172-4FC6-9FF7-BA0048761D92.html), [extendtosymmetryaxis](GUID-33E3208E-1ABC-470D-949C-FDC2BBD409BE.html)

# ArcProperties

Properties describing the shape of an arc segment of a polycurve. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the arc properties.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the arc properties.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the arc properties.   
StartAngle  |  StartAngle  |  °  |  The value of the angle between the start tangent of the segment and the global tangent.   
EndAngle  |  EndAngle  |  °  |  End angle of the arc.   
ArcHeight  |  ArcHeight  |  °  |  Height of the arc.   
ArcWidth  |  ArcWidth  |  °  |  Width of the arc.   
ArcLength  |  ArcLength  |  °  |  Length of the arc.   
Parent  |  Parent  |  \-  |  The segment to which the arc properties are applied   
DirectionAngle1  |  Direction angle 1  |  °  |  Increment of the slope of the arc segment   
LocalStartPosition1  |  LocalStartPosition1  |  Length  |  Horizontal value (x-component) of the offset to begin point   
LocalStartPosition2  |  LocalStartPosition2  |  Length  |  Vertical value (y-component) of the offset to begin point   
LocalCenterPosition1  |  LocalCenterPosition1  |  Length  |  Horizontal value (x-component) of the center of the full circle that can be drawn thought the arc in the tunnel designer local space.   
LocalCenterPosition2  |  LocalCenterPosition2  |  Length  |  Vertical value (y-component) of the center of the full circle that can be drawn thought the arc in the tunnel designer local space.   
LocalEndPosition1  |  LocalEndPosition1  |  Length  |  Horizontal value (x-component) of the offset to end point   
LocalEndPosition2  |  LocalEndPosition2  |  Length  |  Vertical value (y-component) of the offset to end point   
Delta1  |  Delta1  |  °  |  The horizontal increment of the line formed by the start and end point of the segment. Δ 1 is in local polycurve space (defined by the orientation axes), not global model space.   
Delta1  |  Delta1  |  °  |  The vertical increment of the line of formed by the start and end point of the segment. Δ 1 is in local polycurve space (defined by the orientation axes), not global model space.   
Radius  |  Radius  |  \-  |  Radius of the arc segment.   
CentralAngle  |  Central angle  |  °  |  Central angle of the arc segment.   
DiscretizationAngle  |  Discretization angle  |  °  |  Upper boundary for the angle between different arc subsegments in the discretised arc.   
  
## See also

[LineProperties](GUID-F2F7D87F-C9F9-4FAE-83B7-374948FBBAED.html), [Polycurve](GUID-1CDD88A0-44E8-4D70-8502-5D3B2D1FADEB.html), [Segment](GUID-FA4769B6-2597-4755-A7B4-299E6345B4F1.html)

#  addpoint ()

Adds a new point to a polygon or water level. 

## Signature
    
    
    addpoint {<point> | [point]}... | {<point> | <x y | zref>}...
    	point:	{(x y z)} | pt_obj	

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
yref  | float  |  y-coordinate where the pore pressure is equal to zero   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
zref  | float  |  z-coordinate where the pore pressure is equal to zero   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures, Flow conditions |  Polygon, Water level   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds one new point (or more) to an existing polygon. 

_Example:_
    
    
    addpoint Polygon_1 (1 2 3)

Adds a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 3) to Polygon_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    addpoint Polygon_1 (1 2 3) (4 5 6)

Adds two new points with coordinates (1, 2, 3) and (4, 5, 6) to Polygon_1.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds one new water point (or more) to an existing water level without specifying the pinc. 

_Example:_
    
    
    addpoint UserWaterLevel_1 (1 2 3)

Adds a new point with coordinates (1, 2) and a zref of 3 to UserWaterLevel_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    addpoint UserWaterLevel_1 (1 2 3) (4 5 6)

Adds a new point with coordinates (1, 2) and a zref of 3 and a new point with coordinates (4, 5) and a zref of 6 to UserWaterLevel_1.

## See also

[deletepoint](GUID-00824185-7952-4620-8BC0-B1D81873A84F.html), [insertpoint](GUID-9B27B028-581D-442B-B2AC-F573D38FDA25.html), [movepoint](GUID-BD6D83FA-FD49-4A93-A025-081068B6A766.html)

# DiscontinuityMat

Material set assigned to a discontinuity. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the discontinuity material.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the discontinuity material.   
Identification  |  Identification  |  \-  |  Identification of the discontinuity material.   
Colour  |  Colour  |  \-  |  Colour of the discontinuity material.   
MaterialNumber  |  Identification number  |  \-  |  Identification number of the discontinuity material.   
MaterialModel  |  Material model  |  \-  | 

  * Mohr-Coulomb  Sets the discontinuity material to Mohr-Coulomb. 

  
DrainageType  |  Drainage type  |  \-  | 

  * Drained  Drained behaviour. 
  * Non-porous  Material behaviour in which pore pressures cannot occur. 

  
NormalStiffness  |  NormalStiffness, k n |  Force/Length 3 |  Elastic discontinuity normal stiffness.   
ShearStiffness  |  ShearStiffness, k s |  Force/Length 3 |  Elastic discontinuity shear stiffness.   
StrengthMethod  |  Strength method  |  \-  | 

  * Peak  Peak strength of the discontinuity. 
  * Peak and Residual  Peak strength and residual strength factor of the discontinuity. 

  
cRef  |  Cohesion, c' |  Force/Length 2 |  Cohesion of the discontinuity.   
phi  |  Friction angle, φ, phi  |  °  |  Friction angle of the discontinuity.   
psi  |  Dilatancy angle, ψ, psi  |  °  |  Dilatancy angle of the discontinuity.   
ResidualStrengthFactor  |  Residual strength factor, RSF  |  \-  |  Residual strength factor to reduce strength properties of the discontinuity.   
GapClosure  |  Consider gap closure  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables gap closure option. 
  * False  Disables gap closure option. 

  
TransmissivityPrimary  |  Transmissivity 1, T 1 |  Length 3 /Time/Length  |  Transmissivity of the discontinuity in local direction 1.   
TransmissivitySecondary  |  Transmissivity 2, T 2 |  Length 3 /Time/Length  |  Transmissivity of the discontinuity in local direction 2.

#  apply (map)

Applies a command to multiple objects at once. 

## Signature
    
    
    apply <lst_obj> <cmd> [Param]...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
lst_obj  | obj  |  Listable object reference. Name of the listable to which the command should be applied   
cmd  | str  | Command that should be applied to the listable   
Param  | any  | Parameter(s) for the command that should be applied   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
SoilTest  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Applies a command to multiple objects at once. Every time a command is applied to an object an undo-able action is created. 

_Example:_
    
    
    apply General.Phases "setproperties" "Duration" 1.5

Sets the duration of all phases in the General soil test to 1.5 units of time. 

_Example:_
    
    
    apply Oedometer.PhaseTable "setproperties" "Steps" 50

Sets the steps in the phases table in the Oedometer soil test to 50.

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  linemovement (lm)

Creates a line movement. 

## Signature
    
    
    linemovement <lnload_obj> | {<startpoint> <point>...}
    	startpoint: (x y z) | pt_obj
    	point:	{"absolute" {(x y z) | pt_obj}} | {"relative" (x y z)} | {"angles" (Ang Ang) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj }} | {"vector" (dirx diry dirz) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj}}
    

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
lnload_obj  | obj  | LineLoad object reference, Name of the line load on which the line movement should be created   
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the start or end point of the line movement or Name of the points between which the line movement should be created   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference, Name of the line to which a line movement feature should be added or Name of the line to which the created line movement should snap   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which the created line movement should snap   
slvol_obj  | obj  | Soil volume object reference, Name of the soil volume to which the created line movement should snap   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference, Name of the volume to which the created line movement should snap   
"absolute" | str  |  The following 3 numbers are absolute coordinates (default)   
"relative" | str  |  The following 3 numbers are coordinates are relative with respect to the previous coordinates   
"angles" | str  |  The following 3 numbers are angle (in degrees ) and vector length from the previous coordinates   
"vector" | str  |  The following 3 numbers are a vector direction (in x-, y- direction ) and a vector length   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or angle ("angles")   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
z  | float  | z-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
dirx  | float  |  Vector component ("vector")   
diry  | float  |  Vector component ("vector")   
dirz  | float  | Vector component ("vector")   
Ang  | float  | Angle of the line with respect to the reference axis   
Len  | float  |  Vector length ("vector")   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Movement](GUID-8287FC7A-4F2C-4B49-87A6-72E0191CD0EB.html), [Point](GUID-B66BC755-E798-4237-AA8F-FC607481D430.html), [Line](GUID-EA175FC9-E4E6-4FD3-97C0-4F1F3624D025.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds line movement features to one or more lines in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    linemovement Line_1

Adds a line movement feature to Line_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    linemovement (Line_6 Line 4)

Adds line movement features to Line_6 and Line_4.

_Example:_
    
    
    linemovement (1 4 0) (2 3 0)

Creates a new line between three points with coordinates (1, 4, 0) and (2, 3, 0) and adds a line load feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    linemovement Point_1 Point_2 (4 5 0)

Creates a new line between Point_1, Point_2 and a point with coordinates (4, 5, 0) and adds a line movement feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    linemovement Polycurve_1

Adds a line movement feature to closed Polycurve_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    linemovement 1 2 0 "relative" 3 4 0

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 0) to another new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y-direction and 0 in the z-direction relatively to the previous point and adds a line movement feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    linemovement Point_1 "relative" 3 4 0 -5 -9 0 "angles" 30 45 16

Creates a line from Point_1 to a new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y-direction and 0 in the z-direction from the location of Point_1. From that new point a line is created to another new point which is -5 in the x-, -9 in the y-direction and 0 in the z-direction relatively to the previous point. From that point a new line is created which has an angle of 30 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 45 degrees with respect to the xz-plane degrees with respect to the xy-plane and a length of 16. Adds line movement features to all lines.

_Example:_
    
    
    linemovement (1 2 0) "angles" 45 50 10 "absolute" (4 5 0)

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2) which has an angle of 45 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 50 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 10. Then creates a line from the end point of the first line to a new point with coordinates (4, 5, 0) and adds line movement features to all lines.

_Example:_
    
    
    linemovement Group_1

Adds line movement features to all structural surfaces in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only surfaces.

## See also

[line](GUID-A7671899-36CF-4CF1-B1EA-D8C754F013BB.html), [lineload](GUID-38BD79D5-EBB3-4508-AEFD-48808DAF626C.html), [movementfunction](GUID-EA735F6B-8A32-4729-9473-2D76ADB7ABEA.html)

---|---|---|---  
Name  | Name  |  \-  |  Name given to the test   
Caption  | Caption  | \-  | Caption of the test   
Behaviour  |  Behaviour  |  \-  |  Type of test - Drained or Undrained   
Consolidation  |  Consolidation  |  \-  |  Type of consolidation   
K0  |  K0  |  \-  |  K0 Value   
AbsSigyyinit  |  Initial stress |σ'| yy |  Force/Length 2 |  Absolute value of the initial effective vertical stress

ShearStrainAmplitude  |  Shear strain amplitude Δγ xy |  %  |  Shear strain amplitude

ph_obj  | obj  | Phase object reference, name of the phase in which the material should be assigned to the feature   
mat_obj  | obj  |  Material object reference, name of the material which will be assigned to the feature   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
{Soil, Structures | Mesh, Flow conditions, Staged construction}  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Assigns a material to one or more features. 

_Example:_
    
    
    setmaterial Plate_1 PlateMat2D_2

Assigns PlateMat2D_2 to Plate_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    setmaterial (Plate_6 Plate_4) PlateMat2D_3

Assigns PlateMat2D_3 to Plate_6 and Plate_4.

_Example:_
    
    
    setmaterial Group_1 PlateMat2D_5

Assigns PlateMat2D_5 to all plates in Group_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    setmaterial Soillayer_1 SoilMat_2

Assigns SoilMat_2 to Soillayer_1.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Assigns a material to one or more features in one or more phases. 

_Example:_
    
    
    setmaterial GeoGrid_1 InitialPhase GeogridMat_2

Assigns GeogridMat_2 to GeoGrid_1 in the initial phase.

_Example:_
    
    
    setmaterial (Plate_1 Plate_2) (Phase_3 Phase_4) PlateMat2D_5

Assigns PlateMat2D_5 to Plate_1 and Plate_2 in Phase_3 and Phase_4.

## GUID-2DC88566-CB97-4417-8D16-CA6D05A0E98C.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  groupfiltered (grpf)

Makes a group of one or more objects that fulfill a certain criterion. 

## Signature
    
    
    groupfiltered <OptA> | <OptB> | <OptC>
    	OptA: {<plx_obj>... [Index] [SubList_Len]} | {<plx_obj>... [Criterion]} 
    	OptB: {<sc_Option> <ph_obj> [Index] [SubList_Len]} | {<sc_Option> <ph_obj> [Criterion]}
    	OptC: {<sc_feat> <ph_Option> [Index] [SubList_Len]} | {<sc_feat> <ph_Option> [Criterion]}
    		sc_Option: <sc_obj>... | <sc_feat_list> 
    		ph_Option: {<ph_obj> <ph_obj>...} | <ph_obj_list 

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  Objects to be displayed   
Index  | int  |  Number of the object that should be grouped or number of the starting object. The numbering of objects is 0-based, so the first object has number 0.   
SubList_Len  | int  |  Number of objects that should be grouped   
Criterion  | str  |  Criterion that the objects that should be grouped have to fulfill   
sc_feat  | obj  |  List of the staged construction features from which the features should be grouped   
sc_feat_list  | list  |  The name of the staged construction features list from which the features should be grouped   
ph_obj  | obj  |  Name of the phase from which the features should be grouped   
ph_obj_list  | list  |  The name of the phase list from which the features should be grouped   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Group](GUID-EF9C50AC-FE74-4B34-9A0D-D86ECCD825E1.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Groups one or more objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered Polygon_1 Point_2 Point_3

Makes a group of Polygon_1, Point_2 and Point_3.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Groups an object with a specified index from a list of objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered Lines 2

Displays the line at index 2 from the list of lines.

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered Phases 3

Displays the phase at index 3 from the list of phases.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Groups a number of objects from a specified list of objects starting from a specified object. 

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered Lines 2 5

Groups five lines from the list of lines starting from the line at index 2.

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered Phases 1 4

Groups four phases from the list of phases starting from the phase at index 1.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Groups a list of objects that fulfill a specified criterion. 

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered Points "x<2"

Groups a list of all points that have an x-coordinate with a value lesser than 2.

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered Lines "Length<=1"

Groups a list of all lines that have a length less or equal to 1.

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered Plates "Material!="

Groups a list of all plates that have a material assigned to them.

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered Materials "SoilMat"

Groups a list of all soil materials.

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered Lines "LineLoad<>"

Groups a list of all lines that have a line load assigned to them.

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered Phases "ShouldCalculate=False"

Groups a list of all phases that are not to be calculated.

## Alternative 5

_Purpose:_

Groups a list of specified staged construction features in a specified phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered EmbeddedBeam_2_1 EmbeddedBeam_1_1 Phase_2

Groups a list of embedded beams that are in Phase_2.

## Alternative 6

_Purpose:_

Groups a list of staged construction features at a specified index in a specified phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered (EmbeddedBeam_2_1 EmbeddedBeam_1_1) Phase_1 0

Groups the embedded beams at index 0 from the specified list of embedded beams that are in Phase_1.

## Alternative 7

_Purpose:_

Groups a specified number of staged construction features in a specified phase starting from a specified index. 

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered (EmbeddedBeam_2_1 EmbeddedBeam_1_1 EmbeddedBeam_3_1 EmbeddedBeam_4_1 EmbeddedBeam_5_1 EmbeddedBeam_6_1) Phase_1 0 3

Groups three embedded beams starting from index 0 from the specified list of embedded beams that is in Phase_1.

## Alternative 8

_Purpose:_

Groups a list of staged construction features that fulfil a condition in a specified phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered (EmbeddedBeam_2_1 EmbeddedBeam_1_1 EmbeddedBeam_3_1 EmbeddedBeam_4_1 EmbeddedBeam_5_1 EmbeddedBeam_6_1) Phase_1 "Active=True"

Groups embedded beams from the list of embedded beams that are active in Phase_1.

## Alternative 9

_Purpose:_

Groups a list of phases, in which is the specified staged construction feature. 

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered PointLoad_1_1 Phase_1 Phase_2

Groups phases, in which is PointLoad_1_1.

## Alternative 10

_Purpose:_

Groups a phase with the specified index, in which is the staged construction feature. 

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered PointLoad_1_1 Phase_1 Phase_2 1

Groups a phase at index 1, in which is PointLoad_1_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered PointLoad_1_1 Phases 2

Groups phases, in which PointLoad_1_1 is present starting from index 2.

## Alternative 11

_Purpose:_

Groups a list of phases, in which is the staged construction feature fulfil the specified criterion. 

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered PointLoad_1_1 Phase_1 Phase_2 Phase_3 Phase_4 Phase_5 0 3

Groups three phases starting from the phase at index 0, in which is PointLoad_1_1.

## Alternative 12

_Purpose:_

Groups phases, in which staged construction features fulfil the specified criterion. 

_Example:_
    
    
    groupfiltered PointLoad_1_1 Phase_1 Phase_2 Phase_3 "Active=True"

Groups phases, in which PointLoad_1_1 is active.

## See also

[count](GUID-B8D39E79-5481-4635-BA6E-4A855C509720.html), [echo](GUID-4705E5FE-361C-46CF-AD52-4B7F134430F6.html), [filter](GUID-24A1FE60-435E-48CE-90FF-9355CD8EF775.html), [tabulate](GUID-66D40011-D90C-40FB-975C-766676D853ED.html)

## GUID-2E473E68-930B-47E0-8DD2-05A775E5E5F1.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  Phase

Staged construction phase. Phase features depend on the selected deformation calculation type or flow calculation type. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the phase.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the phase.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the phase.   
Number  |  Number  |  \-  |  Number of the phase.   
Identification  |  Indentification  |  \-  |  Identifier of the phase.   
PreviousPhase  |  Previous Phase  |  \-  |  The phase that will take place before this phase.   
DeformCalcType  |  Deformation Calculation Type  |  \-  | 

  * For InitialPhase: 
  * K0 procedure (1)  This calculation type can be used to define the initial stresses for the model, taking into account the loading history of the soil. 
  * Field stress (2)  This calculation type can be used to set up a homogeneous initial stress state in the model, taking into account a rotation of principal stresses. 
  * Gravity loading (3)  The phase will be calculated using a plastic calculation, in which initial stresses are generated based on the volumetric weight of the soil. 
  * Flow only (9)  The phase will be calculated using no effective stresses. The pore pressure calculation type needs to be defined for the flow calculation. 
  * For the non initial phases: 
  * Plastic (4)  The phase will be calculated using an elastic-plastic deformation analysis according to small deformation theory where undrained behaviour is considered. 
  * Consolidation (6)  This calculation type can be used to analyse the development and dissipation of excess pore pressures in a saturated clay-type soil as a function of time. 
  * Safety (7)  A global safety factor will be calculated for the phase. 
  * Dynamics (8)  Dynamics analysis in the time domain. Use non-zero time interval. 
  * Fully coupled flow-deformation (10)  Time-dependent analysis of deformation and (total) pore pressures. Input of soil permeabilities is required for this calculation. It uses non-zero time interval. 
  * Dynamics with consolidation (12)  Dynamics analysis with pore pressure dissipation. Input of soil permeability required. Use non-zero time interval. 

  
PorePresCalcType  |  Pore Pressure Calculation Type  |  \-  | 

  * Phreatic (0)  Direct generation of steady-state pore pressures from phreatic level and cluster-related conditions. 
  * Use pressures from previous phase (1)  This calculation uses steady-state pore pressures from the parent phase as input for the current deformation analysis. 
  * Steady state groundwater flow (2)  Flow calculation to determine steady-state pore pressures and phreatic level based on hydraulic conditions. Input of soil permeability is required. 
  * Transient groundwater flow (3)  Time-dependent flow calculation to determine pore pressures and phreatic level based on hydraulic conditions. Input of soil permeability is required. This type of calculation uses non-zero time interval. 

  
Solver  | Solver  | \-  | 

  * Picos  Multicore indirect 
  * Pardiso  Multicore direct 
  * Classic  Single core indirect 

  
MaxCores  |  Max cores to use  |  \-  |  Maximum number of cores that will be used during the calculation of this phase by multi-core solvers.   
UseCompressionForResultFiles  |  Use compression for result files  |  \-  | 

  * True  Compression for result files will be used. 
  * False  Compression for result files will not be used. 

  
LogInfo  |  Log information  |  \-  |  Information on the feedback given by the kernel after calculation.   
MaxStepsStored  |  Maximum steps stored  |  \-  |  Maximum number of calculation steps that will be saved.   
TimeInterval  |  Time interval  |  Time  |  Total time period considered in the current calculation phase.   
EstimatedEndTime  |  Estimated end time  |  Time  |  An estimation of the accumulated time at the end of the phase that is to be calculated.   
ShouldCalculate  |  ShouldCalculate  |  \-  | 

  * True  The phase will be calculated. 
  * False  The phase will not be calculated. 

  
CalculationResult  |  CalculationResult  |  \-  | 

  * Not calculated (0)  The phase has not been calculated yet. 
  * OK (1)  The phase has been calculated without an error. 
  * Failed (2)  The phase has been calculated, but contains an error. 

  
FirstStep  |  FirstStep  |  \-  |  Index of the first calculation step of the phase.   
LastStep  |  LastStep  |  \-  |  Index of the last calculation step of the phase.   
SpecialOption  |  SpecialOption  |  \-  |  To trigger a particular event or action at the beginning of the calculation phase based on the value of this parameter.

## GUID-2F2A1DFD-7EBE-46DB-B5F4-F7A4F17FB6D6.html

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  SoilMat

Material set that can be assigned to a soil. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the soil material.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the soil material.   
MaterialName  |  Identification  |  \-  |  Identification of the soil material.   
Colour  |  Colour  |  \-  |  Colour of the soil material.   
MaterialNumber  |  Identification number  |  \-  |  Identification number of the soil material.   
SoilModel  |  Material model  |  \-  | 

  * None  No material model is selected. 
  * Linear Elastic  Use the Linear Elastic model. This model is generally too crude to capture essential features of soil and rock behaviour, but for modelling massive structural elements and bedrock layers it tends to be appropriate. 
  * Mohr-Coulomb  Use the Mohr-Coulomb model. This model represents a 'first-order' approximation of soil or rock behaviour. 
  * Hardening Soil  Use the Hardening Soil model. This model is an advanced model for the simulation of soil behaviour. 
  * HS small  Use the Hardening Soil model with small-strain stiffness. This model is the same as the Hardening Soil model, but also accounts for the increased stiffness of soils at small strains. 
  * Soft Soil  Use the Soft Soil model. This model is a Cam-Clay type model especially meant for primary compression of near normally-consolidated clay-type soils. 
  * Soft Soil Creep  Use the Soft Soil Creep model. This model is the same as the Soft Soil model, but also accounts for viscous effects, i.e. creep and stress relaxation. 
  * Jointed Rock  Use the Jointed Rock model. This model is an anisotropic elastic-plastic model, especially meant to simulate the behaviour of rock layers involving a stratification and particular fault directions. 
  * Modified Cam-Clay  Use the Modified Cam-Clay model. This model is meant primarily for the modelling of near normally-consolidated clay-type soils. 
  * NGI-ADP  Use the NGI-ADP model. This model may be used for capacity, deformation and soil-structure interaction analyses involving undrained loading of clay. 
  * Hoek-Brown  Use the Hoek-Brown model. This model is a better non-linear approximation of the strength of rocks. It involves shear strength as well as tensile strength in a continuous formulation. 
  * Sekiguchi-Ohta Inviscid  Use the Sekiguchi-Ohta Inviscid model. This model has been developed to formulate a constitutive law for normally consolidated clay. Particular emphasis is placed on taking the effect of time and stress-induced anisotropy into consideration. 
  * Sekiguchi-Ohta Viscid  Use the Sekiguchi-Ohta Viscid model. This model has been developed to formulate a constitutive law for normally consolidated clay. Particular emphasis is placed on taking the effect of time and stress-induced anisotropy into consideration.. 
  * Concrete  Use the Concrete model. This model is an elastoplastic model for simulating the time-dependent strength and stiffness of concrete, strain hardening-softening in compression and tension as well as creep and shrinkage. 
  * UBC3D-PLM  Use the UBC3D-PLM model. This model is an effective stress elasto-plastic model which is capable of simulating the liquefaction behaviour of sands and silty sands under seismic loading. 
  * UDCAM-S  Use the UDCAM-S model. This model is an advanced model to deal with undrained soil behaviour and degradation of the strength and stiffness in cyclic loading of clay or low permeable silty soils. 
  * User-defined  Use User-defined soil models. A DLL file containing one or more user-defined soil models must be in the directory of PLAXIS 2D in order for this to work. 

  
DrainageType  |  Drainage type  |  \-  | 

  * Drained  Drained or long-term material behaviour in which stiffness and strength are defined in terms of effective properties. 
  * Undrained (A)  Undrained or short-term material behaviour in which stiffness and strength are defined in terms of effective properties. 
  * Undrained (B)  Undrained or short-term material behaviour in which stiffness is defined in terms of effective properties and strength is defined as undrained shear strength. 
  * Undrained (C)  Undrained or short-term material behaviour in which stiffness and strength are defined in terms of undrained properties. 
  * Non-porous  Material behaviour in which pore pressures cannot occur. 

  
gammaUnsat  |  γ unsat |  Force/Length 3 |  Unit soil weight above phreatic level.   
gammaSat  |  γ sat |  Force/Length 3 |  Unit soil weight below phreatic level.   
eInit  |  e init |  \-  |  Initial void ratio.   
nInit  |  n init |  \-  |  Initial porosity.   
RayleighDampingInputMethod  |  Rayleigh Damping input method  |  \-  | 

  * Direct  Allows to specify Rayleigh alpha and beta. 
  * SDOF equivalence  Single Degree of Freedom equivalent values 

  
RayleighAlpha  |  Rayleigh alpha  |  \-  |  Rayleigh alpha value.   
RayleighBeta  |  Rayleigh beta  |  \-  |  Rayleigh beta value.   
TargetDamping1  |  ξ 2 |  %  |  Damping target value 1.   
TargetDamping2  |  ξ 2 |  %  |  Damping target value 2.   
TargetFrequency1  |  f 1 |  Hz  |  Damping target frequency value 1.   
TargetFrequency2  |  f 2 |  Hz  |  Damping target frequency value 2.   
ERef  |  E ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Reference Young's modulus.   
ERef  |  E u,ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Reference Young's modulus for Undrained C.   
nu  |  ν  |  \-  |  Poisson's ratio.   
GRef  |  G ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Reference value of the shear modulus.   
EOed  |  E eod |  Force/Length 2 |  Oedometer modulus.   
EInc  |  E inc |  Force/Length 2 /Length  |  Increment of the Young's modulus.   
verticalRef  |  vertical ref |  Length  |  Reference elevation on the vertical axis above which the Young's modulus is equal to the reference value.   
Vs  |  V s |  Length/Time  |  Shear wave velocity.   
Vp  |  V p |  Length/Time  |  Compression wave velocity.   
cRef  |  c ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Reference value of the cohesion.   
sURef  |  s u,ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Reference value of the undrained shear strength for Undrained B and C.   
phi  |  φ  |  °  |  Friction angle of the soil material.   
phiU  |  φ u (phi)  |  °  |  Friction angle of the soil material for Undrained B and C.   
psi  |  ψ  |  °  |  Dilatancy angle of the soil material.   
cInc  |  c increment |  Force/Length 2 /Length  |  Increment of cohesion.   
sUInc  |  s u,inc |  Force/Length 2 /Length  |  Increment of undrained shear strength.   
TensionCutOff  |  Tension cut-off  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the use of the tension cut-off procedure. 
  * False  Disables the use of the tension cut-off procedure. 

  
TensileStrength  |  Tensile strength  |  Force/Length 2 |  Allowable tensile strength in the soil.   
E50ref  |  E 50 ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Secant stiffness in standard drained triaxial test.   
EOedRef  |  E oed ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Tangent stiffness for primary oedometer loading.   
EURRef  |  E ur ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Unloading/reloading stiffness at engineering strains.   
nuUR  |  ν  |  \-  |  Poisson's ratio for unloading/reloading.   
UseAlternatives  |  Use alternatives  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the option to define the stiffness of the soil material by giving the C c , C s and e init . 
  * False  Disables the option to define the stiffness of the soil material by giving the C c , C s and e init . 

  
Cc  |  C c |  \-  |  Compression index.   
Cs  |  C s |  \-  |  Swelling- or reloading index.   
PowerM  |  power (m)  |  \-  |  Power for stress-level dependency of stiffness.

## GUID-2F3F1340-AD8C-442C-A581-247DB883BA10.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

#  view ()

Changes the view of a plot. 

## Signature
    
    
    view <Viewpoint | Coords>
    	Viewpoint: "left" | "right" | "front" | "back" | "bottom" | "top" | "default"
    	Coords: (x y z)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
"left" | str  |  Changes view to the left view   
"right" | str  |  Changes view to the right view   
"front" | str  |  Changes view to the front view   
"back" | str  |  Changes view to the back view   
"bottom" | str  |  Changes view to the bottom view   
"top" | str  |  Changes view to the top view   
"default" | str  |  Changes view to the default view (perspective view)   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  |  z-coordinate   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Output  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Changes the view of a plot to the specified viewpoint. 

_Example:_
    
    
    view Plots[-1] "bottom"

Changes the viewpoint of the lastly created plot to the bottom view.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Changes the view of a plot to the viewpoint to make it look in the direction of the given vector. 

_Example:_
    
    
    view Plot_2 (1 0 0)

Changes the view of a plot. The view is turned along the positive x-axis.

## See also

[zoom](GUID-D699CE8E-C36D-49B5-9BF4-12C5B39B1F63.html)

# RockBoltProperties

Properties of the rock bolt assigned to a reinforcement in the Tunnel Designer tool. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the rock bolt properties.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the rock bolt properties.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the rock bolt properties.

Material  | Material  | \-  | Material assigned to the rock bolt.   
ApplyStrengthReduction  | Apply strength reduction  | \-  | 

  * True  Enables the option to apply strength reduction for safety calculations that is applied to the rock bolt. 
  * False  Disables the option to apply strength reduction for safety calculations that is applied to the rock bolt.

#  addsubcurve (asc)

Adds a sub section to a tunnel cross section. 

## Signature
    
    
    addsubcurve [Subsection]...
    	Subsection: {"Line" (x y) {Ang1 Len1}} | {"Arc" (x y) {Ang2 Ang3 Len2}} 

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
"Line" | "Arc" | obj  |  Adds a line sub section to a tunnel cross section | Adds an arc sub section to a tunnel cross section   
x  | float  |  First coordinate   
y  | float  |  Second coordinate   
Ang1  | float  |  Angle of the line with respect to the cross-section plane   
Ang2  | float  |  Starting angle of the arc with respect to the cross-section plane   
Ang3  | float  |  End angle of the arc with respect to the cross-section plane   
Len1  | float  |  Length of the line that should be created  
Len2  | float  |  Length of the arc that should be created  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Tunnel  
  
## Objects created

SubsectionPolycurve, Segment 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds a subline to a tunnel cross section. 

_Example:_
    
    
    addsubcurve Tunnel_1.crosssection

Adds a subcurve to Tunnel_1.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds a subcurve to a tunnel cross section. 

_Example:_
    
    
    addsubcurve Tunnel_1.crosssection "Line" 2 3 180 1

Adds a subline to Tunnel_1 from coordinates (2, 3), a starting angle of 180 degree and a length of 1.

_Example:_
    
    
    addsubcurve Tunnel_1.crosssection "Arc" 2 3 0 90 1

Adds a subcurve to Tunnel_1 from coordinates (2, 3), a staring angle of 0 degree, an end angle of 90 degree and a length of 1.

#  extendtosymmetryaxis (esa)

Extends a polycurve to its symmetry axis by adding a new segment. 

## Signature
    
    
    extendtosymmetryaxis
    

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

No parameters 

## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Polycurve   
  
## Objects created

[Segment](GUID-FA4769B6-2597-4755-A7B4-299E6345B4F1.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Extends a polycurve to its symmetry axis by adding a new segment. 

_Example:_
    
    
    extendtosymmetryaxis Polycurve_1

Extends Polycurve_1 to its symmetry axis by adding a new segment. If the slope at the last point of the polycurve is parallel to the local first axis of the polycurve, a line segment will be added. If the slope at the last point is not parallel to the local first axis of the polycurve, an arc segment will be added, such that the slope of the arc segment at its start is equal to the slope of the last point and such that the arc is perpendicular to the symmetry axis in their intersection.

## See also

[add](GUID-AC7505C5-468F-4CD8-AA35-1914733B4B80.html), [close](GUID-C3151C98-F172-4FC6-9FF7-BA0048761D92.html), [insert](GUID-459B7791-2B87-4746-946E-511420D77945.html), [polycurve](GUID-D7BBD382-3935-4DBC-A019-11A7CE5413DB.html), [reset](GUID-277D26FE-EB41-4B67-A841-24A92E59B22B.html), [symmetricclose](GUID-BB96CF95-505C-4C0F-80FE-42752865EF4B.html)

#  tabulate

Displays a table with specified objects and their properties. 

## Signature
    
    
    tabulate <plx_obj>... | {<plx_obj>... <Property_Description>} | {<plx_obj>... <Property_description> <Specified_condition>}

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  Objects to be displayed   
Property_Description  | str  |  The properties that should be displayed in the table, separated by spaces   
Specified_condition  | str  |  The condition that the objects that should be displayed should fulfill   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
\-  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays a table with specified objects and their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate Plots

Displays a table of properties for all plots 

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate CenterLines

Displays a table of properties for all centerlines.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate CurvePoints

Displays a table of properties for all curvepoints.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Displays a table with specified objects and some of their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate Plots "ResultType"

Displays a table of result types for all plots.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate CenterLines "CenterLineType"

Displays a table of centerlinetype for all centerlines.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate CurvePoints "x y z"

Displays a table of x, y, z-coordinates for all curvepoints.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Displays a table with specified objects that fulfill a specified condition, and some of their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate Plots "ResultType" "ScaleFactor=50"

Displays a table of result types for the plots that have a scalefactor equal to 50.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate CurvePoints "x" "Pointtype != Stress Point"

Displays a table of x-coordinates for the curve points that are not stress points.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate CurvePoints "x y z" "z<0"

Displays a table of values for x,y,z coodinates for the curvepoints that have z-coordinate smaller than 0.

## See also

[Count](GUID-E9633CA5-B47E-4E61-BB9D-015C105B6BE8.html), [Filter](GUID-1BB01B49-827D-4249-BA9C-1FB10A8A9EA7.html)

## GUID-35488379-C8B3-46FA-AE81-F92D16E949E9.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  beam (bm)

Adds beam features to lines. 

## Signature
    
    
    beam <line> [line]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
     line:{<startpoint> <point> <point> |  ln_obj |  polyc_obj}
    	startpoint: (x y z) | pt_obj
    	point:	{"absolute" {(x y z) | pt_obj}} | {"relative" (x y z)} | {"angles" (Ang Ang) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj }} | {"vector" (dirx diry dirz) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj}}
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [Beam](GUID-EF04C65E-752F-4D44-9E64-47718CA07D4F.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point(s) for which a Beam object should start or end   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference, Name of the line to which a Beam object should be added   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which the created line should snap   
slvol_obj  | obj  | Soil volume object reference, Name of the soil volume to which the created line should snap   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference, Name of the volume to which the created line should snap   
"absolute" | str  |  The following 3 numbers are absolute coordinates (default)   
"relative" | str  |  The following 3 numbers are coordinates are relative with respect to the previous coordinates   
"angles" | str  |  The following 3 numbers are angle (in degrees ) and vector length from the previous coordinates   
"vector" | str  |  The following 4 numbers are a vector direction (in x-, y-, z- direction) and a vector length   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or angle ("angles")   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
z  | float  | z-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
dirx  | float  |  Vector component ("vector")   
diry  | float  |  Vector component ("vector")   
dirz  | float  | Vector component ("vector")   
Ang  | float  | Angle of the line with respect to the reference axis   
Len  | float  |  Vector length ("vector")   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [Beam](GUID-EF04C65E-752F-4D44-9E64-47718CA07D4F.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [Beam](GUID-EF04C65E-752F-4D44-9E64-47718CA07D4F.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Point](GUID-B66BC755-E798-4237-AA8F-FC607481D430.html), [Line](GUID-EA175FC9-E4E6-4FD3-97C0-4F1F3624D025.html), [Beam](GUID-EF04C65E-752F-4D44-9E64-47718CA07D4F.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds beam features to one or more existing lines in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    beam Line_1

Adds a beam feature to Line_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    beam Line_2 Line_3

Adds beam features to Line_2 and Line_3. 

_Example:_
    
    
    beam Group_1

Adds beam features to all lines in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only lines. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a line between two or more points (which may either exist or will be created) and adds a beam feature to it. 

_Example:_
    
    
    beam (1 4 0) (6 5 8)

Creates a new line between two new points with coordinates (1, 4, 0) and (6, 5, 8) and adds a beam feature to it. 

_Example:_
    
    
    beam Point_1 (5 6 7)

Creates a new line between Point_1 and a new point with coordinates (5, 6, 7) and adds a beam feature to it. 

## Alternative 3

_Example:_
    
    
    beam Point_1 Point_4

Creates a new line between Point_1 and Point_4 and adds a beam feature to it. 

_Example:_
    
    
    beam Point_1 (5.1 6.4 7.2) Point_3

Creates two lines, one between Point_1 and a new point with coordinates (5.1, 6.4, 7.2) and one between the new point and Point_3, and adds beam features to both lines. 

_Purpose:_

Creates one or more lines by either giving absolute coordinates or relative coordinates, by giving the angles with respect to the xz- and the xy-plane and a length or a vector describing the direction and a length and adds beam features to them. 

_Example:_
    
    
    beam 1 2 0 "relative" 3 4 8

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 0) to another new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y- and 8 in the z-direction from the first point at (4, 6, 8) and adds a beam feature to it. 

_Example:_
    
    
    beam Point_1 "relative" 3 4 8 -5 -9 10 "angles" 0 30 16

Creates a line from Point_1 (1, 2, 0) to a new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y- and 8 in the z-direction from the first point at (4, 6, 8). From that new point a line is created to another new point which is -5 in the x-, -9 in the y- and 10 in the z-direction from the previous point at (-1, -3, 18). From that point a new line is created which has an angle of 0 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 30 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 16, this line ends at coordinates (12.86, -3, 26). Adds beam features to all lines. 

_Example:_
    
    
    beam (1 2 3) "angles" 45 50 10 "absolute" (4 5 6)

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 3) which has an angle of 45 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 50 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 10. Then creates a line from the end point of the first line to a new point with coordinates (4, 5, 6) and adds beam features to all lines. 

_Example:_
    
    
    beam Point_2 "angles" 90 0 Volume_1

Creates a line from Point_2 with an angle of 90 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 0 degrees with respect to the xz-plane, snaps it to Volume_1 and adds beam features to the line. 

_Example:_
    
    
    beam Point_1 "vector" 1 0 0 Volume_1

Creates a line from Point_1 with an vector of (1, 0, 0), snaps it to Volume_1 and adds beam features to the line. 

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Adds beam features to one or more existing elements (which may either exist or will be created) in the geometry and directly sets their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    beam Line_1 "Material" BeamMat_1

Adds a beam feature to Line_1 and sets the material to BeamMat_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    beam (Line_2 Line_3) "Material" BeamMat_1

Adds beam features to Line_2 and Line_3 and sets the material to BeamMat_1 for both beams. 

_Example:_
    
    
    beam Point_1 (5 6 7) "Material" BeamMat_1

Creates a new line between Point_1 and a new point with coordinates (5, 6, 7), adds a beam feature to it and sets the material to BeamMat_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    beam Point_1 (5.1 6.4 7.2) Point_3 "Material" BeamMat_1

Creates two lines, one between Point_1 and a new point with coordinates (5.1, 6.4, 7.2) and one between the new point and Point_3, adds beam features to both lines and sets the material to BeamMat_1 for both beams. 

_Example:_
    
    
    beam 1 2 0 "relative" 3 4 8 "Material" BeamMat_1

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 0) to another new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y- and 8 in the z-direction from the first point at (4, 6, 8), adds a beam feature to it and sets the material to BeamMat_1. 

## See also

[beammat (mbm)](GUID-888E671C-2959-4ABD-B91A-0CA87C384FB2.html), [ line (li)](GUID-A7671899-36CF-4CF1-B1EA-D8C754F013BB.html)

#  lineload (lld)

Adds line load features to lines. 

## Signature
    
    
    lineload  <line> [line]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
     line:{<startpoint> <point> <point> |  ln_obj |  polyc_obj}
    	startpoint: (x y z) | pt_obj
    	point:	{"absolute" {(x y z) | pt_obj}} | {"relative" (x y z)} | {"angles" (Ang Ang) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj }} | {"vector" (dirx diry dirz) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj}}
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [LineLoad](GUID-20D78942-4E8C-4133-B6CA-5056C2257417.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the start or end point of the LineLoad or Name of the points between which the LineLoad should be created   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference, Name of the line to which a LineLoad object should be added or Name of the line to which the created LineLoad should snap   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Polycurve object reference, Name of the polycurve to which a LineLoad object should be added   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which the created LineLoad should snap   
slvol_obj  | obj  | Soil volume object reference, Name of the soil volume to which the LineLoad should snap   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference, Name of the volume to which the created LineLoad should snap   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or angle ("angles")   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
z  | float  | z-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
dirx  | float  |  Vector component ("vector")   
diry  | float  |  Vector component ("vector")   
dirz  | float  | Vector component ("vector")   
Ang  | float  | Angle of the line with respect to the reference axis  
Len  | float  |  Vector length ("vector")   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [LineLoad](GUID-20D78942-4E8C-4133-B6CA-5056C2257417.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [LineLoad](GUID-20D78942-4E8C-4133-B6CA-5056C2257417.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[LineLoad](GUID-20D78942-4E8C-4133-B6CA-5056C2257417.html), [Point](GUID-B66BC755-E798-4237-AA8F-FC607481D430.html), [Line](GUID-EA175FC9-E4E6-4FD3-97C0-4F1F3624D025.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds line load features to one or more lines in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    lineload Line_1

Adds a line load feature to Line_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    lineload (Line_6 Line 4)

Adds line load features to Line_6 and Line_4.

_Example:_
    
    
    lineload (1 4 0) (2 3 0)

Creates a new line between three points with coordinates (1, 4, 0)and (2, 3, 0)  and adds a line load feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    lineload Point_1 Point_2 (4 5 0)

Creates a new line between Point_1, Point_2 and a point with coordinates (4, 5, 0) and adds a line load feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    lineload Polycurve_1

Adds a line load feature to closed Polycurve_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    lineload 1 2 0 "relative" 3 4 8

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 0) to another new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y- and 8 in the z-direction from the first point at (4, 6, 8). Creates a line from coordinates (1, 2, 0) to (4, 6, 8) and adds a line load feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    lineload Point_1 "relative" 3 4 8 -5 -9 10 "angles" 0 30 16

Creates a line from Point_1 (1, 2, 0) to a new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y-, and 8 in the z-direction from the first point at (4, 6, 8). From that new point a line is created to another new point which is -5 in the x-, -9 in the y-  and 10 in the z-direction from the previous point at (-1, -3, 18). From that point a new line is created which has an angle of 0 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 30 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 16. This line ends at coordinates (12.86, -3, 26). Adds line load features to all lines.

_Example:_
    
    
    lineload (1 2 3) "angles" 45 50 10 "absolute" (4 5 6)

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 3) which has an angle of 45 degrees with respect to the xy-plane an angle of 50 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 10. Then creates a line from the end point of the first line to a new point with coordinates (4, 5, 5) and adds line load features to all lines.

_Example:_
    
    
    lineload Group_1

Adds line load features to all structural surfaces in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only surfaces.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds line load features to one or more existing lines in the geometry and directly set their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    lineload Line_1 "qz_start" -10

Adds a line load feature to Line_1 and sets the vertical component to -10kN/m.

_Example:_
    
    
    lineload (Line_1 Line_3) "qz_start" -10

Adds a line load feature to Line_1 and Line_3 and sets vertical component to -10kN/m for both line loads.

_Example:_
    
    
    lineload Point_1 (5 6 0) "qz_start" -10

Creates a new line between Point_1 and a new point with coordinates (5, 6, 0), adds a line load feature to it and sets the vertical component to -10kN/m.

_Example:_
    
    
    lineload 1 2 0 "relative" 3 4 8 "qz_start" -10

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 0) to another new point which is 3 in the x-, and 4 in the y- and 8 in the z-direction relatively to the first point, adds a line load feature to it and vertical component to -10kN/m.

## See also

[line](GUID-A7671899-36CF-4CF1-B1EA-D8C754F013BB.html)

#  snap ()

Snaps objects with a default tolerance value of 0.001 or with an optional tolerance parameter. This command does not remove existing objects, nor creates new geometry but only adjusts the object position. The arguments are commutative, which implies that they are taken in alphabetical order for snapping despite the order of input. 

## Signature
    
    
    snap <plx_obj>... [Num]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  Object(s) used for snapping   
Num  | float  |  Tolerance for snapping   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Snaps objects with a default tolerance value of 0.001. This command does not remove existing objects, nor creates new geometry but only adjusts the object position. 

_Example:_
    
    
    snap Point_3 Point_5

Snaps Point_5 to Point_3 with a default tolerance value of 0.001. It snaps objects which are lying close to each other.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Snaps objects with a tolerance. This command does not remove existing objects, nor creates new geometry but only adjusts the object position. 

_Example:_
    
    
    snap Point_3 Point_5 0.1

Snaps Point_5 to Point_3 with a tolerance of 0.1 length unit.
