#  GeogridMat

Material set that can be assigned to a geogrid. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the geogrid material.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the geogrid material.   
Identification  |  Identification  |  \-  |  Identification of the geogrid material.

MaterialNumber  |  Identification number  |  \-  |  Identification number of the geogrid material.   
Elasticity  |  Material type  |  \-  | 

  * No material type  No material type selected 
  * Elastic  Enables elastic geogrid material behaviour. 
  * Elastoplastic  Enables elastoplastic geogrid material behaviour. 
  * Elastoplastic (N-eps)  Enables elastoplastic geogrid material behaviour based on a non-linear N-εdiagram. 
  * Visco-elastic (time-dependent)  Enables visco-elastic perfectly plastic Kelvin-Voigt geogrid material which allows for time-dependent behaviour. 

  
IsIsotropic  |  Isotropic  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables isotropic geogrid material behaviour. 
  * False  Disables isotropic geogrid material behaviour.

EA2  |  EA 2 |  Force/Length  |  The normal elastic stiffness in 2-direction.

N2eps2  |  N 2 -ε 2 |  \-  |  The N-ε diagram in 2-direction.

EA1Long  |  EA 1,long |  Force/Length  |  Elastic stiffness during initial, indefinitely, long strain increment in 1-direction.

RetardationTime  |  Retardation time  |  Force/Length  |  The time where a linear extrapolation of the initial creep rate intersects the long-term displacement line.

#  Soillayer

Soil layer. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the soil layer.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the soil layer.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the soil layer.   
Conditions  |  Conditions  |  \-  | 

  * Head  The pore pressure distribution is hydrostatic and defined by the borehole head. 
  * Hydrostatic  The pore pressure distribution is hydrostatic. 
  * Interpolate  The pore pressure distribution is linearly interpolated from the pore pressures of the adjacent soil layers. 
  * Dry  The pore pressure in the soil layer is equal to zero. 
  * User defined  The pore pressure distribution is defined manually by giving the p top and p bottom . 

  
Zones  |  zones  |  \-  |  Vertical positions of layer boundaries in the boreholes.   
GeneratedSoilPolygons  |  Generated soil polygons  |  \-  |  Includes information about pore pressure in each borehole in contact with soil layers boundaries detailing conditions, head, field data and all the soil information (material, preconsolidation, volume strain, and thermal and water conditions) per soil layer.

#  mergeequivalents (mereq)

Merges objects with a default tolerance value of 0.001 or with an optional tolerance parameter. This command removes existing objects and creates new features. The specified objects are used as initial merge set. It is possible that the merge operation will also affect objects that are directly or indirectly connected to the initial merge set (e.g., the lines connected to explicitly specified points will implicitly be taken into account during the merge operation). 

## Signature
    
    
    mergeequivalents {<obj>...} [Num]
    

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
obj  | obj  |  Objects considered in merging   
Num  | float  |  Tolerance value for merging geometry   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None | Object 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Merges objects with a default tolerance value of 0.001. This command removes existing objects and creates new features. 

_Example:_
    
    
    mergeequivalents Point_3 Point_5

Assuming that Point_3 and Point_5 are near one another, merges Point_3 and Point_5 with a default tolerance of 0.001. It deletes Point_5 with Point_3 remaining as the reference.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Merges objects with a defined tolerance of 0.1. This command removes existing objects and creates new features. 

_Example:_
    
    
    mergeequivalents Point_3 Point_5 0.1

Merges Point_3 and Point_5 with a tolerance of 0.1 length unit. It deletes Point_5 with Point_3 as the reference, if the two points are not more than 0.1 length unit apart.

## See also

[checkgeometry](GUID-C56E8871-9177-427C-A166-C2D7BADE7435.html), [snap](GUID-39377F5D-B810-400C-BCEB-8A1BC776BF8A.html), [snaplinear](GUID-A535292D-AD0B-474E-92F1-2BA80534982D.html)

#  surfload (sld)

Adds surface load features to surfaces. 

## Signature
    
    
    surfload <surface> [surface]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
     surface: {<startpoint> <point> <point> [point]...} | polyc_obj | srf_obj}
    	startpoint: {(x y z)} | pt_obj
    	point:	{(x y z)} | pt_obj	
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [SurfaceLoad](GUID-3DF815C0-00D9-4B21-8D9A-FCB4C3E603C7.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point(s) for which a SurfaceLoad object should start or end   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Polycurve object reference, Name of the polycurve to which a SurfaceLoad object should created   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which a SurfaceLoad object should be added   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [SurfaceLoad](GUID-3DF815C0-00D9-4B21-8D9A-FCB4C3E603C7.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [SurfaceLoad](GUID-3DF815C0-00D9-4B21-8D9A-FCB4C3E603C7.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[SurfaceLoad](GUID-3DF815C0-00D9-4B21-8D9A-FCB4C3E603C7.html), [Surface](GUID-064F8245-0453-4B36-B7F1-2D912DEAF9B3.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds surface load features to one or more existing structural surfaces in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfload Polygon_1

Adds a surface load feature to Polygon_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfload Polygon_2 Polygon_3

Adds surface load features to Polygon_2 and Polygon_3. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfload (Polygon_6 Polygon_4)

Adds surface load features to Polygon_6 and Polygon_4. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfload Group 1

Adds surface load features to all structural surfaces in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only structural surfaces. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface between three or more points (which may either exist or will be created) and adds a surface load feature to it. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfload Point_1 Point_2 (1 0 5)

Creates a structural surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a new point with coordinates (1, 0, 5) and adds a surface load feature to it. 

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface from a polycurve and adds a surface load feature to it. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfload Polycurve_3

Creates a structural surface from Polycurve_3 and adds a surface load feature to it. 

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface from a polycurve and adds a surface load feature to it. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfload Polygon_1 "h" 1.2

Adds a surface load feature to Polygon_1 and sets the head to 1.2. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfload (Polygon_2 Polygon_3) "h" 1.2

Adds surface load features to Polygon_2 and Polygon_3 and sets the head to 1.2 for both surface loads. 

## Alternative 5

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface between three or more points (which may either exist or will be created), adds a surface load feature to it and directly sets its properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfload Point_1 Point_2 (1 0 5) "h" 1.2

Creates a structural surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a new point with coordinates (1, 0, 5), adds a surface load feature to it and sets the head to 1.2. 

## Alternative 6

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface from a polycurve and adds a surface load feature to it and directly sets its properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfload Polycurve_8 "h" 1.2

Creates a structural surface from Polycurve_8, adds a surface load feature to it and sets the head to 1.2. 

## See also

[ __getvalue (__gv)](GUID-03C8E30A-BED2-4A3C-9DA0-234107CED2E8.html), [surface (srf)](GUID-60600C86-7D70-4160-997A-A81DB39A36DB.html)

#  fieldstress ( fs)

Assigns the field stress feature to a soil or rock cluster. 

## Signature
    
    
    fieldstress <ft_obj>... [{PropName PropValue}]...
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [ClusterFieldStress](GUID-63657463-6741-423D-8034-30B450753114.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
ft_obj  | obj  |  Soil or rock cluster to which field stress is to be assigned   
PropName  | str  |  Property name. Details on the available properties at object [ClusterFieldStress](GUID-63657463-6741-423D-8034-30B450753114.html)  
PropValue  | any  |  Property value. Details on the available properties at object [ClusterFieldStress](GUID-63657463-6741-423D-8034-30B450753114.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[ClusterFieldStress](GUID-63657463-6741-423D-8034-30B450753114.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Assigns the field stress feature to one or more soil or rock clusters. 

_Example:_
    
    
    fieldstress Soil_1

Assigns the field stress feature to Soil_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    fieldstress Soil_1 Soil_3 Soil_4

Assigns the field stress feature to Soil_1, Soil_3, and Soil_4.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Assigns the field stress feature to a soil or rock cluster and assigns its properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    fieldstress Soil_1 "sig1" 10

Assigns the field stress feature to Soil_1 and updates its sigma1 property to 10.

_Example:_
    
    
    fieldstress Soil_1 Soil_2 "FieldStressType" "From model conditions"

Assigns the field stress feature to Soil_1 and Soil_2 and updates its field stress type property to "From model conditions".

## See also

[soillayer](GUID-B506C082-E520-4470-9193-776CDB2EA363.html)

#  SurfaceLoad

Surface load feature of a surface. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the surface load.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the surface load.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the surface load.   
Parent  |  Parent  |  \-  |  Name of the surface where the surface load feature is applied to.   
Distribution  |  Distribution  |  \-  | 

  * Uniform  The surface load value is constant over the entire surface. 
  * x-aligned increment  The surface load value changes linearly along the x-axis. 
  * y-aligned increment  The surface load value changes linearly along the y-axis. 
  * z-aligned increment  The surface load value changes linearly along the z-axis. 
  * Vector-aligned increment  The surface load value changes linearly along a vector. 
  * Free increment  The surface load value changes linearly along all axes. 
  * Perpendicular  The surface load is perpendicular to the surface. 
  * Perpendicular, vertical increment  The surface load is perpendicular to the surface and changes along the z-axis. 

  
sign_ref  |  σ n,ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Component of the load perpendicular to the surface.   
sign_inc  |  σ n,inc |  Force/Length 2 |  Increase of the component of the load perpendicular to the surface.

Vector_z  |  Vector z |  Length  |  z-component of the vector.

sigy_inc_V  |  σ y,inc,V |  Force/Length 2 |  Increment of the y-component of the load along the vector.   
sigz_inc_V  |  σ z,inc,V |  Force/Length 2 |  Increment of the z-component of the load along the vector.   
sig_inc_V  |  |σ inc,V |  |  Force/Length 2 |  Absolute increment of the load along the vector.   
sigx_inc_x  |  σ x,inc,x |  Force/Length 2 |  Increment of the x-component of the load along the x-axis.   
sigy_inc_x  |  σ y,inc,x |  Force/Length 2 |  Increment of the y-component of the load along the x-axis.   
sigz_inc_x  |  σ z,inc,x |  Force/Length 2 |  Increment of the z-component of the load along the x-axis.   
sig_inc_x  |  |σ inc,x |  |  Force/Length 2 |  Absolute increment of the load along the x-axis.   
sigx_inc_y  |  σ x,inc,y |  Force/Length 2 |  Increment of the x-component of the load along the y-axis.

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

#  checkcalculationconditions (ccc)

Performs the pre-calculation checks on conditions and settings of the defined phases. 

## Signature
    
    
    checkcalculationconditions [{ph_obj | ph_obj_lst}] [S]
    

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
ph_obj  | obj  |  Phase object reference   
ph_obj_lst  | list  |  Phase object reference list   
S  | str  |  Reported level of check, e.g. errors, warnings, hints, tips, or all   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Mesh , Flow conditions, Staged construction |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Performs the pre-calculation checks on conditions and settings of the defined phases. 

_Example:_
    
    
    checkcalculationconditions

Executes all the pre-calculation checks for all defined phases.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Performs the pre-calculation checks on conditions and settings on a specific phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    checkcalculationconditions Phase_1

Executes all the pre-calculation checks for Phase_1.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Performs the pre-calculation checks on conditions and settings of all phases but report only the errors. 

_Example:_
    
    
    checkcalculationconditions "errors"

Executes all the pre-calculation checks but report only the errors.

_Example:_
    
    
    checkcalculationconditions "warnings"

Executes all the pre-calculation checks for all phases but report only the warnings.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Performs the pre-calculation checks on conditions and settings of the phases listable. 

_Example:_
    
    
    checkcalculationconditions Phases "errors"

Executes all the pre-calculation checks for the phases listable but report only the errors.

_Example:_
    
    
    checkcalculationconditions S_Group_1 "errors"

Executes all the pre-calculation checks for a group of phases but report only the errors.

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  mesh ()

Generates a mesh. 

## Signature
    
    
    mesh mesh_param
    	
    	mesh_param: {Num_esf | Num_esf B | Num_esf B Num_emr | Num_esf B Num_emr Num_min | Num_esf B Num_emr Num_min Num_psf | Prop}
    		Prop: {PropName PropValue}...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
Num_esf  | float  |  Number. Relative element size factor   
B  | bool  |  Boolean. Enhanced mesh refinements   
Num_emr  | float  |  Number. Global EMR scale factor   
Num_min  | float  |  Number. Minimum element size factor   
Num_psf  | float  |  Number. Proximity size factor   
PropName  | str  |  Property name   
PropValue  | any  |  Property value   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Mesh |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    mesh

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with a defined relative element size factor. 

_Example:_
    
    
    mesh 0.1

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with a relative element size factor of 0.1 (this will make the element size equal to 0.1 times the length of the diagonal of the model for which a mesh will be created).

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with a defined relative element size factor and with enhanced mesh refinements (EMR). 

_Example:_
    
    
    mesh 0.1 True

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with a relative element size factor of 0.1 (this will make the element size equal to 0.1 times the length of the diagonal of the model for which a mesh will be created) and the enhanced mesh refinements (EMR) is set to true.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with a defined relative element size factor and with enhanced mesh refinements (EMR). 

_Example:_
    
    
    mesh 0.1 True 1.2

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with a relative element size factor of 0.075, EMR is set to true, and global EMR scale factor equal to 1.2

## Alternative 5

_Purpose:_

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with a defined relative element size factor, enhanced mesh refinements (EMR), global EMR scale factor, minimum size factor, and proximity size factor. 

_Example:_
    
    
    mesh 0.1 True 1.2 0.005

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with a relative element size factor of 0.075, EMR is set to true, global EMR scale factor equal to 1.2, and minimum element size factor of 0.005

## Alternative 6

_Purpose:_

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with a defined relative element size factor, enhanced mesh refinements (EMR), global EMR scale factor, minimum size factor, and proximity size factor. 

_Example:_
    
    
    mesh 0.1 True 1.2 0.005 0.2

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with a relative element size factor of 0.075, EMR is set to true, global scale factor equal to 1.2, minimum element size factor of 0.005, and proximity size factor of 0.2.

## Alternative 7

_Purpose:_

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with specified element dimension, enhanced mesh refinements, global scale factor, minimum size factor, and proximity size factor. 

_Example:_
    
    
    mesh "Coarseness" 0.05 "MaxCPUs" "UseEnhancedRefinements" True "EMRGlobalScale" 1.2 "EMRMinElementSize" 0.005 "UseSweptMeshing" True

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with a relative element size factor of 0.05, enhanced mesh refinements set to true, global scale factor equal to 1.2, minimum element size factor of 0.005, and swept meshing set to true.

_Example:_
    
    
    mesh "UseSweptMeshing" True

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with swept meshing set to true.

## See also

#  Polygon

Polygon object in the geometry. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the polygon.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the polygon.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the polygon.   
BoundingBox  |  Bounding box  |  \-  |  Coordinates of the diagonal defining the bounding box for the polygon.   
x  |  x  |  Length  |  x-coordinate.   
y  |  y  |  Length  |  y-coordinate.   
z  |  z  |  Length  |  z-coordinate.   
AxisFunction  |  AxisFunction  |  \-  | 

  * Automatic  The first, second and third axis of the local coordinate system of the polygon are defined automatically. The first axis is according to the global coordinate system and lies with the second axis in the plane of the polygon. The third axis is perpendicular to the plane of the polygon. 
  * Manual  The first axis of the local coordinate system of the polygon is defined manually, the third axis is perpendicular to the plane of the polygon and the second axis is determined automatically from the first- and third axis.

    	point:	{"absolute" {(x y z) | pt_obj}} | {"relative" (x y z)} | {"angles" (Ang Ang) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj }} | {"vector" (dirx diry dirz) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj}}
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [Cable](GUID-4B03E231-64DC-427D-B728-E9EDE4ADA546.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, point name   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference, Name of the line to which a another line feature should be added   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which a line feature should be added   
slvol_obj  | obj  | Soil volume object reference, Name of the soil volume to which a line feature should be added   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference, Name of the volume to which a line feature should be added   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or angle ("angles")   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
z  | float  | z-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
dirx  | float  |  Vector component ("vector")   
diry  | float  |  Vector component ("vector")   
dirz  | float  | Vector component ("vector")   
Ang  | float  | Angle of the line with respect to the reference axis  
Len  | float  |  Vector length ("vector")   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Cable](GUID-4B03E231-64DC-427D-B728-E9EDE4ADA546.html), [Point](GUID-B66BC755-E798-4237-AA8F-FC607481D430.html), [Line](GUID-EA175FC9-E4E6-4FD3-97C0-4F1F3624D025.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds cable features to one or more lines in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    cable Line_1

Adds a cable feature to Line_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    cable (Line_6 Line 4)

Adds cable features to Line_6 and Line_4.

_Example:_
    
    
    cable (1 4 0) (2 3 0)

Creates a new line between three points with coordinates (1, 4, 0)and (2, 3, 0)  and adds a cable feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    cable Point_1 Point_2 (4 5 0)

Creates a new line between Point_1, Point_2 and a point with coordinates (4, 5, 0) and adds a cable feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    cable Polycurve_1

Adds a cable feature to closed Polycurve_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    cable 1 2 0 "relative" 3 4 8

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 0) to another new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y- and 8 in the z-direction from the first point at (4, 6, 8). Creates a line from coordinates (1, 2, 0) to (4, 6, 8) and adds a cable feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    cable Point_1 "relative" 3 4 8 -5 -9 10 "angles" 0 30 16

Creates a line from Point_1 (1, 2, 0) to a new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y-, and 8 in the z-direction from the first point at (4, 6, 8). From that new point a line is created to another new point which is -5 in the x-, -9 in the y-  and 10 in the z-direction from the previous point at (-1, -3, 18). From that point a new line is created which has an angle of 0 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 30 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 16. This line ends at coordinates (12.86, -3, 26). Adds cable features to all lines.

_Example:_
    
    
    cable (1 2 3) "angles" 45 50 10 "absolute" (4 5 6)

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 3) which has an angle of 45 degrees with respect to the xy-plane an angle of 50 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 10. Then creates a line from the end point of the first line to a new point with coordinates (4, 5, 5) and adds cable features to all lines.

_Example:_
    
    
    cable Group_1

Adds cable features to all structural surfaces in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only surfaces.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds cable features to one or more existing lines in the geometry and directly set their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    cable Line_1 "Material" Cable

Adds a cable bolt feature to Line_1 and sets the material to Cable.

_Example:_
    
    
    cable (Line_1 Line_3) "Material" Cable

Adds a cable feature to Line_1 and Line_3 and sets the material to Cable for both embedded beams.

_Example:_
    
    
    cable Point_1 (5 6 0) "Material" Cable

Creates a new line between Point_1 and a new point with coordinates (5, 6, 0), adds a cable feature to it and sets the material to Cable.

_Example:_
    
    
    cable 1 2 0 "relative" 3 4 8 "Material" Cable

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 0) to another new point which is 3 in the x-, and 4 in the y- and 8 in the z-direction relatively to the first point, adds a cable feature to it and sets the material to Cable.

[line](GUID-A7671899-36CF-4CF1-B1EA-D8C754F013BB.html), [cablemat](GUID-B472969E-8F0B-4810-AB61-CF3DA4BC4C20.html)

#  insert ( )

Inserts a segment into a polycurve or a row into an advanced table. 

## Signature
    
    
    insert <seg_id> | {<seg_id> <Segment>}...
    	Segment: {<"Line"> <Ang> <Len>}... | {<"Arc"> <Ang> <Ang> <R>}...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
seg_id  | int  |  Index of the section before which the line section should be inserted. The numbering of sections is 0-based, so the first section has number 0.   
"Line" | "Arc" | str  |  Adds a line segment to the polycurve | adds an arc segment to the polycurve   
Ang  |  float  |  Increment of the slope of the new line segment   
Len  |  float  |  Length of the new line segment   
R  |  float  |  Radius of the new arc segment   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Polycurve, AdvancedTable   
  
## Objects created

[Segment](GUID-FA4769B6-2597-4755-A7B4-299E6345B4F1.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Inserts a line section with a length of 1 into a polycurve. 

_Example:_
    
    
    insert Polycurve_2 4

Inserts a line section with a length of 1 before the section at index 4 into Polycurve_2.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Inserts a section with specified properties into a polycurve. 

_Example:_
    
    
    insert Polycurve_2 4 "arc" 90 45 2

Inserts an arc section before the section at index 4 into Polycurve_2 with an increment of the slope of 90°, a central angle of 45° and a radius of 2.

_Example:_
    
    
    insert Polycurve_1 0 "line" 0 5

Inserts a line section at the start of Polycurve_1 with an increment of the slope of 0° and a length of 5..

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Inserts a row into an advanced table. 

_Example:_
    
    
    insert LoadMultiplier_1.Table 2

Inserts a row before the row at index 2 into the advanced table of LoadMultiplier_1.

## See also

[Add](GUID-AC7505C5-468F-4CD8-AA35-1914733B4B80.html), [Close](GUID-C3151C98-F172-4FC6-9FF7-BA0048761D92.html), [Extendtosymmetryaxis](GUID-33E3208E-1ABC-470D-949C-FDC2BBD409BE.html), [Polycurve](GUID-1CDD88A0-44E8-4D70-8502-5D3B2D1FADEB.html), [Reset](GUID-277D26FE-EB41-4B67-A841-24A92E59B22B.html), [Symmetricclose](GUID-BB96CF95-505C-4C0F-80FE-42752865EF4B.html)

# EmbeddedBeam

Embedded beam feature of a line. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the embedded beam.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the embedded beam.   
Parent  |  Parent  |  \-  |  Name of the line where the embedded beam feature is applied to.   
Material  |  Material  |  \-  |  Material that is assigned to the embedded beam.   
ApplyStrengthReduction  |  Apply strength reduction  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the option to apply strength reduction for safety calculations that is applied to the embedded beam. 
  * False  Disables the option to apply strength reduction for safety calculations that is applied to the embedded beam. 

  
Behavior  |  Behavior  |  \-  | 

  * Pile  The behaviour of the embedded beam is set to pile. 
  * Rock bolt  The behaviour of the embedded beam is set to rock bolt. 
  * Grout body  The behaviour of the embedded beam is set to grout body. 

  
ConnectionPoint  |  Connection point  |  \-  | 

  * Top  The connection point of the embedded beam is set to top when the behaviour of the embedded beam is set to pile. 
  * Bottom  The connection point of the embedded beam is set to bottom when the behaviour of the embedded beam is set to pile. 
  * First  The connection point of the embedded beam is set to first when the behaviour of the embedded beam is a rock bolt. 
  * Second  The connection point of the embedded beam is set to second when the behaviour of the embedded beam is a rock bolt. 

  
Connection  |  Connection  |  \-  | 

  * Rigid  The connection of the embedded beam is set to rigid. 
  * Hinged  The connection of the embedded beam is set to hinged. 
  * Free  The connection of the embedded beam is set to free. 

  
  
## See also

[EmbeddedBeamMat](GUID-15B679F7-7588-43C8-A9AB-F1B127AE8185.html)

#  __dumpdisplacements ( __ddp)

Displays a list of all prescribed displacements. 

## Signature
    
    
    __dumpdisplacements <ph_obj | step_obj> [Opt]
    	Opt: (x y z) | Criterion 
    		Criterion: {"position" | "displacement" | "reaction force"} | Combination

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
ph_obj  | obj  |  The phase for which the prescribed displacements should be displayed   
step_obj  | obj  |  The step for which the prescribed displacements should be displayed   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
Criterion | Combination  | str  |  Position, displacement or reaction force or combination of these   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Output  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays a list of all prescribed displacements. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __dumpdisplacements Phase_1

Displays a list of all prescribed displacements for Phase_1.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Displays a list of all prescribed displacements for a phase at specific coordinates. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __dumpdisplacements Phase_7 (0 0 0)

Displays a list of all prescribed displacements for Phase_7 at (0 0 0).

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Displays a list of all prescribed displacements for a phase with a specific criterion such as position, displacement or reaction force. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __dumpdisplacements Phase_7 'position' 'displacement'

Displays a list of all prescribed displacements for Phase_7 for each position.

## See also

[echo](GUID-44A4889C-A78D-417E-A303-9A6A22BF325D.html)

#  echo ()

Displays the details of an object. 

## Signature
    
    
    echo [ech_ref]
    	ech_ref: {plx_obj... | lst_obj | mat_obj ph_obj}  

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  | Object reference. Name of the object of which the details should be displayed   
lst_obj  | obj  | Listable reference. Name of the listable of which the objects are to be displayed   
mat_obj  | obj  | Material reference. Name of the material of which details are to be displayed   
ph_obj  | obj  | Phase reference. Name of the phase of which material details are to be displayed   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global | Object | Any   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays extended details of the project. 

_Example:_
    
    
    echo

Displays extended details of the project.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Displays details of an object. 

_Example:_
    
    
    echo Line_1

Displays details of Line_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    echo Line_5.Beam

Displays details of the beam feature of Line_5.

_Example:_
    
    
    echo Group_1[0]

Displays details of the first object of Group_1.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Displays details of one or more specified objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    echo (Line_1 Line_2)

Displays details of Line_1 and Line_2.

_Example:_
    
    
    echo (Point_1.x Point_2.y)

Displays the x-coordinate of Point_1 and the y-coordinate of Point_2.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Displays extended details of the material in a specified phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    echo echo Material_1 Phase_2

Displays extended details of the Material_1 in Phase_2.

# PointLoad

Result types for point load 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
X  |  X  |  Length  |  x coordinate   
Y  |  Y  |  Length  |  y coordinate

## GUID-492787DB-C493-494E-BC71-BED635E3242C.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  validate (val)

Checks the Material parameters for invalid inputs. 

## Signature
    
    
    validate <mat_obj> [type]
    	type: "errors" | "warnings" | "all"

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
mat_obj  | obj  |  Material object reference, name of material to be validated.   
"errors" | str  | Validation will only show the errors. Skipping this parameter will show both errors and warnings.   
"warnings" | str  | Validation will only show the warnings. Skipping this parameter will show both errors and warnings.   
"all" | str  | Validation will show both errors and warnings. Skipping this parameter will show both errors and warnings.   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Checks if the parameters of a material are valid, displays errors and warnings if there are any. 

_Example:_
    
    
    validate SoilMat1

Checks if the parameters of SoilMat1 are valid, and displays errors and warnings if there are any.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Checks if the parameters of a material are valid, displays only the errors if there are any. 

_Example:_
    
    
    validate Sand "errors"

Checks if the parameters of the material called Sand are valid, and displays only the errors if there are any. 

## See also

[calculate](GUID-09867FD6-35A3-4473-8D16-BCAE85CD027D.html), [phase](GUID-3B4FEA05-9544-4360-AA95-14EE8C6217DE.html), [preview](GUID-7A191525-5A12-435C-A144-420B24BCDC6C.html), [viewmesh](GUID-5F7A1A3A-170E-4EEB-A598-8B696FABF695.html)

#  Cable

Cable feature of a line. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the cable.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the cable.   
UserFeatures  | UserFeatures  | \-  | UserFeatures of the cable.   
Parent  |  Parent  |  \-  |  Name of the line where the cable feature is applied to.   
Material  |  Material  |  \-  |  Material that is assigned to the cable.   
ApplyStrengthReduction  |  Apply strength reduction  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the option to apply strength reduction for safety calculations that is applied to the cable. 
  * False  Disables the option to apply strength reduction for safety calculations that is applied to the cable. 

  
ConnectionPoint  |  Connection point  |  \-  | 

  * First  The connection point of the cable is set to first point of the geometry line. 
  * Second  The connection point of the cable is set to second point of the geometry line. 

  
Connection  |  Connection  |  \-  | 

  * Connected  The displacement at the connection point of the cable is directly coupled with the displacement of the rock/soil element in which the connection point is located. 
  * Free  The connection point of the cable is not coupled with the rock/soil element in which the cable top is located, but the interaction through the bond elements along the cable bolt's length is still present. 

  
Start  | Start  | Length  | Coordinates of the first point of the geometry line.   
AdjustPrestress  |  AdjustPrestress  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the option to adjust the prestress force that is applied to the cable. 
  * False  Disables the option to adjust the prestress force that is applied to the cable. 

  
PrestressForce  |  F prestress |  Force  |  Prestress force that is applied to the cable.

## GUID-4C2A32DC-946E-403D-9AF5-43CF9452D1B2.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  linerelative (lire)

Creates lines using relative coordinates. 

## Signature
    
    
     linerelative <startpoint> <rel_coord> [rel_coord]...
    	startpoint: {pt_obj |(x y z)}
    	rel_coord: (x y z)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference. Name of the point from which the line should start   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Point](GUID-B66BC755-E798-4237-AA8F-FC607481D430.html), [Line](GUID-EA175FC9-E4E6-4FD3-97C0-4F1F3624D025.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a line from a point (which may either exist, or will be created) to a new point by giving relative coordinates. 

_Example:_
    
    
    linerelative Point_2 (6 4 8)

Creates a line from Point_2 (1, 2, 3) to a new point which is 6 in the x-, 4 in the y- and 8 in the z-direction from Point_2 at (7, 6, 11). 

_Example:_
    
    
    linerelative Point_2 (6 4 8)(1 5 3)

Creates a line from Point_2 (1, 2, 3) to a new point which is 6 in the x-, 4 in the y- and 8 in the z-direction from Point_2 at (7, 6, 11) and a line from this point to a new point which is 1 in the x-, 5 in the y- and 3 in the z-direction from the second point at (8, 11, 14). 

## See also

[line](GUID-A7671899-36CF-4CF1-B1EA-D8C754F013BB.html), [lineangles](GUID-A23CA42A-3B0B-4A96-A368-AB9BEB3403E7.html), [lineparallel](GUID-6014A769-1016-44A3-84F8-A63B9811C37B.html), [linevector](GUID-F5C2E79F-0CA7-4C1D-80EA-1CF972932980.html)

## GUID-4D1F32CF-5EEF-4049-AD1A-C5D83F1A31F0.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  cone ()

Creates a cone. 

## Signature
    
    
    cone <BaseRadius> <Height> [TopCircleBase] [Coords]
    		Coords: (x y z) | {(x y z) (dirx diry dirz)} 

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
BaseRadius  | float  |  Desired base radius of the cone   
Height  | float  |  Desired height of the cone   
TopCircleBase  | str  |  Desired top circle base of the truncated cone   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate, center point of cone's base   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate, center point of cone's base   
z  | float  | z-coordinate, center point of cone's base   
dirx  | float  |  x-value of the vector giving the direction in which the cone should be pointing   
diry  | float  | y-value of the vector giving the direction in which the cone should be pointing   
dirz  | float  | z-value of the vector giving the direction in which the cone should be pointing   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Volume](GUID-CDDE333E-8922-4FF5-B2DB-4B6B31644557.html), [Soil](GUID-12538F90-AAA2-4AE4-841C-1390CE850761.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a cone with a specified base radius and height at the origin (0, 0, 0). 

_Example:_
    
    
    cone 2 5

Creates a cone with a base radius of 2 and a height of 5 at the origin (0, 0, 0).

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a cone with a specified base radius and height at a specified location (x, y, z). 

_Example:_
    
    
    cone 2 5 (1 2 3)

Creates a cone with a base radius of 2 and a height of 5 at coordinates (1, 2, 3).

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Creates a cone with a specified base radius and height at a specified location (x, y, z) in a specified direction described by a vector. 

_Example:_
    
    
    cone 2 5 (1 2 3) (5 7 12)

Creates a cone with a base radius of 2 and a height of 5 at coordinates (1, 2, 3) pointing in direction (5, 7, 12).

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Creates a truncated cone with a specified base radius, a specified top circle base and height at the origin (0, 0, 0). 

_Example:_
    
    
    cone 1.2 8 0.8

Creates a truncated cone with a base radius of 1.2, a specified top circle base of 0.8 and a height of 8 at the origin (0, 0, 0).

## Alternative 5

_Purpose:_

Creates a truncated cone with a specified base radius, a specified top circle base and height at a specified location (x, y, z) . 

_Example:_
    
    
    cone 1.2 8 0.8 (1 2 3)

Creates a truncated cone with a base radius of 1.2, a specified top circle base of 0.8 and a height of 8 at coordinates (1, 2, 3).

## Alternative 6

_Purpose:_

Creates a truncated cone with a specified base radius, a specified top circle base and height at a specified location (x, y, z) in a specified direction described by a vector. 

_Example:_
    
    
    cone 1.2 8 0.8 (1 2 3) (5 7 12)

Creates a truncated cone with a base radius of 1.2, a specified top circle base of 0.8 and a height of 8 at coordinates (1, 2, 3) pointing in direction (5, 7, 12).

## See also

[cuboid](GUID-BA74E3B7-898B-412C-B289-779F6CC06C81.html), [cylinder](GUID-0E0DFF88-BB0E-4010-AD68-F9C9C666293C.html)

#  pointmovement (pm)

Creates a point movement. 

## Signature
    
    
    pointmovement <ptload_obj> | point:	{(x y z)} | pt_obj	

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
ptload_obj  | obj  | PointLoad object reference, Name of the point load on which the point movement should be created   
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point from which the point movement should be created   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Point](GUID-B66BC755-E798-4237-AA8F-FC607481D430.html), [PointLoad](GUID-857F809A-D43C-4831-AE65-988AA5D3DF1A.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a point movement on a point or point load objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    pointmovement Point_3

Creates a point movement on Point_3.

_Example:_
    
    
    pointmovement Point_2 PointLoad_6 Point_3

Creates point movement objects on Point_2, PointLoad_6, and Point_3.

_Example:_
    
    
    pointmovement Group_1

Creates a point movement on points in Group_1.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a point movement with specified coordinates. 

_Example:_
    
    
    pointmovement (5 6 7)

Creates a point movement with coordinates (5, 6, 7).

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Creates two or more point movement objects with specified coordinates. 

_Example:_
    
    
    pointmovement (5 6 7) (8 9 10)

Creates two point movements with coordinates (5, 6, 7) and (8, 9, 10) respectively.

## See also

[linemovement](GUID-2BEE950A-EFB8-4D61-BFF3-9D6BFDA28207.html), [point](GUID-24E81355-9B0D-4CCF-AA5B-B50FDB985916.html), [pointload](GUID-C26C4C03-6FAB-4F64-A3E0-A9275D95B52D.html)

#  CableMat

Material set that can be assigned to a cable. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the cable material.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the cable material.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the cable material.   
Identification  |  Identification  |  \-  |  Identification of the cable material.   
Colour  |  Colour  |  \-  |  Colour of the cable material.   
MaterialType  |  Material type  |  \-  | 

  * None  No material type selected. 
  * Elastic  Sets the cable material behaviour to elastic. 
  * Elastoplastic  Sets the cable material behaviour to elastic. 

  
LSpacing  |  L spacing |  Length  |  Distance between the cables in the out-of-plane direction.   
CrossSectionType  |  Cross section type  |  \-  | 

  * Predefined  Use one of the predefined cross section types. 
  * User-defined  Define a cross section by giving geometric values. 

  
PredefinedCrossSectionType  |  Predefined cross section type  |  \-  | 

  * Solid circular beam  Use a solid circular beam. 
  * Circular tube  Use a circular tube. 

  
Diameter  |  Diameter  |  Length  |  Diameter of a circular tube or solid circular beam.   
A  |  Area  |  Length 2 |  Area of the cross-section of the cable.   
E  |  Young's modulus  |  Force/Length 2 |  Young's modulus of the cable material.   
NpComp  |  N p,comp |  Force  |  Maximum compressive axial force (without any acting bending moment) of the cable material.   
NpTens  |  N p,tens |  Force  |  Maximum tensile axial force (without any acting bending moment) of the cable material.   
KsBond  |  Shear stiffness k s |  Force/Length 2 | Stress dependent shear stiffness of the bond.   
FullyBonded  | Fully bonded  | \-  | 

  * True  No bond failure (plasticity) takes place. 
  * False  Bond failure (plasticity) can take place. 

  
BondStrengthDistribution  | Strength distribution  | \-  | 

  * Uniform  Sets the bond strength distribution to uniform. 
  * Multi-linear  Sets the bond strength distribution to multi-linear. 

  
CohesiveStrengthBond  | Cohesive strength  | Force/Length  | Bond cohesive strength   
PhiBond  | φ bond | °  | Bond friction angle   
FailureSurfacePerimeter  | Failure surface perimeter  | \-  | 

  * Predefined  The failure perimeter is calculated by default based on cable diameter, assuming that failure takes place at the cable circumference. 
  * User-defined  A value is required to directly define the failure perimeter. 

  
Perimeter  | Perimeter  | Length  | The value of the failure surface perimeter.

    __dumpbeams [B]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14).

#  activate (act)

Activates features. 

## Signature
    
    
    activate [act_obj]... <ph_obj>...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
act_obj  | obj  |  Activatable object reference. Name of the object that should be activated.   
ph_obj  | obj  | Phase reference. Name of the phase in which the object should be activated.   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Mesh, Flow conditions, Staged construction |  Activatable object | Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Activates one or more activatable objects in one or more phases. 

_Example:_
    
    
    activate (Plate_1 Plate_2) (Phase_4 Phase_5)

Activates Plate_1 and Plate_2 in Phase_4 and Phase_5.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Activates a list of objects in one or more phases. 

_Example:_
    
    
    activate Points (Phase_1 Phase_2 Phase_3)

Activates all Points in Phase_1, Phase_2 and Phase_3.

[deactivate](GUID-640035C9-DC1E-4071-BB28-3A7BC9EF68CF.html)

#  add ()

Adds a certain centerline object to a structural plot. 

## Signature
    
    
    add <plot_obj>... <cl_obj | crit_obj>

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plot_obj  | obj  |  Plot object reference, e.g., Plot_1 or Plots[-1]   
cl_obj  | obj  |  CenterLine object   
crit_obj  | obj  | Criteria object for CenterLine   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Output  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds a certain centerline criteria and centerline object to the lastly created structural plot. 

_Example:_
    
    
    add Plots[-1] CenterLines[-1]

Adds a centerline to the lastly created structural plot.

_Example:_
    
    
    add Plots[-1] CenterLineCriteriaObject_1

Adds a centerline criteria object to the lastly created structural plot. The center line needs to be detected using the generate command and then added to the plot.

## See also

[centerline](GUID-2B595D48-7D1F-4D0F-AFF6-59B451E1C90D.html), [centerlineconfig](GUID-72DEA980-1F62-4450-9922-9664B27ADA6F.html), [generate](GUID-15EEEBEB-66FB-49DE-B914-A7AEE0731B3C.html)

## GUID-578B164F-64A9-4253-AB25-E0AA306A029C.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  intersect (cut)

Intersects many objects. This is possible only with same objects, such as parametric-parametric or non-parametric-non-parametric, no mixed objects are allowed. 

## Signature
    
    
    intersect <plx_obj> <plx_obj>... [B]...
    	plx_obj: pt_obj | ln_obj | polyc_obj | surf_obj | vol_obj | slvol_obj

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point that should be intersected   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference, Name of the line that should be intersected   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface that should be intersected   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference, Name of the volume that should be intersected   
slvol_obj  | obj  | Soil volume object reference, Name of the soil volume that should be intersected   
B  | boolean  |  True enables the option to keep the original objects, False disables this option   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Point](GUID-B66BC755-E798-4237-AA8F-FC607481D430.html), [Line](GUID-EA175FC9-E4E6-4FD3-97C0-4F1F3624D025.html), [Surface](GUID-064F8245-0453-4B36-B7F1-2D912DEAF9B3.html), [Volume](GUID-CDDE333E-8922-4FF5-B2DB-4B6B31644557.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Intersects two or more objects and remove the original objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    intersect (Volume_1 Volume_2 Volume_3)

Intersects Volume_1, Volume_2 and Volume_3.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Intersects two or more objects and optionally keep the original objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    intersect (Volume_1 Volume_2 Volume_3) True

Intersects Volume_1, Volume_2 and Volume_3 and keeps the original volumes.

## See also

[combine](GUID-DA567E53-B25D-48C0-A08F-17036C9438A3.html)

**Parent topic:** [ Input commands reference ](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html)

#  Results

Contains the results of a soil lab test, e.g., echo Triaxial.Results.

---|---|---|---  
Time  |  t  |  Time  |  Current time for a specific step

#  LoftedSurface

Surface which is generated through a list of closed polycurves using the loft command. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the lofted surface.   
x  |  x  |  Length  |  x-coordinate.   
y  |  y  |  Length  |  y-coordinate.   
z  |  z  |  Length  |  z-coordinate.   
AxisFunction  |  AxisFunction  |  \-  | 

  * Automatic  The first axis of the local coordinate system of the line is in the direction of the line. The second and third axis are defined automatically according to the global coordinate system. 
  * Manual  The first axis of the local coordinate system of the line is in the direction of the line. The second axis is defined manually, the third axis is defined automatically according to the right hand rule. 

  
Status  |  Status  |  \-  |  Status of the generation process. A successfully generated lofted surface has the Status 'OK'.

#  GeogridMat

Material set that can be assigned to a geogrid. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the geogrid material.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the geogrid material.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the geogrid material.   
Identification  |  Identification  |  \-  |  Identification of the geogrid material.   
Colour  |  Colour  |  \-  |  Colour of the geogrid material.   
MaterialType  |  Material type  |  \-  | 

  * None  No material type selected. 
  * Elastic  Enables elastic geogrid material behaviour. 
  * Elastoplastic  Enables elastoplastic geogrid material behaviour. 
  * Elastoplastic (N-ε)  Enables elastoplastic geogrid material behaviour based on a non-linear N-ε diagram. 
  * Visco-elastic (time-dependent)  Enables visco-elastic perfectly plastic Kelvin-Voigt geogrid material which allows for time-dependent behaviour. 

  
IsIsotropic  |  Isotropic  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables isotropic geogrid material behaviour. 
  * False  Disables isotropic geogrid material behaviour. 

  
EA1  |  EA 1 |  Force/Length  |  The normal elastic stiffness in 1-direction.   
EA2  |  EA 2 |  Force/Length  |  The normal elastic stiffness in 2-direction.   
GA  |  GA  | Force/Length  |  In-plane shear stiffness, anisotropic behaviour.   
Np1  |  N p,1 |  Force/Length  |  The maximum force in 1-direction.   
Np2  |  N p,2 |  Force/Length  |  The maximum force in 2-direction.   
N1eps1  |  N 1 -ε 1 |  \-  |  The N-ε diagram in 1-direction.   
N2eps2  |  N 2 -ε 2 |  \-  |  The N-ε diagram in 2-direction.   
EA1Short  |  EA 1,short |  Force/Length  |  Elastic stiffness during initial, instantaneous, strain increment in 1-direction.   
EA2Short  |  EA 2,short |  Force/Length  |  Elastic stiffness during initial, instantaneous, strain increment in 2-direction.   
EA1Long  |  EA 1,long |  Force/Length  |  Elastic stiffness during initial, indefinitely, long strain increment in 1-direction.   
EA2Long  |  EA 2,long |  Force/Length  |  Elastic stiffness during initial, indefinitely, long strain increment in 2-direction.   
RetardationTime  |  Retardation time  |  Force/Length  |  The time where a linear extrapolation of the initial creep rate intersects the long-term displacement line.

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

# __predict ()

Predicts whether a command will potentially succeed or is guaranteed to fail. 

## Signature
    
    
    __predict <cmd> [Param]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
cmd  | str  |  Command name and arguments of which the outcome should be predicted   
Param  | any  | One or more parameters for the command   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Predicts whether a command will potentially succeed or is guaranteed to fail. When it fails, the reason for failure will be given. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __predict "echo"

Predicts whether the command "echo" will succeed or fail.

_Example:_
    
    
    __predict "point (1 2 3)"

Predicts whether the command and arguments "point (1 2 3)" will succeed or fail.

_Example:_
    
    
    __predict "rename Line_1 'Line_342'"

Predicts whether the command and arguments "rename Line_1 'Line_342'" will succeed or fail.

_Example:_
    
    
    __predict 'calculate'

Predicts whether 'calculate' command will succeed or not.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Predicts whether a command will potentially succeed or is guaranteed to fail. When it fails, the reason for failure will be given. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __predict 'cuboid' 5

Predicts whether creating a cuboid with faces of length 5 will succeed or not.

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
Index  | int  |  Index number of the phase to be inserted   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
SoilTest  |  Test   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Inserts a row or phase to a table in the SoilTest. 

_Example:_
    
    
    insertphase Oedometer 2

Inserts a row in the phase table of Oedometer test in index number 2. 

_Example:_
    
    
    insertphase General 1

Inserts a phase in General test in index number 1.

#  getcurveresults (gcres)

Displays results for curve points that have been previously selected. 

## Signature
    
    
    getcurveresults <{Node | lst_obj}>... <{ph_obj | step_obj}>... <ResultType> [S]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
Node  | obj  |  Preselected node for retrieving results   
lst_obj  | obj  |  List of all nodes and stress points   
ph_obj  | obj  | Phase object reference, the phase for which the calculation results should be displayed   
step_obj  | obj  | Step object reference, the step for which the calculation results should be displayed   
ResultType  | str  | Result type for which the calculation results should be displayed   
S  | str  | Text, "min" for minimum value, "max" for maximum value, "last" for last result value   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
\-  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays results for curve points that have been previously selected. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getcurveresults CurvePoints.Nodes[0] Phase_2 ResultTypes.Soil.Ux

Generates the curve results of displacement in x direction for Phase_2 for preselected soil nodes.

_Example:_
    
    
    getcurveresults CN_1 Step_4 ResultTypes.Soil.Ux

Generates the curve results of displacement in x direction for Step_4 for curve point CN_1.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Displays results for curve points that have been previously selected with minimum, maximum or last values. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getcurveresults PostCalcNodes[0] Phase_2 ResultTypes.Soil.Ux "max"

Displays results of displacement in x direction for Phase_2 for post-calc soil nodes with maximum values for selected curve points.

_Example:_
    
    
    getcurveresults CN_1 Step_4 ResultTypes.Soil.Ux "max"

Displays results of displacement in x direction for Step_4 with maximum values for curve point CN_1.

## GUID-5F2A061D-7DD7-4D52-986D-BA3F01F013AA.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  getresults (gres)

Generates a table with the calculation results. 

## Signature
    
    
    getresults [{geo | cl_obj}] [{ph_obj | step_obj}] <ResultType> [Text] [B]...
    	Text: {"node" | "stress point" | "element" | "material point"}

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
geo  | obj  |  Geometric entity, entity for which the calculation results should be displayed   
cl_obj  | obj  |  Centerline object, the centerline for which the calculation results should be displayed   
ph_obj  | obj  | Phase object reference, the phase for which the calculation results should be displayed   
step_obj  | obj  | Step object reference, the step for which the calculation results should be displayed   
ResultType  | obj  | Result type for which the calculation results should be displayed   
Text  | str  | Node, stress point, element, or material point   
B  | bool  | Boolean, enables or disables the use of smoothing for results   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
\-  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

PlxValues 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Generates a table with the calculation results of a specified result type in a phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getresults Phase_1 ResultTypes.Soil.Utot "node"

Generates a table with the calculation results of total displacement values for Phase_1, for all soil nodes.

_Example:_
    
    
    getresults Phases[-1] ResultTypes.RigidBody.XRef "node"

Returns the x component of the reference point of all the active rigid bodies in a phase.

_Example:_
    
    
    getresults Phase_1 ResultTypes.Soil.ElementID "element"

Generates a table with the IDs of all soil elements for Phase_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    getresults Phase_1 ResultTypes.Soil.MaterialIndex "element"

Generates a table with the indexes of all soil elements for Phase_1. Using the echo command, the Materials[index].Identification can show the identification of the specific material according to the index specified. Other options are "node" and "stress point".

_Example:_
    
    
    getresults Step_34 ResultTypes.Soil.SigxxE "stress point"

Generates a table with the calculation results of effective stress values in the x direction for Step_34, for all soil stress points.

_Example:_
    
    
    getresults Phase_1.Steps[-1] ResultTypes.Soil.MeanEffStress "stress point"

Generates a table with the calculation results of mean effective stress values for the last step of Phase_1, for all soil stress points.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Generates a table with the calculation results of a specified result type in a phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getresults Phase_1 ResultTypes.Soil.Utot "node" True

Generates a table with the calculation results of total displacement values for Phase_1, for all soil nodes with result smoothing.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Generates a table with the calculation results of a specified result type, of a structural object in a phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getresults EmbeddedBeam_1 Phase_6 ResultTypes.EmbeddedBeam.Ux "node"

Generates a table with the calculation results of displacement values in x direction for Phase_6, for all EmbeddedBeam_1 nodes.

_Example:_
    
    
    getresults EmbeddedBeams[-1] Phase_6.Steps[0] ResultTypes.EmbeddedBeam.Uy "node"

Generates a table with the calculation results of displacement values in y direction, for the first step of Phase_6 (if stored), for the lastly created embedded beam object, for all nodes.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Generates a table with the calculation results of a specified result type in a phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getresults EmbeddedBeam_1 Phase_4 ResultTypes.EmbeddedBeam.Utot "node" True

Generates a table with the calculation results of total displacement values for Phase_4, for EmbeddedBeam_1 nodes with result smoothing.

## Alternative 5

_Purpose:_

Generates a table with the calculation results of a specified result type for the active phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getresults ResultTypes.Soil.Ux "node"

Generates a table with the calculation results of displacement in the x direction for soil nodes.

## Alternative 6

_Purpose:_

Generates a table with the calculation results of a specified result type for the active phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getresults ResultTypes.Soil.Utot "node" True

Generates a table with the calculation results of total displacement for soil nodes with result smoothing.

## Alternative7

_Purpose:_

Generates a table with the calculation results of a specified result type for the active phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getresults EmbeddedBeam_1 ResultTypes.EmbeddedBeam.Ux "node"

Generates a table with the calculation results of displacement values in x direction for all EmbeddedBeam_1 nodes.

## Alternative 8

_Purpose:_

Generates a table with the calculation results of a specified result type for the active phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getresults EmbeddedBeam_1 ResultTypes.EmbeddedBeam.Ux "node" True

Generates a table with the calculation results of displacement values in x direction for EmbeddedBeam_1 nodes with result smoothing.

## Alternative 9

_Purpose:_

Generates a table with the calculation results of a specified result type, for a centerline object for in a phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getresults CenterLines[-1] Phase_1 ResultTypes.CenterLine.M2D

Generates a table with the calculation results of bending moment for Phase_1 for the defined centerline.

#  lineparallel (lipa)

Creates a line parallel to another line. 

## Signature
    
    
     lineparallel <startpoint> <ln_obj> [Len]
    	startpoint: {pt_obj |(x y z)}

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference. Name of the point from which the line should be created   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference. Name of the line to which the line should be parallel   
Len  | float  |  Length. The length of the line that should be created   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Point](GUID-B66BC755-E798-4237-AA8F-FC607481D430.html), [Line](GUID-EA175FC9-E4E6-4FD3-97C0-4F1F3624D025.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a line from a point (which may either exist, or will be created) parallel to an existing line with the same length. 

_Example:_
    
    
    lineparallel Point_3 Line_1

Creates a line from Point_3 parallel to Line_1 with the same length and direction as Line_1. If Line_1 is from (0, 0, 0) to (3, 0, 4), the new line starts at Point_3 (0, 1, 0) and goes to a new point at (3, 1, 4).

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a line from a point (which may either exist, or will be created) parallel to an existing line with a specified length. 

_Example:_
    
    
    lineparallel 0 1 0 Line_1 10

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (0, 1, 0) parallel to Line_1 with a length of 10. If Line_1 is from (0, 0, 0) to (3, 0, 4), the new line goes from (0, 1, 0) to (6, 1, 8).

## See also

[line](GUID-A7671899-36CF-4CF1-B1EA-D8C754F013BB.html), [lineangles](GUID-A23CA42A-3B0B-4A96-A368-AB9BEB3403E7.html), [linerelative](GUID-4C2A32DC-946E-403D-9AF5-43CF9452D1B2.html), [linevector](GUID-F5C2E79F-0CA7-4C1D-80EA-1CF972932980.html)

# surface (srf)

Creates a polygon or a surface. 

## Signature
    
    
    surface Points | Polycurve
    	Points: <{pt_obj | (x y z)} {pt_obj | (x y z)} {pt_obj | (x y z)}> [{pt_obj | (x y z)}]...
    	Polycurve: polyc_obj

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, point name   
polyc_obj  | obj  |  Name of the polycurve that construct the surface.   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[ Polygon](GUID-41820D20-39F0-4968-AC4B-FC589E7EB18E.html) | [ Surface](GUID-064F8245-0453-4B36-B7F1-2D912DEAF9B3.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface between three or more points. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surface (3 2 1) (4 5 8) (10 11 14)

Creates a structural surface between coordinates (3, 2, 1), (4, 5, 8) and (10, 11, 14). 

_Example:_
    
    
    surface Point_1 Point_2 Point_3

Creates a structural surface between Point_1, Point_2 and Point_3. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surface Point_1 Point_4 (10 11 14) (6 7 9)

Creates a structural surface between Point_1, Point_4 and coordinates (10, 11, 14) and (6, 7, 9). 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface from a polycurve. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surface Polycurve_1

Creates a surface from Polycurve_1. 

## See also

[contraction](GUID-F192A9A8-B396-47A5-8E46-3A83F2177F25.html), [geogrid](GUID-6B33756A-BD25-43AC-B88F-566AFC325A91.html), [neginterface](GUID-8F3F52A1-BBDC-48D0-8EBC-6FD9224054A0.html), [plate](GUID-FF5D716F-297B-431F-8354-8FEE77644DFD.html), [posinterface](GUID-87FA745B-DD8E-4488-A20B-131F6BEAE1E4.html), [surfdispl](GUID-2291A7A2-775F-403D-B733-080B833E1035.html), [surfload](GUID-3C73B3C7-367D-48D6-9027-B8CD04517765.html)

#  SurfaceDisplacement

Surface prescribed displacement feature of a surface. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the surface prescribed displacement.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the surface prescribed displacement.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the surface prescribed displacement.   
Parent  |  Parent  |  \-  |  Name of the surface where the surface prescribed displacement feature is applied to.   
Displacement_x  |  Displacement x |  \-  | 

  * Free  The surface can displace freely along the x-axis. 
  * Fixed  The surface is fixed along the x-axis. 
  * Prescribed  The surface has a prescribed displacement along the x-axis. 

  
Displacement_y  |  Displacement y |  \-  | 

  * Free  The surface can displace freely along the y-axis. 
  * Fixed  The surface is fixed along the y-axis. 
  * Prescribed  The surface has a prescribed displacement along the y-axis. 

  
Displacement_z  |  Displacement z |  \-  | 

  * Free  The surface can displace freely along the z-axis. 
  * Fixed  The surface is fixed along the z-axis. 
  * Prescribed  The surface has a prescribed displacement along the z-axis. 

  
Distribution  |  Distribution  |  \-  | 

  * Uniform  The surface prescribed displacement value is constant over the entire surface. 
  * x-aligned increment  The surface prescribed displacement value changes linearly along the x-axis. 
  * y-aligned increment  The surface prescribed displacement value changes linearly along the y-axis. 
  * z-aligned increment  The surface prescribed displacement value changes linearly along the z-axis. 
  * Vector-aligned increment  The surface prescribed displacement value changes linearly along a vector. 
  * Free increment  The surface prescribed displacement value changes linearly along all axes. 
  * Perpendicular  The surface prescribed displacement is perpendicular to the surface. 
  * Perpendicular, vertical increment  The surface prescribed displacement is perpendicular to the surface and changes along the z-axis. 

  
un_ref  |  u n,ref |  Length  |  Component of the displacement perpendicular to the surface.   
un_inc  |  u n,inc |  Length/Length  |  Increment of the component of the displacement perpendicular to the surface.   
ux  |  u x |  Length  |  x-component of the displacement.   
uy  |  u y |  Length  |  y-component of the displacement.   
uz  |  u z |  Length  |  z-component of the displacement.   
u  |  |u|  |  Length  |  Absolute value of the displacement.   
Vector_x  |  Vector x |  Length  |  x-component of the vector.   
Vector_y  |  Vector y |  Length  |  y-component of the vector.   
Vector_z  |  Vector z |  Length  |  z-component of the vector.   
ux_inc_V  |  u x,inc,V |  ΔLength/Length  |  Increment of the x-component of the displacement along the vector.   
uy_inc_V  |  u y,inc,V |  ΔLength/Length  |  Increment of the y-component of the displacement along the vector.   
uz_inc_V  |  u z,inc,V |  ΔLength/Length  |  Increment of the z-component of the displacement along the vector.   
u_inc_V  |  |u inc,V |  |  ΔLength/Length  |  Absolute increase of the displacement along the vector.   
ux_inc_x  |  u x,inc,x |  ΔLength/Length  |  Increment of the x-component of the displacement along the x-axis.   
uy_inc_x  |  u y,inc,x |  ΔLength/Length  |  Increment of the y-component of the displacement along the x-axis.   
uz_inc_x  |  u z,inc,x |  ΔLength/Length  |  Increment of the z-component of the displacement along the x-axis.   
u_inc_x  |  |u inc,x |  |  ΔLength/Length  |  Absolute increment of the displacement along the x-axis.

#  __removeintermediatesteps (__ris)

Removes saved intermediate calculation steps. 

## Signature
    
    
    __removeintermediatesteps [ph_obj]...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
ph_obj  | obj  |  Phase object reference, name of the phase in which the intermediate calculation steps should be removed   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Flow conditions, Staged construction |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Removes saved intermediate calculation steps in one or more phases. Only the last calculation step will not be removed. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __removeintermediatesteps (InitialPhase Phase_1 Phase_5)

Removes saved intermediate calculation steps in the initial phase, Phase_1 and Phase_5.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Removes saved intermediate calculation steps in all phases. Only the last calculation step of every phase will not be removed. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __removeintermediatesteps

Removes saved intermediate calculation steps in all phases.

#  revolve (rv)

Creates a surface or volume by revolution of a line or surface around an axis. 

## Signature
    
    
    revolve <plx_obj>... <point> <point> <Ang>
    	point:	{(x y z)} | pt_obj	

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  PLAXIS object reference, Name of a geometric entity that must be revolved   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
dirx  | float  |  x-vector component   
dirx  | float  | y-vector component   
dirz  | float  | z-vector component   
Ang  | float  |  Degrees of revolution around the specified reference axis   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Surface](GUID-064F8245-0453-4B36-B7F1-2D912DEAF9B3.html), [Volume](GUID-CDDE333E-8922-4FF5-B2DB-4B6B31644557.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a volume or surface by revolving a surface or line around an axis defined by a starting point and the direction of a vector. 

_Example:_
    
    
    revolve Polycurve_1 (2 -2 0) (0 0 1) 180

Creates a surface by revolving Polycurve_1 180 degrees around the axis defined by the line starting at point (2 -2 0) and the direction of vector (0 0 1). 

_Example:_
    
    
    revolve Polygon_1 (3 3 -3) (1 1 1) 360

Creates a volume by revolving Polygon_1 360 degrees around the axis defined by the line starting at point (3 3 -3) and the direction of vector (1 1 1). 

## See also

[extrude](GUID-B06CC4E8-15C7-4338-A786-7A563E875CFC.html)

#  deactivate (deact)

Deactivates features. 

## Signature
    
    
    deactivate <act_obj>... <ph_obj>...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
act_obj  | obj  |  Activatable object reference. Name of the object that should be deactivated.   
ph_obj  | obj  | Phase reference. Name of the phase in which the object should be deactivated.   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Mesh, Flow conditions, Staged construction |  Global

None

_Purpose:_

Deactivates one or more activatable objects in one or more phases.

Deactivates a list of objects in one or more phases.

#  __gogreen ( __pwr)

Instructs the computer to logoff/sleep/hibernate/poweroff. 

## Signature
    
    
    __gogreen [PowerOption] [B] [I]
    	PowerOption: "logoff" | "sleep" | "hibernate" | "poweroff"

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
PowerOption  | str  |  Instructs the computer to logoff, sleep, hibernate or power off.   
B  | bool  |  True forces the computer to logoff/sleep/hibernate/poweroff, even if other applications refuse. False does not force the computer to logoff/sleep/hibernate/poweroff, if other applications refuse.   
I  | int  |  Number of seconds before the computer will logoff/sleep/hibernate/poweroff.   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Instructs the computer to hibernate. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __gogreen

Instructs the computer to hibernate.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Instructs the computer to logoff/sleep/hibernate/poweroff. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __gogreen "sleep"

Instructs the computer to go to sleep.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Forces or instructs the computer to logoff/sleep/hibernate/poweroff. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __gogreen "sleep" True

Forces the computer to sleep, even if other applications refuse.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Forces or instructs the computer to logoff/sleep/hibernate/poweroff after a certain number of seconds. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __gogreen "sleep" True 60

Forces the computer to poweroff in 60 seconds, even if other applications refuse.

## See also

[save](GUID-B6F8E8BD-C3F6-4FAC-B9D0-BAC143855E40.html)

**Parent topic:** [ Input commands reference ](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html)
