#  markphasescyclic (mpc)

Sets a group of phases in General test to be part of a cyclic analysis and allows the specific cycle to be repeated as many times specified. 

## Signature
    
    
    markphasescyclic <FirstPhase> <LastPhase> <Num>
    	FirstPhase, LastPhase: ph_obj_index

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
ph_obj_index  | int  |  Index number of the phase considered (zero-based counting), e.g. for Phase 1 which is General.Phases[0] the index is 0   
Num  | int  |  Number of times the specified cycle (of phases) is to be repeated   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
SoilTest  | Test   
  
## Objects created

[General.CyclicPhases](GUID-90F84317-203A-44F5-9FB1-608AF36EC345.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Sets a group of phases in General test to be part of a cyclic analysis and allows the specific cycle to be repeated as many times specified. 

_Example:_
    
    
    markphasescyclic General 0 3 1000

Sets the group of phases, starting from starting from phase with index 0 (General.Phases[0]) up to including phase with index 3 (General.Phases[3]) to be considered one cycle of a cyclic analyses to be repeated 1000 times. 

_Example:_
    
    
    markphasescyclic General 2 4 500

Sets the group of phases, starting from phase with index 2 (General.Phases[2]) up to including phase with index 4 (General.Phases[4]) to be considered one cycle of a cyclic analyses to be repeated 500 times. 

## See also

[deletecyclicphases](GUID-B9ADFBB0-D695-4B6E-9257-CB8481E01E22.html), [General](GUID-90F84317-203A-44F5-9FB1-608AF36EC345.html)

**Parent topic:** [ Soiltest command reference ](GUID-07D4ED2F-DA46-4459-8032-95205D8918A6.html)

#  __dumpwaterloads ( __dwl)

Displays a list of all water loads. 

## Signature
    
    
    __dumpdisplacements <ph_obj | step_obj> [Opt]
    	Opt: Criterion | (x y z) 
    		Criterion: {"position" | "water load x" | "water load y" | "water load z" | "count"} | Combination

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
ph_obj  | obj  |  The phase for which the prescribed displacements should be displayed   
step_obj  | obj  |  The step for which the prescribed displacements should be displayed   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
Criterion | Combination  | str  |  Position, water load x, y, z, number of water loads or combination of these   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Output  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays a list of all water loads. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __dumpwaterloads Phase_1

Displays a list of all water loads for Phase_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __dumpwaterloads Step_11

Displays a list of all water loads for Step_11. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Displays a list of all water loads for a phase at a specific coordinate. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __dumpwaterloads Phase_2 (0 0 0)

Displays a list of all water loads for Phase_7 at (0 0 0). 

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Displays a list of water loads or the number of water loads for a specific phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __dumpwaterloads Phase_3 "count"

Displays the number of water loads for Phase_3. 

## See also

[echo](GUID-44A4889C-A78D-417E-A303-9A6A22BF325D.html)

## GUID-6683E25F-D53D-4F24-BBFC-17775EC11DBD.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  platemat (mpm)

Creates a plate material set. 

## Signature
    
    
    platemat [{PropName PropValue}]...
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [PlateMat](GUID-A6C5816D-DEA3-4633-9565-25A900D05D9E.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
PropName  | str  |  Property name. Details on the available properties at object [PlateMat](GUID-A6C5816D-DEA3-4633-9565-25A900D05D9E.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  |  Property value. Details on the available properties at object [PlateMat](GUID-A6C5816D-DEA3-4633-9565-25A900D05D9E.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[PlateMat](GUID-A6C5816D-DEA3-4633-9565-25A900D05D9E.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a plate material set with no specified properties. It is not possible to calculate with this material before editing it to make its properties valid. 

_Example:_
    
    
    platemat

Creates a new plate material set. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a plate material set with specified properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    platemat "Identification" "BasementFloor" "MaterialType" "Elastic" "Gamma" 50 "E1" 30000000 "D3d" 0.3

Creates a new plate material set.

## See also

[plate](GUID-FF5D716F-297B-431F-8354-8FEE77644DFD.html)

## GUID-66D40011-D90C-40FB-975C-766676D853ED.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  tabulate (tbl)

Displays a table of properties for specified objects. 

## Signature
    
    
    tabulate <OptA> | <OptB> | <OptC>
    	OptA: <plx_obj>... [Index] [Criterion] 
    	OptB: <sc_Option> <ph_obj> [Index] [Criterion]
    	OptC: <sc_feat> <ph_Option> [Index] [Criterion]
    		sc_Option: <sc_obj>... | <sc_feat_list> 
    		ph_Option: {<ph_obj> <ph_obj>...} | <ph_obj_list 

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  Objects to be displayed   
Index  | int  |  Number of the object that should be tabulated or number of the starting object. The numbering of objects is 0-based, so the first object has number 0.   
Criterion  | str  |  Criterion that the objects that should be tabulated have to fulfill   
sc_feat  | obj  |  List of the staged construction features from which the features should be tabulated   
sc_feat_list  | list  |  The name of the staged construction features list from which the features should be tabulated   
ph_obj  | obj  |  Name of the phase from which the features should be tabulated   
ph_obj_list  | list  |  The name of the phase list from which the features should be tabulated   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays a table with specified objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate LoadMultiplier_1 LoadMultiplier_2

Displays a table of listed load multipliers.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate MovementFunctions

Displays a table of all movement functions.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate DiaphragmWall Geosynthetic

Displays a table of the listed material objects.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate Materials

Displays a table of all materials.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate Lines

Displays a table of all line objects.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate Phases

Displays a table of phases.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Displays a table of objects that fulfil a specified criterion. 

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate Points "x<2"

Displays a table of all points that have an x-coordinate with a value lesser than 2.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate SoilMat_1 SoilMat_2 "gammaSat gammaUnsat Gref"

Displays a table of three properties details for the listed soil materials.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate Materials "SoilMat"

Displays a table of all soil materials.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate Lines "LineLoad<>"

Displays a table of all lines that have a line load assigned to them.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate Lines "Length<=1"

Displays a table of all lines that have a length less or equal to 1.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate Phases "ShouldCalculate=False"

Displays a table of all phases that are not to be calculated.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Displays a table (with specified columns) of objects that fulfil a specified criterion. 

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate (Line_1 Line_2) "First Second" "First=Point_1"

Displays a table of lines of which first point is Point_1. The table will show two columns: first and second line points.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate Points "x" "x=2"

Displays a table of all points that have x-coordinate equal to 2\. The table will show one column: x coordinates.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate (Point_1 Point_2 Point_3) "x" "x>2"

Displays a table of points thet have x-coordinate greater than 2\. The table will show one column: x coordinates.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate Phases "Identification DeformCalcType MaxCores" "MaxCores=2"

Displays a table of all phases which max cores equals to 2. The table will show three columns: Identification, DeformCalcType, and MaxCores.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Displays a table of specified staged features in the specified phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate (EmbeddedBeam_2_1 EmbeddedBeam_1_1) Phase_1

Displays a table of beams that are in Phase_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate LineLoads Phase_2

Displays a table of line loads that are in Phase_2.

## Alternative 5

_Purpose:_

Displays a table of the values of the specified properties in columns, in the given phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate (PointLoad_2_1 PointLoad_3_1) Phase_1 "Fx Fy"

Displays a table of point loads that are in Phase_1. The table will show two columns: Fx and Fy.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate EmbeddedBeams InitialPhase "Fx Fz"

Displays a table of embedded beams that are in InitialPhase. The table will show two columns: Fx and Fy.

## Alternative 6

_Purpose:_

Displays a table of the values of the specified properties in columns that fulfil the specified criteria in the given phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate (PointLoad_1_1 PointLoad_2_1) Phase_1 "Fx Fy" "Active=True"

Displays a table of point loads that are active in Phase_1. The table will show three columns: Fx and Fy.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate PointLoads Phase_1 "Fx Fy" "Active=True"

Displays a table of all point loads that are active in Phase_1. The table will show four columns: Fx and Fy.

## Alternative 7

_Purpose:_

Displays a list of phases in which staged feature is present. 

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate PointLoad_1_1 Phase_1 Phase_2

Displays a list of phases in which PointLoad_1_1 is present.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate PointLoad_1_1 Phases

Displays a list of phases from all phases in which PointLoad_1_1 is present.

## Alternative 8

_Purpose:_

Displays a table of the values of the specified properties in columns, in the given phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate PointLoad_1_1 Phase_1 Phase_2 "Active"

Displays a list of phases in which PointLoad_1_1 is active.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate PointLoad_1_1 Phases "Fx Active"

Displays phases, in which PointLoad_1_1 is present. The table will show two columns: Fx and Active.

## Alternative 9

_Purpose:_

Displays a table of the values of the specified properties in columns, that fulfil the specified criteria in the given phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate PointLoad_1_1 Phase_1 Phase_2 "" "Active=True"

Displays a table of phases, in which PointLoad_1_1 is active. The table will have all available columns (Active, Fx, Fy, Fz, F, Mx, My and Mz).

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate PointLoad_1_1 Phases "Fy F Active" "Active=True"

Displays phases, in which PointLoad_1_1 is active. The table will show three columns: Fy, F, and Active.

_Example:_
    
    
    tabulate PointLoad_2_1 S_Group_2 "Fx Fy" "Fx>1"

Displays phases from the group of phases, in which Fx value is greater than 1. The table will show two columns: Fx and Fy

[count](GUID-B8D39E79-5481-4635-BA6E-4A855C509720.html), [echo](GUID-4705E5FE-361C-46CF-AD52-4B7F134430F6.html), [filter](GUID-24A1FE60-435E-48CE-90FF-9355CD8EF775.html), [groupfiltered](GUID-2DC88566-CB97-4417-8D16-CA6D05A0E98C.html)

#  PlotTypes

Settings available for the object Plot 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
None  |  None  |  \-  |  Shows the default visualization of the mesh.   
NodeArrows  |  NodeArrows  |  \-  |  Displays arrows on the location of the nodes indicating the vectors   
ContourLines  |  ContourLines  |  \-  |  Displays contour lines of the result type.   
ColourContourLines  |  ColourContourLines  |  \-  |  Displays coloured contour lines of the result type.   
Shadings  |  Shadings  |  \-  |  Visualizes the amplitude of the result type by coloring the mesh from blue to red.   
IsoAreas  |  IsoAreas  |  \-  |  Displays curved lines that separate each area of the mesh that has a different value and also a line joining minimum and maximum value.   
PrincipalDirectionsNoColour  |  PrincipalDirectionsNoColour  |  \-  |  Shows the principal direction vectors in the soil elements in the colour red.   
Deformation  |  Deformation  |  \-  |  Shows the deformation vectors on the structure.   
Distribution  |  Distribution  |  \-  |  Shows how the given result type is distributed over the structure.   
DistributionOpen  |  DistributionOpen  |  \-  |  Shows how the given result type is distributed over the structure as a wireframe.   
PlasticPoints  |  PlasticPoints  |  \-  |  Shows the various plastic point types in the mesh.   
CenterPrincipalDirectionsNoColour  |  CenterPrincipalDirectionsNoColour  |  \-  |  Shows the principal direction vectors in the soil elements in the colour red, but doesn't display vectors at the edges.   
NodeLabels  |  NodeLabels  |  \-  |  Shows labels with the result type value above all the nodes. The nodes must be visible for the labels to be visible as well.   
StressPointLabels  |  StressPointLabels  |  \-  |  Shows labels with the result type value above all the stress points. The stress points must be visible for the labels to be visible as well.   
StressPointArrows  |  StressPointArrows  |  \-  |  Displays arrows on the location of the stress points indicating the vectors   
PrincipalDirections  |  PrincipalDirections  |  \-  |  Shows the principal direction vectors in the soil elements.   
CenterPrincipalDirections  |  CenterPrincipalDirections  |  \-  |  Shows the principal direction vectors in the soil elements but doesn't display vectors at the edges.   
DistributionEnvelope  |  DistributionEnvelope  |  \-  |  Shows the minimum and maximum value on the structure calculated over all steps.   
DistributionEnvelopeOpen  |  DistributionEnvelopeOpen  |  \-  |  Shows the minimum and maximum value on the structure calculated over all steps as a wireframe.

#  rotate (ror)

Rotates objects around a point. 

## Signature
    
    
    rotate [plx_obj]... <point> <anglex angley anglez>
    	plx_obj: point | ln_obj | polyc_obj | tnl_obj | srf_obj | vol_obj
    		point:	{(x y z)} | pt_obj	
    

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point that should be rotated or around which the objects should be rotated   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference, Name of the line that should be rotated   
polyc_obj  | obj  |  Polycurve object reference, Name of the polycurve that should be rotated   
tn_obj  | obj  | Tunnel object reference, Name of the tunnel that should be rotated   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface that should be rotated   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference, Name of the volume that should be rotated   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate of reference point   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate of reference point   
z  | float  | z-coordinate of reference point   
anglex  | float  |  Degrees of rotation around x-axis   
angley  | float  |  Degrees of rotation around y-axis   
anglez  | float  |  Degrees of rotation around z-axis   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Rotates one or more objects around a point with rotation around x-axis, y-axis and z-axis. 

_Example:_
    
    
    rotate (Lines[-1] Line_2) (3 1 2) 45 30 5

Rotates the last line from the list of lines and Line_2 around coordinates (3, 1, 2) with 45 degrees around x-axis, 30 degrees around y-axis and 5 degrees around z-axis.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Rotates one or more objects around a point with rotation around x-axis, y-axis and z-axis. 

_Example:_
    
    
    rotate Volume_1 (4 3 1) 45 30 5

Rotates Volume_1 around coordinates (4 3 1) with 45 degrees around x-axis, 30 degrees around y-axis and 5 degrees around z-axis.

## See also

[revolve](GUID-6360FBAB-FEF9-485E-B78B-389597D4A78B.html), [rotateline](GUID-2480B8E0-547B-4F67-A6EA-3DA0649F7C30.html)

#  __kill ()

Closes down PLAXIS 3D Input without saving. 

## Signature
    
    
    __kill

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

No parameters 

## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Closes down PLAXIS 3D Input without saving any of the open projects. After PLAXIS 3D Input is restarted, the option to restore the project will be presented. External processes, such as PLAXIS 3D Output, will not be terminated by this command. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __kill)

Closes down PLAXIS 3D Input without saving any of the open projects.

#  geogrid (gg)

Adds geogrid features to lines. 

## Signature
    
    
    geogrid  <surface> [surface]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
     surface: {<startpoint> <point> <point> [point]...} | polyc_obj | srf_obj}
    	startpoint: {(x y z)} | pt_obj
    	point:	{(x y z)} | pt_obj	
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [Geogrid](GUID-C3D8C36B-2582-428A-BFD7-D5A1EE0D5506.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point(s) for which a Geogrid object should start or end   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Polycurve object reference, Name of the polycurve to which a Geogrid object should be added   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which a Discontinuity object should be added   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [Geogrid](GUID-C3D8C36B-2582-428A-BFD7-D5A1EE0D5506.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [Geogrid](GUID-C3D8C36B-2582-428A-BFD7-D5A1EE0D5506.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Geogrid](GUID-C3D8C36B-2582-428A-BFD7-D5A1EE0D5506.html),  [Polygon](GUID-41820D20-39F0-4968-AC4B-FC589E7EB18E.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds geogrid features to one or more  surfaces in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    geogrid Polygon_1

Adds a geogrid feature to Polygon_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    geogrid (Polygon_6 Polygon_4)

Adds geogrid features to Polygon_6 and Polygon_4.

_Example:_
    
    
    geogrid (1 4 0) (2 3 0) (4 5 0)

Creates a new surface between three points with coordinates (1, 4, 0), (2, 3, 0) and (4, 5, 0) and adds a geogrid feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    geogrid Point_1 Point_2 (4 5 0)

Creates a new surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a point with coordinates (4, 5, 0) and adds a geogrid feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    geogrid Polycurve_1

Adds a geogrid feature to closed Polycurve_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    geogrid Group_1

Adds geogrid features to all structural surfaces in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only surfaces.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds geogrid features to one or more existing surfaces in the geometry and directly set their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    geogrid Polygon_1 "Material" Footing

Adds a geogrid feature to Polygon_1 and sets the material to Footing.

_Example:_
    
    
    geogrid (Polygon_1 Polygon_3) "Material" Footing

Adds a geogrid feature to Polygon_1 and Polygon_3 and sets the material to Footing for both geogrids.

_Example:_
    
    
    geogrid Point_1 Point_2 (5 6 0) "Material" Footing

Creates a new surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a new point with coordinates (5, 6, 0), adds a geogrid feature to it and sets the material to Footing.

## See also

[geogridmat](GUID-0A72DFD9-5937-40AE-9EDD-F2B570CDFE3A.html), [surface](GUID-60600C86-7D70-4160-997A-A81DB39A36DB.html)

#  index ()

Displays the value at the given index. 

## Signature
    
    
    index <I>

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
I  | int  | Number that represents the index of the list containing the result. The numbering of objects is 0-based, so the first item has number 0.   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---

## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  gotoflow (gtf)

Switches to flow conditions mode. 

## Signature
    
    
    gotoflow [B]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
B  | bool  |  Boolean, true creates a new intersection even if not necessary, false does not create an intersection unless necessary   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Switches from the current working mode to flow conditions mode. There has to be at least one volume or surface in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    gotoflow

Switches from the current working mode to flow conditions mode.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Switches from the current working mode to flow condiitons mode with the possibility to create a new intersection regardless of whether there are any geometric changes. There has to be at least one volume or surface in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    gotoflow true

Switches from the current working mode to flow conditions mode and creates a new intersection.

## See also

[gotomesh](GUID-AB747571-E828-46E6-A61C-0A272607711F.html), [gotosoil](GUID-C2B37282-D2E9-4F51-98D4-A0384519D230.html), [gotostages](GUID-21A0CB93-D360-4579-A71F-D6194E761C61.html), [gotostructures](GUID-2D2D4A90-8C0E-466E-B975-1D60CA11C77E.html), [gotowater](GUID-963CE5B1-B438-4646-97BF-AD5EA511D96D.html)

#  commands (cms)

Displays available commands and their signatures. 

## Signature
    
    
    commands [{ptcmd | lst_obj | lst_obj ptcmd}]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---

lst_obj  | obj  |  Listable object reference, name of the listable of which the objects are to be displayed   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Output  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays all available global commands for the current working mode with their corresponding signature(s). 

_Example:_
    
    
    commands

Displays all available global commands for the current working mode with their corresponding signature(s).

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Displays the signatures of a global command. 

_Example:_
    
    
    commands "getresults"

Displays the signatures of the command "getresults".

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Displays all available commands for a listable object with their signatures. 

_Example:_
    
    
    commands Plot_1

Displays all available commands for Plot_1, with their signatures.

_Example:_
    
    
    commands Plot_1 "x"

Displays all available commands for Plot_1, with their signatures, the names of which contain the "x".

# soil()

Adds soil features to volumes. 

## Signature
    
    
    soil <vol_obj>... [{PropName PropValue}]...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference, Name of the volume to which a line feature should be added   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Soil ](GUID-12538F90-AAA2-4AE4-841C-1390CE850761.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds soil features to one or more existing volumes in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    soil Volume_1

Adds a soil feature to Volume_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    soil Volume_2 Volume_3

Adds soil features to Volume_2 and Volume_3. 

_Example:_
    
    
    soil (Volume_6 Volume_4)

Adds soil features to Volume_6 and Volume_4. 

_Example:_
    
    
    soil Group_1

Adds soil features to all volumes in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only volumes.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds soil features to one or more existing volumes in the geometry and directly set their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    soil Volume_1 "Material" SoilMat_1

Adds a soil feature to Volume_1 and sets the material to SoilMat_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    soil (Volume_2 Volume_3) "Material" SoilMat_1

Adds soil features to Volume_2 and Volume_3 and sets the material to SoilMat_1 for both soils.

## See also

[ soilmat (msm)](GUID-92E91172-FC7D-4632-B76E-E6653E4C1DA7.html)

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

# surfgwfbc (sgfb)

Adds groundwater flow boundary condition features to surfaces. 

## Signature
    
    
    surfgwfcb <surface> [surface]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
     surface: {<startpoint> <point> <point> [point]...} | polyc_obj | srf_obj}
    	startpoint: {(x y z)} | pt_obj
    	point:	{(x y z)} | pt_obj	
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [SurfaceGWFlowBC](GUID-196AA0A0-CC32-452F-A031-DA926DFD2E7F.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point(s) for which a SurfaceGWFlowBC object should start or end   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Polycurve object reference, Name of the polycurve to which a SurfaceGWFlowBC object should created   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which a SurfaceGWFlowBC object should be added   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [SurfaceGWFlowBC](GUID-196AA0A0-CC32-452F-A031-DA926DFD2E7F.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [SurfaceGWFlowBC](GUID-196AA0A0-CC32-452F-A031-DA926DFD2E7F.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[SurfaceGWFlowBC](GUID-196AA0A0-CC32-452F-A031-DA926DFD2E7F.html), [Surface](GUID-064F8245-0453-4B36-B7F1-2D912DEAF9B3.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds surface groundwater flow boundary condition features to one or more existing structural surfaces in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfgwfbc Polygon_1

Adds a surface groundwater flow boundary condition feature to Polygon_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfgwfbc Polygon_2 Polygon_3

Adds surface groundwater flow boundary condition features to Polygon_2 and Polygon_3. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfgwfbc (Polygon_6 Polygon_4)

Adds surface groundwater flow boundary condition features to Polygon_6 and Polygon_4. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfgwfbc Group_1

Adds surface groundwater flow boundary condition features to all structural surfaces in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only structural surfaces. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface between three or more points (which may either exist or will be created) and adds a surface groundwater flow boundary condition feature to it. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfgwfbc Point_1 Point_2 (1 0 5)

Creates a structural surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a new point with coordinates (1, 0, 5) and adds a surface groundwater flow boundary condition feature to it. 

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface from a polycurve and adds a surface groundwater flow boundary condition feature to it. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfgwfbc Polycurve_3

Creates a structural surface from Polycurve_3 and adds a surface groundwater flow boundary condition feature to it. 

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Adds surface groundwater flow boundary condition features to one or more existing structural surfaces in the geometry and directly sets their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfgwfbc Polygon_1 "Behaviour" "Closed"

Adds a surface groundwater flow boundary condition feature to Polygon_1 and sets the behaviour to "Closed". 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfgwfbc (Polygon_2 Polygon_3) "Behaviour" "Closed"

Adds surface groundwater flow boundary condition features to Polygon_2 and Polygon_3 and sets the behaviour to "Closed" for both surface groundwater flow boundary conditions. 

## Alternative 5

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface between three or more points (which may either exist or will be created), adds a surface groundwater flow boundary condition feature to it and directly sets its properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfgwfbc Point_1 Point_2 (1 0 5) "Behaviour" "Closed"

Creates a structural surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a new point with coordinates (1, 0, 5), adds a surface groundwater flow boundary condition feature to it and sets the behaviour to "Closed". 

## Alternative 6

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface from a polycurve and adds a surface groundwater flow boundary condition feature to it and directly sets its properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    surfgwfbc Polycurve_8 "Behaviour" "Closed"

Creates a structural surface from Polycurve_8, adds a surface groundwater flow boundary condition feature to it and sets the behaviour to "Closed". 

## See also

[ linedrain (ldr)](GUID-13A3B1EA-7EFF-4646-840D-705BE7A4205B.html), [surface (srf)](GUID-60600C86-7D70-4160-997A-A81DB39A36DB.html), [ surfdrain (sdr)](GUID-26106C4C-AEB9-46E5-BCEA-80917523BBF1.html), [ well ()](GUID-ACA20A1B-BF90-47EE-8095-22327EA2DBD1.html)

#  nurbssurface (nrbss)

Creates a NURBS surface. 

## Signature
    
    
    nurbssurface <Coords_Bounding_Box> <Grid_Points> [Polynomial_Degree] [Continuity] <point>... 
    	Coords_Bounding_Box : Coords_Bottom_Left Coords_Top_Left
    		Coords_Bottom_Left : (x y z)
    		Coords_Top_Left : (x y z)
    	Grid_Points : gridx gridy
    	Polynomial_Degree: min_degree max_degree
    	Continuity: "c0" | "g1" | "c1" | "g2" | "c2" | "c3"
    	point:	{(x y z)} | pt_obj	

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
x  | float  |  x-coordinate of bottom-left or top-left corner point on the XY plane   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate of bottom-left or top-left corner point on the XY plane   
z  | float  | z-coordinate of bottom-left or top-left corner point on the XY plane   
gridx  | float  |  Grid points in the x-direction   
gridy  | float  |  Grid points in the y-direction   
min_degree  | float  |  Min polynomial degree   
max_degree  | float  |  Max polynomial degree   
"c0" | str  | Continuity. Only geometric continuity   
"g1" | str  | Continuity. For each point on the curve, the tangent vectors "on the right" and "on the left" are co-linear with the same orientation   
"c1" | str  |  Continuity of the first derivative. The "C1" curve is also "G1" but, in addition, the tangent vectors " on the right" and "on the left" are equal   
"g2" | str  | Continuity. For each point on the curve, the normalized normal vectors "on the right" and "on the left" are equal   
"c2" | str  |  Continuity of the second derivative. The "c2" curve is also "g2" but, in addition, the main directions of the curves also match.   
"c3" | str  |  Continuity of the third derivative.   
pt_obj  | obj  |  Coordinates of the points where the NURBS surface ends or coordinates of the points that create a surface   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[NURBSSurface](GUID-BD32A4B5-4EF3-4ADD-B4BB-65718F190946.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates NURBS surface in a specified location from the specified points. It detects a best-fitting plane so it can be used to arbitrarily oriented surfaces. 

_Example:_
    
    
    nurbssurface (0 0 0) (50 50 0) 10 10 (0 0 0) (5 2 0) (5 5 0) (2 5 0) (2 2 2) (4 5 6) (7 8 9)

Creates NURBS surface from the specified points starting at point (0 0 0) and ending at point (50 50 0). Grid points are set 10 in x-direction and 10 in y-direction.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates NURBS surface in a specified location from the specified points. It detects a best-fitting plane so it can be used to arbitrarily oriented surfaces.. 

_Example:_
    
    
    nurbssurface (0 0 0) (50 50 0) 10 10 1 2 "c1" (0 0 0) (5 0 0) (5 5 0) (0 5 0) (2 2 2)

Creates NURBS surface from the specified points starting at point (0 0 0) and ending at point (50 50 0). Grid points are set 10 in x-direction and 10 in y-direction with the continuity of the surface c1.

## See also

[import](GUID-BF60F423-93C6-4891-8BBD-6A036B1B4153.html)

**Parent topic:** [ Input commands reference ](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html)

#  __dumppoints (__dpt)

Displays a list of all points.

#  Discontinuity

Discontinuity feature of a line. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the discontinuity.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the discontinuity.   
Parent  |  Parent  |  \-  |  Name of the line where the discontinuity feature is applied to.   
Material  |  Material  |  \-  |  Material that is assigned to the discontinuity.   
ApplyStrengthReduction  |  Apply strength reduction  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the option to apply strength reduction for safety calculations that is applied to the discontinuity. 
  * False  Disables the option to apply strength reduction for safety calculations that is applied to the discontinuity. 

  
ActiveInFlow  |  Active in flow  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the option to consider the Groundwater properties of the discontinuity in groundwater flow analyses. 
  * False  Disables the option to consider the Groundwater properties of the discontinuity in groundwater flow analyses. 

  
WaterConditions  |  Water conditions  |  \-  | 

  * Global level  The pore pressure distribution is hydrostatic and it is automatically calculated from the global water level. 
  * Custom level  The pore pressure distribution is hydrostatic and it is automatically calculated from a custom water level. 
  * Head  The pore pressure distribution is hydrostatic and defined by the priovided reference elevation. 
  * User-defined  The pore pressure distribution is defined manually by giving the y ( ref), the corresponding p ref and p inc
  * Interpolate  The pore pressure distribution is linearly interpolated from the pore pressures of the adjacent soil layers. 
  * Dry  The pore pressure in the soil layer is equal to zero.

#  copylayers (col)

Copies the soil layer properties from one borehole to other boreholes. 

## Signature
    
    
    copylayers <bh_obj> <bh_obj>...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14).

---|---|---

bh_obj  | obj  |  Name of the borehole to which the properties of the soil layers should be copied   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Copies the water pressures and layer boundary positions of the soil layers from one borehole to other boreholes. 

_Example:_
    
    
    copylayers Borehole_1 (Borehole_4 Borehole_6)

#  resetlocal (rlc)

Requests a reset of the fineness of a mesh. 

## Signature
    
    
    resetlocal <msh_obj>...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
msh_obj  | obj  |  Meshable object reference, name of the meshable object for which the fineness should be reset to default setting   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Mesh |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Requests a reset of the fineness of the mesh of a meshable object to the default setting. The mesh has to be generated again for the effect to take place. 

_Example:_
    
    
    resetlocal Volume_1

Requests a reset of the fineness of the mesh of Volume_1 to the default setting.

## GUID-7CCCA1E8-2744-47CE-A26A-A82D1D55245E.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  set ()

Changes the properties of an object in the project. 

## Signature
    
    
    set <{plx_obj | Type...}> [PropValue]
    	Type: B | I | Num | Colour | S | plx_obj

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  | PLAXIS object reference, name of the object from which the properties should be copied   
B  | bool  | Boolean   
I  | int  | Integer   
Num  | float  | Number   
Colour  | int | obj  | Color reference   
S  | str  | Text   
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Object | Any   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Copies the properties of one object to another. 

_Example:_
    
    
    set Plate_1 Plate_2

Copies the properties of Plate_2 to Plate_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    set Point_1 Points[1]

Copies the properties of the second point from the list of points to Point_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    set Phase_1 Phase_2

Copies the properties of Phase_2 to Phase_1 except the parent phase property. Using this command only copies the phase properties, but does not copy other staged construction settings such as active state of soil and structures, value of loads etc.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Changes a numerical/text property of an object. 

_Example:_
    
    
    set Point_1.x 5.2

Changes the x-coordinate of Point_1 to 5.2.

_Example:_
    
    
    set Point_1.x Point_2.x

Changes the x-coordinate of Point_1 to the x-coordinate of Point_2.

_Example:_
    
    
    set PlateMat2D_1.Colour 646464

Changes the colour of PlateMat2D_1 to the colour with colour code 646464.

_Example:_
    
    
    set PlateMat2D_1.Colour Colours.Blue

Changes the colour of PlateMat2D_1 to blue.

_Example:_
    
    
    set Well_1.Behaviour 1

Changes the behaviour of Well_1 to "Infiltration".

_Example:_
    
    
    set Project.Title "Excavation"

Changes the title of the project to 'Excavation'.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Changes one or more properties of one or more objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    set (Point_1.x Point_2.y Point_5.y) 2

Changes the x-coordinate of Point_1 and the y-coordinate of Point_2 and Point_5 to 2.

_Example:_
    
    
    set Plate_1.Material (Phase_1 Phase_2) PlateMat2D_3

Changes the material of Plate_1 to PlateMat2D_3 in Phase_1 and Phase_2.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Changes a row in an advanced table. 

_Example:_
    
    
    set HeadFunction_1.Table[2].DeltaHead 3

Changes the DeltaHead property in the third row of HeadFunction_1 table to the value 3.

_Example:_
    
    
    set DisplacementMultiplier_1.Table[0][1] 7

Changes the value on row 0, column 1 of the advanced table of DisplacementMultiplier_1 to 7.

#  SlicePolycurveChains

Slice polycurve chain objects in tunnel geometry that include the [Reinforcements](GUID-FAF51C48-81C3-48C1-AE96-0C6B69B7604D.html) object. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

#  __getcommonmeshnodes (__gcmn)

Displays the number of shared nodes of two cut objects. 

## Signature
    
    
    __getcommonmeshnodes <plx_obj> <plx_obj> [B]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  PLAXIS object reference, name of the object of which the number of shared nodes should be displayed   
B  | boolean  |  True displays the positions of the shared nodes, False does not   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Mesh |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays the number of shared nodes of two cut objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __getcommonmeshnodes Line_2 Polygon_1

Displays the number of nodes of Line_2 that are present in Polygon_1. When, for example, the line is located along the edge of the surface, this command will give 'all' as feedback.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Displays the number of shared nodes of two cut objects with the possibility to display the positions of the shared nodes. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __getcommonmeshnodes Polygon_1 Line_2 True

Displays the number of nodes of Polygon_1 that are present in Line_2 and a list with the positions of these nodes. When, for example, the line is located along the edge of the surface, this command will give a percentage as feedback.

#  Deform

Deformation feature on a phase, containing calculation parameters relevant to the deformation calculation. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the deform feature.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the deform feature.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the deform feature.   
LoadingType  |  Loading type  |  \-  | 

  * Staged construction (1)  Consolidation and simultaneous loading in the sense of changing the load combination, stress state, weight, strength or stiffness of the elements, activated by changing the load and geometry configuration or pore pressure distribution by means of staged construction. 
  * Minimum excess pore pressure (2)  Consolidation without additional loading, until all excess pore pressures have decreased below a certain minimum value, specified by the minimum pore pressure parameter. 
  * Degree of consolidation (3)  Consolidation without additional loading, until a desired degree of consolidation, specified by the degree of consolidation parameter, is reached. 
  * Target SumMsf (4)  Reduction of the soil and interface strength towards a target value of the total multiplier ΣMsf. The program first performs a full safety analysis until failure and then it recalculates the last step before the target value of ΣMsf in order to reach the target exactly. 
  * Incremental Multipliers (5)  Reduction of the soil interface strength parameters by using Incremental Multipliers option. 

  
UseUpdatedMesh  |  Use updated mesh  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the use of an updated mesh. 
  * False  Disables the use of an updated mesh. 

  
UseUpdatedWaterPressures  |  Use updated water pressures  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the use of updated water pressures. 
  * False  Disables the use of water pressures. 

  
UseDefaultIterationParams  |  Use default iteration parameters  |  \-  | 

  * True  Default parameters will be used for the iterative procedure. 
  * False  Parameters used for the iterative procedure will be defined manually. 

  
OverRelaxation  |  Over relaxation  |  \-  |  Over relaxation factor that is used to reduce the number of iterations needed.   
ArcLengthControl  |  Arc length control  |  \-  | 

  * On  Phase will use arc length control. 
  * Off  Parameters used for the iterative procedure will be defined manually. 
  * Auto  Use of arc length control will be decided by the kernel. 

  
UseLineSearch  |  Use line search  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the use of line search. 
  * False  Disables the use of line search. 

  
IgnoreUndrainedBehaviour  |  Ignore undrained behaviour  |  \-  | 

  * True  Undrained behaviour will be ignored in this phase. 
  * False  Undrained behaviour will not be ignored in this phase. 

  
ForceFullyDrainedOnActivation  |  forcefullydrainedonactivation  |  \-  | 

  * True  Forces fully drained behaviour in newly activated cluster. 
  * False  Does not force fully drained behaviour in newly activated cluster. 

  
IgnoreSuction  |  Ignore suction  |  \-  | 

  * True  Ignores the use of suction. 
  * False  Suction is taken into account. 

  
ResetDisplacementsToZero  |  Reset displacements to zero  |  \-  | 

  * True  Displacements will be reset to zero in this phase. 
  * False  Displacements will not be reset to zero in this phase. 

  
ResetSmallStrain  |  Reset small strain  |  \-  | 

  * True  Small strains will be reset to zero in this phase. 
  * False  Small strains will not be reset to zero in this phase. 

  
ResetTime  |  Reset time  |  \-  | 

  * True  Time parameter will be reset to zero in this phase. 
  * False  Time parameter will not be reset to zero in this phase. 

  
ResetStateVariables  |  Reset state variables  |  \-  | 

  * True  State variables will be set to default at the start of this phase. 
  * False  State variables will not be set to default at the start of this phase. 

  
CavitationStress  |  Cavitation stress  |  \-  |  Cavitation stress.   
UseCavitationCutOff  |  Use cavitation cut-off  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the use of cavitation cut-off. 
  * False  Disables the use of cavitation cut-off. 

  
TimeStepDetermType  |  Time step determination  |  \-  | 

  * Automatic  Automatic time step determination. 
  * Manual  Time step determination chosen by a user. 

  
FirstTimeStep  |  First time step  |  \-  |  User-defined first time step, which overrides the critical step.   
MinTimeStep  |  Minimal time step  |  \-  |  Minimal time step value.   
MaxTimeStep  |  Maximal time step  |  \-  |  Maximal time step value.   
MaxSteps  |  Maximum steps  |  \-  |  Maximum number of additional calculation steps.   
MaxLoadFractionPerStep  |  Maximum load fraction per step  |  \-  |  Amount of load fraction per step.   
MaxIterations  |  Maximum iterations  |  \-  |  Maximum allowable number of iterations within any individual calculation step.   
MaxUnloadingSteps  |  Maximum unloading steps  |  \-  |  Maximum allowable number of unloading steps until failure is assumed.   
ToleratedError  |  Tolerated error  |  \-  |  Maximum allowed error of the numerical calculation.   
UseGradualError  |  Use gradual error  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the use of gradual error. 
  * False  Disables the use of gradual error. 

  
DesiredMaxIterations  |  Desired maximum iterations  |  \-  |  Desired maximum number of iterations per calculation step.   
DesiredMinIterations  |  Desired minimum iterations  |  \-  |  Desired minimum number of iterations per calculation step.   
SumMweight  |  Sum M weight  |  \-  |  Total multiplier for the material weight.   
IsModified  |  IsModified  |  \-  | 

  * True  Indicates that the load condition file should be rewritten. 
  * False  Indicates that the load condition file shouldn't be rewritten. 

  
UseSubspaceAccelerator  |  UseSubspaceAccelerator  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the use of subspace accelerator for the calculation. 
  * False  Disables the use of subspace accelerator for the calculation. 

  
SubspaceSize  |  SubspaceSize  |  \-  |  Value of the subspace size for subspace accelerator. Default value is 3.

## GUID-7F121703-D18A-4263-B9A4-8C95E1EA4F9B.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

#  importpointcloud (ipc)

Imports a point cloud and creates a surface that matches those points. 

## Signature
    
    
    importpointcloud [Coords_Bounding_Box] [Grid_Points] [Polynomial_Degree] [Continuity] <File>
    	Coords_Bounding_Box : Coords_Bottom_Left Coords_Top_Left
    		Coords_Bottom_Left : (x y z)
    		Coords_Top_Left : (x y z)
    	Grid_Points : gridx gridy
    	Polynomial_Degree: min_degree max_degree
    	Continuity: "c0" | "g1" | "c1" | "g2" | "c2" | "c3"
    

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
x  | float  |  x-coordinate of bottom-left or top-left corner point on the XY plane   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate of bottom-left or top-left corner point on the XY plane   
z  | float  | z-coordinate of bottom-left or top-left corner point on the XY plane   
gridx  | float  |  Grid points in the x-direction   
gridy  | float  |  Grid points in the y-direction   
min_degree  | float  |  Min polynomial degree   
max_degree  | float  |  Max polynomial degree   
"c0" | str  | Continuity. Only geometric continuity   
"g1" | str  | Continuity. For each point on the curve, the tangent vectors "on the right" and "on the left" are co-linear with the same orientation   
"c1" | str  |  Continuity of the first derivative. The "C1" curve is also "G1" but, in addition, the tangent vectors " on the right" and "on the left" are equal   
"g2" | str  | Continuity. For each point on the curve, the normalized normal vectors "on the right" and "on the left" are equal   
"c2" | str  |  Continuity of the second derivative. The "c2" curve is also "g2" but, in addition, the main directions of the curves also match.   
"c3" | str  |  Continuity of the third derivative.   
File  | str  |  File name with the points that are to be imported   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

NURBSSurface 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Imports a points cloud and creates a NURBS surface that matches those points. It detects a best-fitting plane so it can be used to arbitrarily oriented surfaces. 

_Example:_
    
    
    importpointcloud "D:\mypoints.txt"

Imports a points cloud and creates a surface that matches those points.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Imports a points cloud and creates a surface. 

_Example:_
    
    
    importpointcloud (0 0 0) (50 50 0) 10 10 "D:\mypoints.txt"

Imports points from the file and places it at the pointed coordinates with 10 grid points in x- and 10 in y-direction.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Imports a points cloud and creates a surface. 

_Example:_
    
    
    importpointcloud (0 0 0) (50 50 0) 10 10 1 2 "D:\mypoints.txt"

Imports a points cloud, creates a surface and places it at the pointed coordinates with 10 grid points in x- and 10 in y-direction, with specified minimum and maximum polynomial degrees.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Imports a points cloud and creates a surface. 

_Example:_
    
    
    importpointcloud (0 0 0) (50 50 0) 10 10 1 2 "c1" "D:\mypoints.txt"

Imports a points cloud, creates a surface and places it at the pointed coordinates with 10 grid points in x- and 10 in y-direction, minimum and maximum polynomial degrees and specified continuity code.

## See also

[import](GUID-BF60F423-93C6-4891-8BBD-6A036B1B4153.html)

## GUID-7F9898FC-3C40-4C78-8C27-FBAD15517782.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  addedmass (am)

Adds added mass features tosurfaces. 

## Signature
    
    
    addedmass  <surface> [surface]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
     surface: {<startpoint> <point> <point> [point]...} | polyc_obj | srf_obj}
    	startpoint: {(x y z)} | pt_obj
    	point:	{(x y z)} | pt_obj	
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [AddedMass](GUID-836EAD36-683B-4B5C-83C9-D571260C78D1.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point(s) for which an AddedMass object should start or end   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Polycurve object reference, Name of the polycurve to which an AddedMass object should be added   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which an AddedMass object should be added   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [AddedMass](GUID-836EAD36-683B-4B5C-83C9-D571260C78D1.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [AddedMass](GUID-836EAD36-683B-4B5C-83C9-D571260C78D1.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[AddedMass](GUID-836EAD36-683B-4B5C-83C9-D571260C78D1.html),  [Polygon](GUID-41820D20-39F0-4968-AC4B-FC589E7EB18E.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds added mass features to one or more  surfaces in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    addedmass Polygon_1

Adds an added mass feature to Polygon_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    addedmass (Polygon_6 Polygon_4)

Adds added mass features to Polygon_6 and Polygon_4.

_Example:_
    
    
    addedmass (1 4 0) (2 3 0) (4 5 0)

Creates a new surface between three points with coordinates (1, 4, 0), (2, 3, 0) and (4, 5, 0) and adds an added mass feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    addedmass Point_1 Point_2 (4 5 0)

Creates a new surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a point with coordinates (4, 5, 0) and adds an added mass feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    addedmass Polycurve_1

Adds an added mass feature to closed Polycurve_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    addedmass Group_1

Adds added mass features to all structural surfaces in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only surfaces.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds added mass features to one or more existing surfaces in the geometry and directly set their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    addedmass Polygon_1 "Material" Footing

Adds an added mass feature to Polygon_1 and sets the material to Footing.

_Example:_
    
    
    addedmass (Polygon_1 Polygon_3) "Material" Footing

Adds an added mass feature to Polygon_1 and Polygon_3 and sets the material to Footing for both added masss.

_Example:_
    
    
    addedmass Point_1 Point_2 (5 6 0) "Material" Footing

Creates a new surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a new point with coordinates (5, 6, 0), adds an added mass feature to it and sets the material to Footing.

## See also

[surface](GUID-60600C86-7D70-4160-997A-A81DB39A36DB.html)

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

#  unassign (ua)

Unassign the assignment of a property to none. 

## Signature
    
    
    unassign <plx_obj> [Param]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  The object's property considered to be unassigned.   
Param  | any  |  Parameter(s) for the command that should be applied, e.g. the Phase object when in green modes.   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures, Flow conditions, Staged construction |  Global | Object property   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Unassign the assignment of a property to none in Structures mode. 

_Example:_
    
    
    unassign Polygon_1.Soil.Material

Unassigns the material data set from the Material property of the Soil object, which is a feature of Polygon_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    unassign (Polygon_1.Soil.Material Polygon_2.Soil.Material)

Unassigns the material data sets from the Material properties of the Soil_1_1 and Soil_2_1 objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    unassign Line_1.LineDisplacement.LineDisplacement.Multiplierx

Unassigns the dynamic multiplier from the Multiplierx property of the dynamic line displacement, which is a feature of Line_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    unassign Line_2.GWFlowBC.DischargeFunction

Unassigns the discharge function from the groundwater flow boundary condition (GWFlowBC) property, which is a feature of Line_2. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Unassign the assignment of a property to none in Staged construction mode. 

_Example:_
    
    
    unassign Soil_1_1.Material Phase_1

Unassigns the material data set from the Material property of the Soil_1_1 object, in Phase_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    unassign (Soil_1_1.Material Soil_2_1.Material) Phase_1

Unassigns the material data sets from the Material properties of the Soil_1_1 and Soil_2_1 objects, in Phase_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    unassign Line_1.LineDisplacement.LineDisplacement.Multiplierx Phase_3

Unassigns the dynamic multiplier from the Multiplierx property of the dynamic line displacement, which is a feature of Line_1, in Phase_3. 

_Example:_
    
    
    _unassign (DynLineDisplacement_1_1.Multiplierx DynLineDisplacement_1_2.Multiplierx) Phase_3

Unassigns the dynamic multipliers from the Multiplierx property of both dynamic line displacements, DynLineDisplacement_1_1 and DynLineDisplacement_1_2, in Phase_3. 

_Example:_
    
    
    unassign Line_2.GWFlowBC.DischargeFunction Phases[-1]

Unassigns the discharge function from the groundwater flow boundary condition (GWFlowBC) property, which is a feature of Line_2, in the lastly created phase.

[set](GUID-7CCCA1E8-2744-47CE-A26A-A82D1D55245E.html)

#  connection (co)

Creates a connection between two objects: the custom part and the reference part. 

## Signature
    
    
    connection <plx_obj plx_obj>

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  PLAXIS object reference, name of the objects that should be connected.   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

Connection 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a connection between two staged user features: the custom part and the reference part.

_Example:_
    
    
    connection Plate_2_1 Plate_1_1

Creates a connection between Plate_2_1 and Plate_1_1.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a connection between two cut objects.

_Example:_
    
    
    connection (Polygon_2 Polygon_1)

Creates a connection between Polygon_2 and Polygon_1.

#  DiscontinuityMat3D

Material set that can be assigned to a discontinuity. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the discontinuity material.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the discontinuity material.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the discontinuity material object.   
Identification  |  Identification  |  \-  |  Identification of the discontinuity material.   
Colour  |  Colour  |  \-  |  Colour of the discontinuity material.   
MaterialModel  |  Material model  |  \-  |  Mohr-Coulomb Sets the discontinuity material to Mohr-Coulomb.   
DrainageType  |  Drainage type  |  \-  | 

  * Drained  Drained behaviour. 
  * Non-porous  Material behaviour in which pore pressures cannot occur. 

  
NormalStiffness  |  NormalStiffness, k n |  Force/Length 3 |  Elastic discontinuity normal stiffness.

StrengthMethod  |  Strength method  |  \-  | 

  * Peak  Peak strength of the discontinuity.

cRef  |  Cohesion, c' |  Force/Length 2 |  Cohesion of the discontinuity.

psi  |  Dilatancy angle, ψ, psi  |  °  |  Dilatancy angle of the discontinuity.

Creates an anchor material set. 

## Signature
    
    
    anchormat [{PropName PropValue}]...
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [AnchorMat](GUID-2E13896D-FB89-4BE9-83FE-30C2291F98D9.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14).

## GUID-87FA745B-DD8E-4488-A20B-131F6BEAE1E4.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  posinterface (pif)

Adds positive interface features tosurfaces. 

## Signature
    
    
    posinterface  <surface> [surface]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
     surface: {<startpoint> <point> <point> [point]...} | polyc_obj | srf_obj}
    	startpoint: {(x y z)} | pt_obj
    	point:	{(x y z)} | pt_obj	
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [PositiveInterface](GUID-1D180A7C-F2BB-4B57-838C-9DA6737EADAA.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point(s) for which a PositiveInterface object should start or end   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Polycurve object reference, Name of the polycurve to which a PositiveInterface object should be added   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which a PositiveInterface object should be added   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [PositiveInterface](GUID-1D180A7C-F2BB-4B57-838C-9DA6737EADAA.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [PositiveInterface](GUID-1D180A7C-F2BB-4B57-838C-9DA6737EADAA.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[PositiveInterface](GUID-1D180A7C-F2BB-4B57-838C-9DA6737EADAA.html),  [Polygon](GUID-41820D20-39F0-4968-AC4B-FC589E7EB18E.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds positive interface features to one or more  surfaces in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    posinterface Polygon_1

Adds a positive interface feature to Polygon_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    posinterface (Polygon_6 Polygon_4)

Adds positive interface features to Polygon_6 and Polygon_4.

_Example:_
    
    
    posinterface (1 4 0) (2 3 0) (4 5 0)

Creates a new surface between three points with coordinates (1, 4, 0), (2, 3, 0) and (4, 5, 0) and adds a positive interface feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    posinterface Point_1 Point_2 (4 5 0)

Creates a new surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a point with coordinates (4, 5, 0) and adds a positive interface feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    posinterface Polycurve_1

Adds a positive interface feature to closed Polycurve_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    posinterface Group_1

Adds positive interface features to all structural surfaces in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only surfaces.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds positive interface features to one or more existing surfaces in the geometry and directly set their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    posinterface Polygon_1 "Material" Footing

Adds a positive interface feature to Polygon_1 and sets the material to Footing.

_Example:_
    
    
    posinterface (Polygon_1 Polygon_3) "Material" Footing

Adds a positive interface feature to Polygon_1 and Polygon_3 and sets the material to Footing for both positive interfaces.

_Example:_
    
    
    posinterface Point_1 Point_2 (5 6 0) "Material" Footing

Creates a new surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a new point with coordinates (5, 6, 0), adds a positive interface feature to it and sets the material to Footing.

## See also

[surface](GUID-60600C86-7D70-4160-997A-A81DB39A36DB.html)

#  embeddedbeam (ebm)

Adds embedded beam features to lines. 

## Signature
    
    
    embeddedbeam <line> [line]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
     line:{<startpoint> <point> <point> |  ln_obj |  polyc_obj}
    	startpoint: (x y z) | pt_obj
    	point:	{"absolute" {(x y z) | pt_obj}} | {"relative" (x y z)} | {"angles" (Ang Ang) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj }} | {"vector" (dirx diry dirz) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj}}
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [EmbeddedBeam](GUID-45C76C79-D6B5-4BD2-849A-24CA6C95A02E.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point(s) for which a EmbeddedBeam object should start or end   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference, Name of the line to which a EmbeddedBeam object should be added   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Polycurve object reference, Name of the polycurve to which a EmbeddedBeam object should be added   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which the created EmbeddedBeam should snap   
slvol_obj  | obj  | Soil volume object reference, Name of the soil volume to which the created EmbeddedBeam should snap   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference, Name of the volume to which the created EmbeddedBeam should snap   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or angle ("angles")   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
z  | float  | z-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
dirx  | float  |  Vector component ("vector")   
diry  | float  |  Vector component ("vector")   
dirz  | float  | Vector component ("vector")   
Ang  | float  | Angle of the line with respect to the reference axis  
Len  | float  |  Vector length ("vector")   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [EmbeddedBeam](GUID-45C76C79-D6B5-4BD2-849A-24CA6C95A02E.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [EmbeddedBeam](GUID-45C76C79-D6B5-4BD2-849A-24CA6C95A02E.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[EmbeddedBeam](GUID-45C76C79-D6B5-4BD2-849A-24CA6C95A02E.html), [Point](GUID-B66BC755-E798-4237-AA8F-FC607481D430.html), [Line](GUID-EA175FC9-E4E6-4FD3-97C0-4F1F3624D025.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds embedded beam features to one or more lines in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    embeddedbeam Line_1

Adds an embedded beam feature to Line_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    embeddedbeam (Line_6 Line 4)

Adds embedded beam features to Line_6 and Line_4.

_Example:_
    
    
    embeddedbeam (1 4 0) (2 3 0)

Creates a new line between three points with coordinates (1, 4, 0)and (2, 3, 0)  and adds an embedded beam feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    embeddedbeam Point_1 Point_2 (4 5 0)

Creates a new line between Point_1, Point_2 and a point with coordinates (4, 5, 0) and adds an embedded beam feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    embeddedbeam Polycurve_1

Adds an embedded beam feature to closed Polycurve_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    embeddedbeam 1 2 0 "relative" 3 4 8

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 0) to another new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y- and 8 in the z-direction from the first point at (4, 6, 8). Creates a line from coordinates (1, 2, 0) to (4, 6, 8) and adds an embedded beam feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    embeddedbeam Point_1 "relative" 3 4 8 -5 -9 10 "angles" 0 30 16

Creates a line from Point_1 (1, 2, 0) to a new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y-, and 8 in the z-direction from the first point at (4, 6, 8). From that new point a line is created to another new point which is -5 in the x-, -9 in the y-  and 10 in the z-direction from the previous point at (-1, -3, 18). From that point a new line is created which has an angle of 0 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 30 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 16. This line ends at coordinates (12.86, -3, 26).Adds embedded beam features to all lines.

_Example:_
    
    
    embeddedbeam (1 2 3) "angles" 45 50 10 "absolute" (4 5 6)

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 3) which has an angle of 45 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 50 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 10. Then creates a line from the end point of the first line to a new point with coordinates (4, 5, 6) and adds embedded beam features to all lines.

_Example:_
    
    
    embeddedbeam Group_1

Adds embedded beam features to all structural surfaces in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only surfaces.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds embedded beam features to one or more existing lines in the geometry and directly set their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    embeddedbeam Line_1 "Material" Pile

Adds an embedded beam feature to Line_1 and sets the material to Pile.

_Example:_
    
    
    embeddedbeam (Line_1 Line_3) "Material" Pile

Adds an embedded beam feature to Line_1 and Line_3 and sets the material to Pile for both embedded beams.

_Example:_
    
    
    embeddedbeam Point_1 (5 6 0) "Material" Pile

Creates a new line between Point_1 and a new point with coordinates (5, 6, 0), adds an embedded beam feature to it and sets the material to Pile.

_Example:_
    
    
    embeddedbeam 1 2 0 "relative" 3 4 8 "Material" Pile

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 0) to another new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y- and 8 in the z-direction from the first point at (4, 6, 8). Creates a line from coordinates (1, 2, 0) to (4, 6, 8), adds an embedded beam feature to it and sets the material to Pile.

## See also

[line](GUID-A7671899-36CF-4CF1-B1EA-D8C754F013BB.html), [embeddedbeammat](GUID-DE87AA6E-3C26-4E41-98E7-4B9286D0FCC6.html)

# beammat (mbm)

Creates a beam material set. 

## Signature
    
    
    beammat [{PropName PropValue}]]...
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [BeamMat](GUID-1AF4F8EE-0D29-472B-873B-52B848565AE3.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
PropName  | str  |  Property name. Details on the available properties at object [BeamMat](GUID-1AF4F8EE-0D29-472B-873B-52B848565AE3.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  |  Property value. Details on the available properties at object [BeamMat](GUID-1AF4F8EE-0D29-472B-873B-52B848565AE3.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[BeamMat](GUID-1AF4F8EE-0D29-472B-873B-52B848565AE3.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates an embedded beam material set with no specified properties. It is not possible to calculate with this material before editing it to make its properties valid. 

_Example:_
    
    
    embeddedbeammat

Creates a new embedded beam material set. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates an embedded beam material set with specified properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    embeddedbeammat "Identification" "Piles" "MaterialType" "Elastic" "Gamma" 24 "E" 10000000 "Diameter" 0.25 "TSkinStartMax" 1 "TSkinEndMax" 100 "FMax" 100

Creates a new embedded beam material set with different pairs of properties and values. 

## See also

[ embeddedbeam (ebm)](GUID-886C96D7-3224-422C-903A-5F308D18323A.html)

#  arrayr (arr)

Creates an array from one or more objects. 

## Signature
    
    
    arrayr {<bh_obj>... <Num> <x y>} | {<pt_obj> | <ln_obj> | <polyc_obj> | <tn_obj> | <srf_obj> | <vol_obj>}... <Num> <x y z> | {<pt_obj> | <ln_obj> | <polyc_obj> | <tn_obj> |<srf_obj> | <vol_obj>}... <Rows> <x y z> <Columns> <x y z> { <pt_obj> | <ln_obj> | <polyc_obj> | <tn_obj> | <srf_obj> | <vol_obj>}... <Rows> <x y z> <Columns> <x y z> <Levels> <x y z>}

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
bh_obj  | obj  | Name of the borehole from which an array should be created   
pt_obj  | obj  |  Name of the point from which an array should be created   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Name of the line from which an array should be created   
polyc_obj  | obj  |  Name of the polycurve from which an array should be created   
tn_obj  | obj  |  Name of the tunnel from which an array should be created   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Name of the structural surface from which an array is to be created   
vol_obj  | obj  |  Name of the volume from which an array is to be created   
x  | float  |  Interval in the x-direction   
y  | float  |  Interval in the y-direction   
z  | float  | Interval in the z-direction   
Num  | int  |  Desired number of objects in the array   
Rows  | int  | Desired number of rows in the array   
Columns  | int  | Desired number of columns in the array   
Levels  | int  | Interval between the newly created objects in the array   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

{1,...} Object 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates an array from a borehole, with a specified number of new boreholes at a specified interval. 

_Example:_
    
    
    arrayr Borehole_1 2 0 5

Creates an array from Borehole_1 with 2 newly created boreholes at an interval of (0, 5).). 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a two-dimensional array from a selected object, with a specified number of rows and columns and columns at the specified intervals. 

_Example:_
    
    
    arrayr Point_1 2 (1 5 0) 3 (6 4 8) 

Creates an array from Point_1 with 2 rows at an interval of (1, 5) and 3 columns at an interval of (6, 4 8). 

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Creates an array from a selected object, with a specified number of new objects at a specified interval. 

_Example:_
    
    
    arrayr Point_1 2 (1 5 0)

Creates an array from Point_1 with 2 newly created points at an interval of (1, 5). 

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Creates a three-dimensional array from a selected object, with a specified number of rows, columns and pages at the specified intervals. 

_Example:_
    
    
    arrayr Point_1 2 (1 5 0) 3 (6 4 8) 5 (7 10 9)

Creates a three-dimensional array from Point_1 with 2 rows at an interval of (1, 5, 0), 3 columns at an interval of (6, 4, 8) and 5 levels at an interval of (7, 10, 9).

## See also

[arrayp](GUID-99F68BB5-EAD3-44F9-9EFE-4F2EA293C752.html)

#  __writephasestomesh (__wpm)

Writes water and load conditions to files. 

## Signature
    
    
    __writephasestomesh [ph_obj]... [B] 

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
ph_obj  | obj  |  Phase object reference, name of the phase for which the water and load conditions should be written   
B  | bool  |  Boolean, True enables the option to write all water and load conditions regardless of whether they were changed, false enables that only the modified parts should be written   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Flow conditions, Staged construction |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Writes the modified parts of the water and load conditions in all phases to the files used by the calculation kernel. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __writephasestomesh

Writes the modified parts of the water and load conditions in all phases.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Writes all water and load conditions in all phases to the files used by the calculation kernel. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __writephasestomesh True

Writes all water and load conditions in all phases.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Writes the modified parts of the water and load conditions in one or more phases to the files used by the calculation kernel. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __writephasestomesh (InitialPhase Phase_1)

Writes the modified parts of the water and load conditions in the initial phase and Phase_1.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Writes all water and load conditions in one or more phases to the files used by the calculation kernel. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __writephasestomesh (Phase_1 Phase_2) True

Writes all water and load conditions of Phase_1 and Phase_2 regardless of whether they were changed.
