#  intersectsegments ()

Intersects sub sections of a tunnel cross section. 

## Signature
    
    
    intersectsegments <seg_obj | sub_polyc_obj> <seg_obj | sub_polyc_obj>...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
seg_obj  | obj  |  Name of the segments that should be intersected   
sub_polyc_obj  | obj  |  Name of the subsection polycurve that should be intersected   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Tunnel cross section   
  
## Objects created

[Segment](GUID-FA4769B6-2597-4755-A7B4-299E6345B4F1.html), [Subsection polycurve](GUID-F39EBCD2-A90F-49BC-9C88-38C743323CAF.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Intersects two or more segments or subsection polycurves and removes the original objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    intersectsegments Tunnel_1.CrossSection (Tunnel_1.CrossSection.Subsections[0] Tunnel_1.CrossSection.Segments[0])

Intersects a segments and a subsection polycurve of Tunnel_1.

[addsubcurve](GUID-31EC4FE6-7391-4B75-B854-541EC11D0E53.html) , [insertsubcurve](GUID-6C9251A3-736D-4C91-ADC3-CBA69C32C0FB.html) , [tunnel](GUID-D750CED7-5801-425F-BE0F-142EC33000B3.html) , [generatetunnel](GUID-B173EDB3-DD3C-46C6-91F4-0299EF6695BC.html) , [symmetricclose](GUID-BB96CF95-505C-4C0F-80FE-42752865EF4B.html) , [insertsubcurve](GUID-6C9251A3-736D-4C91-ADC3-CBA69C32C0FB.html)

  * Closed  The Ymin boundary of the model will be closed.

#  setsoillayerporepressure ( slpp)

Changes the pore pressures of a soil layer. 

## Signature
    
    
    setsoillayerporepressure <bh_obj> <sll_obj> <Ptop> <Pbottom>

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
bh_obj  | obj  |  Name of the borehole where the pore pressures should be changed   
sll_obj  | obj  |  Name of the soil layer of which the pore pressures should be changed   
Ptop  | float  |  New value of the pore pressure at the top of the soil layer   
Pbottom  | float  |  New value of the pore pressure at the bottom of the soil layer   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Changes the pore pressures at the top and bottom of a soil layer at a specified borehole. The water conditions of the soil layer should be set to 'User defined'. 

_Example:_
    
    
    setsoillayerporepressure Borehole_1 Soillayer_1 -1 -12

Changes the pore pressure at the top of Soillayer_1 to -1 and the pore pressure at the bottom of Soillayer_1 to -12. 

## See also

[getsoillayerlevel](GUID-91F3E651-13EF-4EF2-9C9F-CF804B655434.html), [getsoillayerporepressure ](GUID-C3B16A43-34CD-4DF5-AF82-BF3A7350D39A.html), [insertsoillayer](GUID-454F69DC-24F1-4364-A10D-ACF0BB00EA84.html), [setsoillayerlevel](GUID-92DCA340-D424-4070-ABAF-B8F9EAA826EE.html)

#  CRS

Simulates a Constant Rate-of-Strain Compression Test. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name given to the test   
Caption  | Caption  | \-  | Caption of the test   
PreconsolidationPressure  |  |Vertical precons. stress|  |  Force/Length 2 |  Vertical preconsolidation stress   
ApplyMobilisedShearStrength  |  Apply mob. rel. shear strength  |  \-  |  Apply mobilised shear strength, which can be set to True or False.   
MobilisedShearStrength  |  Mob. rel. shear strength  |  \-  |  Mobilised relative shear strength. This value must be between 0 (isotropic stress state) and 1 (failure state).   
PhaseTable[n].Duration  |  Duration  |  day  |  Duration of the n th phase   
PhaseTable[n].Epsinc  |  Strain Increment  |  Force/Length 2 |  Strain increment of the n th phase   
PhaseTable[n].Steps  |  Steps  |  \-  |  Number of steps of the n th phase   
Error  | Tolerated error  | \-  | Tolerated error (read-only and set to 0.01)   
Relax  | Over-relaxation factor  | \-  | Over-relaxation factor (read-only and set to 1.0)   
Iteration  | Maximum number of iterations  | \-  | Maximum number of iterations (read-only and set to 50)   
ArcLength  | Arc-length control  | \-  | Arc-length control setting (read-only and set to False)   
Phases  | Phases  | \-  | List of phases

#  setwaterinterpolate (swint)

Sets that the pore pressure of one or more soil features should be interpolated. 

## Signature
    
    
    setwaterinterpolate <plx_obj>... [ph_obj]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  Name of the object(s) or phase(s) of which the pore pressure should be interpolated   
ph_obj  | obj  |  Name of the phase(s) in which the pore pressure should be interpolated   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Mesh, Flow conditions, Staged construction |  Object | Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Sets that the pore pressure of one or more soil features should be interpolated in a specified phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    setwaterinterpolate BoreholeVolume_1_1 InitialPhase

Sets that pore pressure of BoreholeVolume_1_1 should be interpolated in the InitialPhase.

_Example:_
    
    
    setwaterinterpolate (BoreholeVolume_1_1 BoreholeVolume_2_1) InitialPhase

Sets that pore pressure of BoreholeVolume_1_1 and BoreholeVolume_2_1 should be interpolated in the InitialPhase.

_Example:_
    
    
    setwaterinterpolate Soil_1_1 InitialPhase Phase_1

Sets that pore pressure of Soil_1_1 should be interpolated in the InitialPhase and Phase_1.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Sets that the pore pressure of a soil features should be interpolated in one or more specified phases. 

_Example:_
    
    
    setwaterinterpolate Soils (InitialPhase Phase_1)

Sets that pore pressure of all soils in the list of soils should be interpolated in the InitialPhase and Phase_1.

## See also

[setwaterdry](GUID-EE786935-8CD0-426F-92CC-D8482F867185.html), [setwaterlevel](GUID-0B60CE1E-E4A5-4FA1-8F4A-CE6043693C17.html)

**Parent topic:** [ Input commands reference ](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html)

#  neginterface (nif)

Adds negative interface features tosurfaces. 

## Signature
    
    
    neginterface  <surface> [surface]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
     surface: {<startpoint> <point> <point> [point]...} | polyc_obj | srf_obj}
    	startpoint: {(x y z)} | pt_obj
    	point:	{(x y z)} | pt_obj	
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [NegativeInterface](GUID-8497888C-3D20-42CE-AA73-68CBC4138DEE.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point(s) for which a NegativeInterface object should start or end   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Polycurve object reference, Name of the polycurve to which a NegativeInterface object should be added   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which a NegativeInterface object should be added   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [NegativeInterface](GUID-8497888C-3D20-42CE-AA73-68CBC4138DEE.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [NegativeInterface](GUID-8497888C-3D20-42CE-AA73-68CBC4138DEE.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[NegativeInterface](GUID-8497888C-3D20-42CE-AA73-68CBC4138DEE.html),  [Polygon](GUID-41820D20-39F0-4968-AC4B-FC589E7EB18E.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds negative interface features to one or more  surfaces in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    neginterface Polygon_1

Adds a negative interface feature to Polygon_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    neginterface (Polygon_6 Polygon_4)

Adds negative interface features to Polygon_6 and Polygon_4.

_Example:_
    
    
    neginterface (1 4 0) (2 3 0) (4 5 0)

Creates a new surface between three points with coordinates (1, 4, 0), (2, 3, 0) and (4, 5, 0) and adds a positive interface feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    neginterface Point_1 Point_2 (4 5 0)

Creates a new surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a point with coordinates (4, 5, 0) and adds a negative interface feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    neginterface Polycurve_1

Adds a negative interface feature to closed Polycurve_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    neginterface Group_1

Adds negative interface features to all structural surfaces in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only surfaces.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds negative interface features to one or more existing surfaces in the geometry and directly set their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    neginterface Polygon_1 "Material" Footing

Adds a negative interface feature to Polygon_1 and sets the material to Footing.

_Example:_
    
    
    neginterface (Polygon_1 Polygon_3) "Material" Footing

Adds a negative interface feature to Polygon_1 and Polygon_3 and sets the material to Footing for both negative interfaces.

_Example:_
    
    
    neginterface Point_1 Point_2 (5 6 0) "Material" Footing

Creates a new surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a new point with coordinates (5, 6, 0), adds a negative interface feature to it and sets the material to Footing.

## See also

[surface](GUID-60600C86-7D70-4160-997A-A81DB39A36DB.html)

#  getcrosssectionresults (gcsres)

Generates a table with the calculation results of a cross section. 

## Signature
    
    
    getcrosssectionresults <plot_obj> <{ph_obj | step_obj}> <ResultType> [B]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plot_obj  | obj  |  Plot object reference, plot from which cross section plot should be generated   
ph_obj  | obj  |  Phase object reference, the phase for which the calculation results should be displayed   
step_obj  | obj  | Step object reference, the step for which the calculation results should be displayed   
ResultType  | str  |  Result type for which the calculation results should be displayed   
B  | bool  | Boolean   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
\-  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Generates a table with the calculation results of a cross section. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getcrosssectionresults Plots[-1] Phase_2 ResultTypes.Soil.Ux

Generates a table with the cross section results of displacement in x direction for Phase_2 for the lastly created plot.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Generates a table with the calculation results of a cross section without result smoothing. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getcrosssectionresults Plots[-1] Phase_1 ResultTypes.Soil.PActive False

Generates a table with the cross section results of active pore pressures for Phase_1 for the lastly created plot without result smoothing.

#  General

Simulates a user-defined soil test. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  | Name  |  \-  |  Name given to the test   
Caption  | Caption  | \-  | Caption of the test   
Behaviour  |  Behaviour  |  \-  |  Type of test - Drained or Undrained   
PreconsolidationPressure  |  |Vertical precons. stress  |  Force/Length 2 |  Vertical preconsolidation stress   
ApplyMobilisedShearStrength  |  Apply mob. rel. shear strength  |  \-  |  Apply mobilised shear strength, which can be set to True or False.   
MobilisedShearStrength  |  Mob. rel. shear strength  |  \-  |  Mobilised relative shear strength. This value must be between 0 (isotropic stress state) and 1 (failure state).   
Sigxxinit  |  σ xx |  Force/Length 2 |  Principal stresses in the x direction   
Sigyyinit  |  σ yy |  Force/Length 2 |  Principal stresses in the y direction   
Sigzzinit  |  σ zz |  Force/Length 2 |  Principal stresses in the z direction   
Sigxxinit  |  τ xy |  Force/Length 2 |  Initial stresses in the xy direction   
Sigxxinit  |  τ yz |  Force/Length 2 |  Initial stresses in the yz direction   
Sigxxinit  |  τ zx |  Force/Length 2 |  Initial stresses in the zx direction   
PhaseTable[n].Duration  |  Duration  |  day  |  Duration of the n th phase   
PhaseTable[n].Steps  |  Steps  |  \-  |  Number of steps of the n th phase   
Error  | Tolerated error  | \-  | Tolerated error (read-only and set to 0.01)   
Relax  | Over-relaxation factor  | \-  | Over-relaxation factor (read-only and set to 1.0)   
Iteration  | Maximum number of iterations  | \-  | Maximum number of iterations (read-only and set to 50)   
ArcLength  | Arc-length control  | \-  | Arc-length control setting (read-only and set to False)   
Phases  | Phases  | \-  | List of phases   
CyclicPhases  | \-  | \-  | List of cyclic phases as defined via the [markphasescyclic](GUID-65F6CFC0-6085-40B2-AD5E-C72A51E59474.html) command.

#  getsoillayerlevel (gsll)

Returns the location of a soil layer boundary at a borehole. 

## Signature
    
    
    getsoillayerlevel <bh_obj> <sl_num>

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
bh_obj  | obj  |  Name of a borehole whose soil layer boundary value should be returned.   
sl_num  | int  |  Number of a soil layer boundary whose location should be returned. The numbering of soil layer boundaries is 0-based, so the topmost soil layer boundary has number 0.   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Returns location of a soil layer boundary at a borehole. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getsoillayerlevel Borehole_1 0

Obtains location of the first soil layer boundary of Borehole_1.

## See also

[getsoillayerporepressure](GUID-C3B16A43-34CD-4DF5-AF82-BF3A7350D39A.html), [setsoillayerlevel](GUID-92DCA340-D424-4070-ABAF-B8F9EAA826EE.html)

#  setsoillayerlevel (sll)

Sets the borehole soil layer level. 

## Signature
    
    
    setsoillayerlevel <bh_obj> <{I Num}>...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
bh_obj  | obj  |  Name of borehole of which the soil layer level should be set   
I  | int  |  Level that separates the soil layers in which level 0 is considered to be the ground surface   
Num  | float  |  Elevation of the soil layer level   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Sets the borehole soil layer level. 

_Example:_
    
    
    setsoillayerlevel Borehole_1 1 -2

Sets the bottom level of soil layer of Borehole_1 to 2. 

_Example:_
    
    
    setsoillayerlevel Borehole_1 (1 -2) (2 -3.5)

Sets the bottom level of the first soil layer of Borehole_1 to -2 and the bottom level of the second soil layer to -3.5.

_Example:_
    
    
    setsoillayerlevel Borehole_1 0 -0.5 (1 -2) 2 -3.5

Sets the top level of the first soil layer of Borehole_1 to -0.5, the bottom level of the first soil layer to -2 and the bottom level of the second soil layer to -3.5.

## See also

[getsoillayerlevel](GUID-91F3E651-13EF-4EF2-9C9F-CF804B655434.html), [getsoillayerporepressure ](GUID-C3B16A43-34CD-4DF5-AF82-BF3A7350D39A.html), [insertsoillayer](GUID-454F69DC-24F1-4364-A10D-ACF0BB00EA84.html), [setsoillayerporepressure](GUID-8E069E78-FF7C-437B-B3B6-C4BF128FDA71.html)

#  __dumpfixities (__dfx)

Displays a list of all fixities. 

## Signature
    
    
    __dumpfixities <ph_obj | step_obj> [Opt]
    	Opt: {Criterion (x y z)} | (x y z) | Criterion 
    		Criterion: {"position" | "x-axis fixity" | "y-axis fixity" | "z-axis fixity" | "rotational fixity"} | Combination 

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
ph_obj  | obj  |  The phase for which the prescribed displacements should be displayed   
step_obj  | obj  |  The step for which the prescribed displacements should be displayed   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
Criterion | Combination  | str  |  Position, x-axis fixity or y-axis fixity or z-axis fixity or rotational fixity or combination of these   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Output  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays a list of all fixities. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __dumpfixities Phase_1

Displays a list of all fixities for Phase_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    __dumpfixities Step_14

Displays a list of all fixities for Step_14.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Displays a list of all fixities for a phase at specific coordinates. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __dumpfixities Phase_7 (0 0 0)

Displays a list of all fixities for Phase_7 at (0 0 0)

_Example:_
    
    
    __dumpfixities Step_14 (0 0 0)

Displays a list of all fixities for Step_14 at (0 0 0)

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Displays a list of all fixities for a phase for position, x, y or rotational fixity. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __dumpfixities Phase_1 'position' 'x'

Displays a list for Phase_1 for each position and if x-axis is fixed.

_Example:_
    
    
    __dumpfixities Phase_1 'position' 'x' 'y'

Displays a list for Phase_1 for each position and if both x-axis and y-axis are fixed.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Displays a list of all fixities for a phase for x, y or rotational fixity at specific coordinates. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __dumpfixities Phase_1 'position' 'x' (0 0 0)

Displays a list of all fixities Phase_1 for each position and if x-axis is fixed at (0 0 0).

[echo](GUID-44A4889C-A78D-417E-A303-9A6A22BF325D.html)

#  gotowater (gtw)

Switches to flow conditions mode. 

## Signature
    
    
    gotowater [B]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
B  | bool  |  Boolean, true creates a new intersection even if not necessary, false does not create an intersection unless necessary   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Switches from the current working mode to flow conditions mode. There has to be at least one volume or surface in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    gotowater

Switches from the current working mode to flow conditions mode.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Switches from the current working mode to flow condiitons mode with the possibility to create a new intersection regardless of whether there are any geometric changes. There has to be at least one volume or surface in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    gotowater true

Switches from the current working mode to flow conditions mode and creates a new intersection.

## See also

[gotomesh](GUID-AB747571-E828-46E6-A61C-0A272607711F.html), [gotosoil](GUID-C2B37282-D2E9-4F51-98D4-A0384519D230.html), [gotostages](GUID-21A0CB93-D360-4579-A71F-D6194E761C61.html), [gotostructures](GUID-2D2D4A90-8C0E-466E-B975-1D60CA11C77E.html), [gotoflow](GUID-6D24EBE0-FA81-4550-9869-B68365640F1D.html)

# NodetoNodeAnchor

Node-to-node anchor feature of a line. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the node-to-node anchor.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the node-to-node anchor.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  |  UserFeatures of node-to-node anchor.

  * True  Enables the option to adjust the prestress force that is applied to the node-to-node anchor. 
  * False  Disables the option to adjust the prestress force that is applied to the node-to-node anchor.

#  Flow

Flow feature on a phase, containing calculation parameters relevant to the flow calculation. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the flow object.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the flow object.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the flow object.   
Parent  |  Parent  |  \-  |  Name of the parent object of the flow feature.   
FirstTimeStep  |  First time step  |  Time  |  Increment of time used in the first step of analysis.   
MaxTimeStep  |  Maximum time step  |  Time  |  Maximum time step allowed for analysis.   
MinTimeStep  |  Minimum time step  |  Time  |  Minimum time step allowed for analysis   
MaxSteps  |  Maximum steps  |  \-  |  Maximum number of additional calculation steps.   
UseDefaultIterationParams  |  Use default iteration parameters  |  \-  | 

  * True  Default parameters will be used for the iterative procedure. 
  * False  Parameters used for the iterative procedure will be defined manually. 

  
OverRelaxation  |  Over relaxation  |  \-  |  Over relaxation factor that is used to reduce the number of iterations needed.   
MaxIterations  |  Maximum iterations  |  \-  |  Maximum allowable number of iterations within any individual calculation step.   
DesiredMaxIterations  |  Desired maximum iterations  |  \-  |  Desired maximum number of iterations per calculation step.   
DesiredMinIterations  |  Desired minimum iterations  |  \-  |  Desired minimum number of iterations per calculation step.   
ToleratedError  |  Tolerated error  |  \-  |  Maximum allowed error of the numerical calculation.   
IsModified  |  IsModified  |  \-  | 

  * True  Indicates that the load condition file should be rewritten. 
  * False  Indicates that the load condition file shouldn't be rewritten. 

  
ReferenceFlowAnalysis  | Include reference flow analysis  | \-  | 

  * True  Include a reference groundwater flow analysis. By default this considers a steady state ground water flow analysis. 
  * False  Prevents running a reference groundwater flow analysis. No steady state ground water flow analysis is computed. This is the default behaviour. 

  
ReferenceFlowCondition  | Reference flow condition  | \-  | When selected to include reference flow analysis (ReferenceFlowAnalysis = True), a steady state ground water flow analysis is computed by default.

# AnchorMat

Material set assigned to a fixed-end anchor or a node-to-node anchor. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the anchor material.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the anchor material.   
MaterialName  |  Identification  |  \-  |  Identification of the anchor material.   
Colour  |  Colour  |  \-  |  Colour of the anchor material.

  * No material type  No material type selected. 
  * Elastic  Sets anchor material behaviour to elastic. 
  * Elastoplastic  Sets anchor material behaviour to elastoplastic.

#  arrayp (arp)

Creates an array from one or more objects. 

## Signature
    
    
    arrayp {<pt_obj> | <ln_obj> | <polyc_obj> | <tn_obj> | <srf_obj> | <vol_obj>} <point> <Num> <Ang> <B>
    	point:	{(x y z)} | pt_obj	

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, point name   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference, Name of the line to which a another line feature should be added   
polyc_obj  | obj  |  Name of the polycurve from which an array should be created   
tn_obj  | obj  |  Name of the tunnel from which an array should be created   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Name of the structural surface from which an array is to be created   
vol_obj  | obj  |  Name of the volume from which an array is to be created   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate of the centre point around which the array is to be created   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate of the centre point around which the array is to be created   
z  | float  | z-coordinate of the centre point around which the array is to be created   
Num  | int  | Number of items to be created   
Ang  | float  |  Angle to fill, in degrees   
B  | bool  |  True rotates the created objects around the local axis of rotation, False does not rotate the created objects around the local axis of rotation   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

{1,...} Object 

_Purpose:_

A Creates an array from a specified object, with a specified number of items at the specified angles, with a possibility of rotating the objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    arrayp Line_1 (0 0 0) (0 0 1) 180 4 True

Creates an array from Line_1 with 4 items with an angle of 180 degrees to fill with rotation.

## See also

[arrayr](GUID-898C143C-A722-48FA-983A-AE3EAEABCB07.html)

#  insertpoint ()

Inserts a new point to an existing polygon or water level. 

## Signature
    
    
    insertpoint <pt_num> <point>
    	point:point:	{(x y z)} | pt_obj	

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_num  | int  |  Number of the point before which the new point should be inserted. The numbering of points is 0-based, so the first point has number 0.   
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, point name   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate or z-reference where the pore pressure is equal to zero for water levels   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures, Flow conditions |  Polygon | Water level   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Inserts a new point to an existing polygon before a specified point of the polygon. 

_Example:_
    
    
    insertpoint Polygon_1 5 (1 2 3)

Inserts a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 3) to Polygon_1 before the point at index 5.

_Example:_
    
    
    insertpoint Polygon_1 5 Point_2

Inserts a new point at the location of Point_2 to Polygon_1 before the point at index 5.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Inserts a new point to an existing water level before a specified point of the water level. 

_Example:_
    
    
    insertpoint UserWaterLevel_1 3 (2 6 4)

Inserts a new point with coordinates (2, 6, 4) with a z-reference of 4 to UserWaterLevel_1 before the point at index 3.

[addpoint](GUID-28FC204C-9A94-4B53-8630-C356010C2793.html) , [deletepoint](GUID-00824185-7952-4620-8BC0-B1D81873A84F.html) , [movepoint](GUID-BD6D83FA-FD49-4A93-A025-081068B6A766.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  importcrosssection (ics)

Imports one or more polycurves into the cross-section of a tunnel. If the cross-section of the tunnel is not empty, the imported segments are added to the end of the segment list. If the file contains more than one polycurve, the one with the largest bounding box is imported as the cross-section and the others as sub-sections. The imported polycurves can only contain line and arc segments, and they should be positioned on the XY-plane. 

## Signature
    
    
     importcrosssection <tn_obj> <path> [PropName PropValue...]...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
tn_obj  | obj  |  Tunnel object reference   
path  | str  |  Save location. File name of the object that should be imported   
PropName  | str  | Property name   
PropValue  | any  | Property value   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Segment](GUID-FA4769B6-2597-4755-A7B4-299E6345B4F1.html), [SubsectionPolycurve](GUID-F39EBCD2-A90F-49BC-9C88-38C743323CAF.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Imports one or more polycurves into the cross-section of a tunnel. 

_Example:_
    
    
    importcrosssection Tunnel_1 "D:\PLAXIS\shapes\polylineXY.dxf"

Imports the polycurve in file polylineXY.dxf into the cross-section of Tunnel_1.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Imports one or more polycurves into the cross-section of a tunnel considering additional settings. 

_Example:_
    
    
    importcrosssection Tunnel_1 "D:\PLAXIS\shapes\crosssection.dxf" "Scale" 2.0 "Tolerance" 1.0E-4 "Segments" (2 3 4) "SegmentsOrigin" (2 "StartPoint") "Intersect" True

Imports contents of the file crosssection.dxf into Tunnel_1. The scaling factor is set to 2.0, merge points tolerance is equal to 1.0E-4, segments 2, 3 and 4 will be imported, the start of the cross section will be defined at the start point of segment 2 (alternatively "EndPoint" keyword can be used) and automatic intersection is considered. Any remaining segments will be imported as subsections.

#  Model

Model object containing general information about the mesh status and the generation options. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the model.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the model.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the model.   
CurrentPhase  |  CurrentPhase  |  \-  |  The current phase in Staged construction mode.   
MeshFeedback  |  MeshFeedback  |  \-  |  Feedback from meshing procedure.   
MeshStatus  |  MeshStatus  |  \-  | 

  * Status  Current mesh status of model. 
  * NumberOfElements  Number of generated elements. 
  * NumberOfNodes  Number of generated nodes. 

  
MeshOptions  |  MeshOptions  |  \-  | 

  * Coarseness  Global coarseness factor. 
  * MaxCPUs  Maximum CPUs used for meshing. 
  * UseEnhancedRefinements  True: Activate the enhanced mesh refinements. 
  * UseEnhancedRefinements  False: Deactivate the enhanced mesh refinements. 
  * EMRGlobalScale  EMR global scale factor. 
  * EMRMinElementSize  EMR minimum element size. 
  * EMRProximity  EMR proximity value. 
  * UseSweptMeshing  True: Use the swept meshing. 
  * UseSweptMeshing  False: Do not use the swept meshing. 
  * ElementRelativeSize  Element relative size value. 
  * ElementDimension  Element dimension value.

#  setdefaultmaterial (sdm)

Forces an interface to use the material of the soil it is adjacent to. 

## Signature
    
    
    setdefaultmaterial [ph_obj]...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
ph_obj  | obj  |  Phase object reference, name of the phase in which the material should be changed   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures | Staged construction |  Interface | Staged feature   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Forces the interface of a surface to use the same material as the soil next to which it is located. 

_Example:_
    
    
    setdefaultmaterial PositiveInterface_1

Forces PositiveInterface_1 to use the same material as the soil next to which it is located.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Forces the interface of a surface to use the same material as the soil next to which it is located in one or more phases. 

_Example:_
    
    
    setdefaultmaterial NegativeInterface_2 (Phase_1 Phase_3)

Forces NegativeInterface_1 to use the same material as the soil next to which it is located in Phase_1 and Phase_3.

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  lineangles (lian)

Creates lines in directions specified using an angle. 

## Signature
    
    
    liangles <startpoint> <line_ref> [line_ref]...
    	startpoint: {pt_obj |(x y z)}
    	line_ref: Ang_xy Ang_xz {Len | ln_obj | vol_obj | svol_obj | srf_obj}

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference. Name of the point from which the line should start   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
Ang_xy  | float  | Angle. Angle of the line with respect to the xy-plane   
Ang_xz  | float  |  Angle. Angle of the line with respect to the xy-plane   
Len  | float  |  Length. Length of the line that should be created   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference, Name of the line to which a another line feature should be added   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference, Name of the volume to which a line feature should be added   
slvol_obj  | obj  | Soil volume object reference, Name of the soil volume to which a line feature should be added   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which a line feature should be added   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Point](GUID-B66BC755-E798-4237-AA8F-FC607481D430.html), [Line](GUID-EA175FC9-E4E6-4FD3-97C0-4F1F3624D025.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates one or more lines from a point by giving an angle and a line length. 

_Example:_
    
    
    lineangles Point_1 0 30 16

Creates a line from Point_1 with an angle of 0 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 30 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 16. The start point, Point_1, has coordinates (1, 2, 0) the end point of the line has coordinates (14.86, 2, 0). 

_Example:_
    
    
    lineangles (1 2 0) 30 0 9

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1 2 0) with an angle of 30 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 0 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 9. The end point of the line has coordinates (8.794, 6.5, 0). 

_Example:_
    
    
    lineangles Point_2 90 0 Volume_1

Creates a line from Point_2 with an angle of 90 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 0 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and snaps it to Volume_1. 

## See also

[line](GUID-A7671899-36CF-4CF1-B1EA-D8C754F013BB.html), [lineparallel](GUID-6014A769-1016-44A3-84F8-A63B9811C37B.html), [linerelative](GUID-4C2A32DC-946E-403D-9AF5-43CF9452D1B2.html), [linevector](GUID-F5C2E79F-0CA7-4C1D-80EA-1CF972932980.html)

## GUID-A535292D-AD0B-474E-92F1-2BA80534982D.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  snaplinear (snpl)

Snaps one or more points that are connected to a line to the object given as argument, in such a way that the orientation of the connected line does not change. This command does not remove existing objects, nor creates new geometry but only adjusts the object position. 

## Signature
    
    
    snaplinear	 <pt_obj>... <geo>

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference. Points to be snapped   
geo  | obj  |  Geometric entity. Snapping target   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Snaps one or more points that are connected to a line to the object given as argument. This command does not remove existing objects, nor creates new geometry but only adjusts the object position. 

_Example:_
    
    
    snaplinear Point_3 Line_5

Snaps Point_3 to Line_5.

## See also

[mergeequivalents](GUID-3B1F977D-186A-4DC1-97BC-6A7DE3463AF8.html), [snap](GUID-39377F5D-B810-400C-BCEB-8A1BC776BF8A.html)

## GUID-A7671899-36CF-4CF1-B1EA-D8C754F013BB.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  line (li)

Creates a line. 

## Signature
    
    
    line <startpoint> <point> [point]...
    	startpoint: (x y z) | pt_obj
    	point:	{"absolute" {(x y z) | pt_obj}} | {"relative" (x y z)} | {"angles" (Ang Ang) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj }} | {"vector" (dirx diry dirz) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj}}

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Names of the point(s) which define the line(s) that should be created   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference, Name of the line to which the created line should snap   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which the created line should snap   
slvol_obj  | obj  | Soil volume object reference, Name of the soil volume to which the created line should snap   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference, Name of the volume to which the created line should snap   
"absolute" | str  |  The following 3 numbers are absolute coordinates (default)   
"relative" | str  |  The following 3 numbers are coordinates are relative with respect to the previous coordinates   
"angles" | str  |  The following 3 numbers are angle (in degrees ) and vector length from the previous coordinates   
"vector" | str  |  The following numbers are a vector direction (in x-, y-, and z direction ) and a vector length   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or angle ("angles")   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
z  | float  | z-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
dirx  | float  |  Vector component ("vector")   
diry  | float  |  Vector component ("vector")   
dirz  | float  | Vector component ("vector")   
Ang  | float  | Angle of the line with respect to the reference axis  
Len  | float  |  Vector length ("vector")   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures | Global   
  
## Objects created

[point](GUID-B66BC755-E798-4237-AA8F-FC607481D430.html), [line](GUID-EA175FC9-E4E6-4FD3-97C0-4F1F3624D025.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a line between two or more points. 

_Example:_
    
    
    line (5 6 7) (8 9 10)

Creates a line from coordinates (5, 6, 7) to (8, 9, 10). 

_Example:_
    
    
    line (1 2 3) Point_1

Creates a line from coordinates (1, 2, 3) to Point_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    line Point_14 (8 4 12)

Creates a line from Point_14 to coordinates (8, 4, 12). 

_Example:_
    
    
    line Point_6 Point_4

Creates a line from Point_6 to Point_4. 

_Example:_
    
    
    line Point_1 Point_2 Point_3

Creates a line from Point_1 to Point_2 and another line from Point_2 to Point_3. 

_Example:_
    
    
    line (1 0 2) (9 4 5) (8 6 7) Point_8

Creates a line from coordinates (1, 0, 2) to coordinates (9, 4, 5), from that point another line to coordinates (8, 6, 7) and from that point another line to Point_8. 

_Example:_
    
    
    line Point_5 (1 2 3) Point_6

Creates a line from Point_5 to coordinates (1, 2,, 3) and from that point another line to Point_6. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates one or more lines by either giving absolute coordinates or relative coordinates, by giving the angle with respect to the xz- and xy-plane, and a length or a vector describing the direction and a length. 

_Example:_
    
    
    line 1 2 0 "relative" 3 4 8

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 0) to another new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y- and 8 in the z-direction from the first point at (4, 6, 8). Creates a line from coordinates (1, 2, 0) to (4, 6, 8). 

_Example:_
    
    
    line Point_1 "relative" 3 4 8 -5 -9 10 "angles" 0 30 16

Creates a line from Point_1 (1, 2, 0) to a new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y-, and 8 in the z-direction from the first point at (4, 6, 8). From that new point a line is created to another new point which is -5 in the x-, -9 in the y-  and 10 in the z-direction from the previous point at (-1, -3, 18). From that point a new line is created which has an angle of 0 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 30 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 16. This line ends at coordinates (12.86, -3, 26). 

_Example:_
    
    
    line (1 2 3) "angles" 45 50 10 "vector" (8 2 5) 14

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 3) which has an angle of 45 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 50 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 10. Then creates a line from the end point of the first line in direction (8, 2, 5) with a length of 14. 

_Example:_
    
    
    line (1 2 3) "angles" 45 50 10 "absolute" (4 5 6)

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 3) which has an angle of 45 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 50 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 10. Then creates a line from the end point of the first line to a new point with coordinates (4, 5, 6). 

_Example:_
    
    
    line Point_2 "angles" 90 0 Volume_1

Creates a line from Point_2 with an angle of 90 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 0 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and snaps it to Volume_1. 

## See also

[beam](GUID-35488379-C8B3-46FA-AE81-F92D16E949E9.html), [ discontinuity (di)](GUID-FF7B3427-D2BC-4CA8-B794-EB4457464F25.html), [embeddedbeam](GUID-886C96D7-3224-422C-903A-5F308D18323A.html), [geogrid](GUID-6B33756A-BD25-43AC-B88F-566AFC325A91.html), [lineangles](GUID-A23CA42A-3B0B-4A96-A368-AB9BEB3403E7.html), [linedispl](GUID-B496F380-0249-48C7-9512-165D061EC611.html), [linedrain,](GUID-13A3B1EA-7EFF-4646-840D-705BE7A4205B.html) [lineload](GUID-38BD79D5-EBB3-4508-AEFD-48808DAF626C.html), [lineparallel](GUID-6014A769-1016-44A3-84F8-A63B9811C37B.html), [linerelative](GUID-4C2A32DC-946E-403D-9AF5-43CF9452D1B2.html), [linevector](GUID-F5C2E79F-0CA7-4C1D-80EA-1CF972932980.html), [n2nanchor](GUID-0FD3164F-7D6D-4F9B-BAD1-5B9ABF6F84F8.html), [neginterface](GUID-8F3F52A1-BBDC-48D0-8EBC-6FD9224054A0.html), [plate](GUID-FF5D716F-297B-431F-8354-8FEE77644DFD.html), [positerface](GUID-87FA745B-DD8E-4488-A20B-131F6BEAE1E4.html), [well](GUID-ACA20A1B-BF90-47EE-8095-22327EA2DBD1.html)

#  gotomesh (gtm)

Switches to Mesh mode. 

## Signature
    
    
    gotomesh [B]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
B  | bool  |  Boolean, true creates a new intersection even if not necessary, false does not create an intersection unless necessary   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Switches from the current working mode to Mesh mode. There has to be at least one volume or surface in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    gotomesh

Switches from the current working mode to Mesh mode.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Switches from the current working mode to Mesh mode with the possibility to create a new intersection regardless of whether there are any geometric changes. There has to be at least one volume or surface in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    gotomesh true

Switches from the current working mode to Mesh mode and creates a new intersection.

#  crosssectionplot (csplt)

Creates a plot for visualising cross section. 

## Signature
    
    
    crosssectionplot <plot_obj> <Coords>
    	Coords: {(x y z) (x y z)} | {(x y z) (x y z) (x y z)}

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plot_obj  | obj  |  Plot object reference, Plot from which cross-section plot should be generated   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate of the first|second|third point   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate of the first|second|third point   
z  | float  |  z-coordinate of the first|second|third point   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Output  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Plot](GUID-E178C8BF-CD8B-4DF0-8C92-485EA89DED46.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a cross section plot using two points. 

_Example:_
    
    
    crosssectionplot Plot_1 (0 0 0) (1 1 1)

Creates a cross section plot specified by points (0 0 0), (1 1 1), and the normal.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a plot for visualising cross section using three points. The points cannot be collinear. 

_Example:_
    
    
    crosssectionplot Plot_1 (0 0 0) (1 1 1) (2 5 1)

Creates a cross section plot specified by points (0 0 0), (1 1 1), and (2 5 1).

## See also

[getcrosssectionresults](GUID-9081423F-7040-471A-BF5F-941F220B017C.html)

#  filter (fi)

Filters a list of specified objects. 

## Signature
    
    
    filter <S>

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14).

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---

## Scope

## Objects created

PlxValues

_Purpose:_

_Example:_

#  add ()

Adds a segment to a polycurve or a row to an advanced table 

## Signature
    
    
    add [Segment] | [Num] | [TunnelPartCurve}...
    	Segment: {<"Line"> <Ang> <Len>}... | {<"Arc"> <Ang> <Ang> <R>}...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



Parameters 

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
"Line" | "Arc" | str  |  Adds a line segment to the polycurve | adds an arc segment to the polycurve   
Ang  |  float  |  Increment of the slope of the new line segment   
Len  |  float  |  Length of the new line segment   
R  |  float  |  Radius of the new arc segment   
Num  | float  |  Value of the new property   
TunnelPartCurve  | obj  |  Name of the tunnel part curve that should be added   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Structures |  Global, Polycurve, AdvancedTable, TunnelPart  
  
## Objects created

[Segment](GUID-FA4769B6-2597-4755-A7B4-299E6345B4F1.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds a line segment with a length of 1 to a polycurve. 

_Example:_
    
    
    add Polycurve_1

Adds a line segmentwith a length of 1 to Polycurve_1. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds one or more  segments with specified properties to a polycurve. 

_Example:_
    
    
    add Polycurve_2 "Arc" 0 45 1 "Line" 90 2

Adds an arc segment with an increment of the slope of 0°, a central angle of 45° and a radius of 1 to Polycurve_2 and adds a line segment with an increment of the slope of 90° and a length of 2 after that. 

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Adds a row to an advanced table. 

_Example:_
    
    
    add LoadMultiplier_1.Table

Adds a row to the advanced table of LoadMultiplier_1. 

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Adds a row to an advanced table. 

_Example:_
    
    
    add LoadMultiplier_1.Table 5 2

Adds a row to the advanced table of LoadMultiplier_1 with a time value of 5 and a multiplier value of 2. 

## Alternative 5

_Purpose:_

Adds a tunnel part curve to a template tunnel. 

_Example:_
    
    
    add TunnelPart_1 TunnelPartCurve_1 TunnelPartCurve_2

Adds two tunnel part curves to TunnelPart_1. 

## See also

[insert](GUID-459B7791-2B87-4746-946E-511420D77945.html), [polycurve](GUID-D7BBD382-3935-4DBC-A019-11A7CE5413DB.html), [reset](GUID-277D26FE-EB41-4B67-A841-24A92E59B22B.html), [symmetricclose](GUID-BB96CF95-505C-4C0F-80FE-42752865EF4B.html), [close ](GUID-C3151C98-F172-4FC6-9FF7-BA0048761D92.html), [extendtosymmetryaxis](GUID-33E3208E-1ABC-470D-949C-FDC2BBD409BE.html)

#  well ()

Adds well features to lines. 

## Signature
    
    
    well  <line> [line]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
     line:{<startpoint> <point> <point> |  ln_obj |  polyc_obj}
    	startpoint: (x y z) | pt_obj
    	point:	{"absolute" {(x y z) | pt_obj}} | {"relative" (x y z)} | {"angles" (Ang Ang) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj }} | {"vector" (dirx diry dirz) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj}}
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [Well](GUID-0870CCD0-057B-4AF5-BF52-8FB26E9EFD8F.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point(s) for which a Well object should start or end   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference, Name of the line to which a Well object should be added   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which a Well object should be added   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or angle ("angles")   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
z  | float  | z-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
dirx  | float  |  Vector component ("vector")   
diry  | float  |  Vector component ("vector")   
dirz  | float  | Vector component ("vector")   
Ang  | float  | Angle of the line with respect to the reference axis  
Len  | float  |  Vector length ("vector")   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [Well](GUID-0870CCD0-057B-4AF5-BF52-8FB26E9EFD8F.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [Well](GUID-0870CCD0-057B-4AF5-BF52-8FB26E9EFD8F.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Well](GUID-0870CCD0-057B-4AF5-BF52-8FB26E9EFD8F.html),  [Polygon](GUID-41820D20-39F0-4968-AC4B-FC589E7EB18E.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds well features to one or more  surfaces in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    well Polygon_1

Adds a well feature to Polygon_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    well (Polygon_6 Polygon_4)

Adds well features to Polygon_6 and Polygon_4.

_Example:_
    
    
    well (1 4 0) (2 3 0) (4 5 0)

Creates a new surface between three points with coordinates (1, 4, 0), (2, 3, 0) and (4, 5, 0) and adds a well feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    well Point_1 Point_2 (4 5 0)

Creates a new surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a point with coordinates (4, 5, 0) and adds a well feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    well Polycurve_1

Adds a well feature to closed Polycurve_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    well Group_1

Adds well features to all structural surfaces in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only surfaces.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds well features to one or more existing surfaces in the geometry and directly set their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    well Polygon_1 "Behaviour" "Extraction"

Adds a well feature to Polygon_1 and sets the behaviour to "Extraction".

_Example:_
    
    
    well (Polygon_1 Polygon_3) "Behaviour" "Extraction"

Adds a well feature to Polygon_1 and Polygon_3 and sets the behaviour to "Extraction" for both wells.

_Example:_
    
    
    well Point_1 Point_2 (5 6 0) "Behaviour" "Extraction"

Creates a new surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a new point with coordinates (5, 6, 0), adds a well feature to it and sets the behaviour to "Extraction".

## See also

[surface](GUID-60600C86-7D70-4160-997A-A81DB39A36DB.html)

#  Input commands reference 

The PLAXIS 3D interpreter supports a wide range of commands. The commands reference gives an overview of these and their parameters, and provides numerous usage examples. 

## General command syntax
    
    
    Command	Parameters

## Signature conventions

Symbol  | Definition/use   
---|---  
<...> |  Compulsory parameters   
[...]  |  Optional parameters   
{...}  | Grouping parameters (for choices)   
" " |  String parameters, without quotes they're numbers   
|  |  To separate choices   
…  | Prior argument can be repeated   
str  | String   
int  | Integer   
float  | Floating point   
bool  | Boolean   
enum  | Enumeration   
list  | List   
obj  | Object   
any  | Any Type

#  __getcurveresults (__gcres)

Displays the calculated values of a particular block of the specified phase. 

## Signature
    
    
    __getcurveresults <ph_obj> <blc_obj> [value_id] [value_id]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
ph_obj  | obj  |  Phase object reference. Name of the phase from which the calculation results should be displayed   
blc_obj  | str  |  Block object reference. Name of the block from which the calculation results should be displayed   
value_id  | int  |  Value index. Index of the value that should be displayed. The numbering of the values is 0-based   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Flow conditions, Staged construction |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays the values of the calculation results of a specified block in a phase. The values shown are the values in the last step of the calculation. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __getcurveresults Phase_1 "PPRESS_R"

Displays the values of the calculation results of block 'PPRESS_R' in Phase_1.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Displays a specific calculation result of a specified block in a phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __getcurveresults Phase_1 "PPRESS_R" 14

Displays the minimum, maximum and last value of the position at index 14 of the calculation results of block 'PPRESS_R' in Phase_1. The numbering of the values is 0-based.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Displays the values of the calculation results of column of a specified block in a phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __getcurveresults Phase_1 "PPRESS_R" 0 3

Displays the values of the calculation results of the first of the three columns of block 'PPRESS_R' in Phase_1.

Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the water level.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the water level.   
BoundingBox  |  Bounding box  |  \-  |  Coordinates of the diagonal defining the bounding box for the water level.   
x  |  x  |  Length  |  x-coordinate.   
y  |  y  |  Length  |  y-coordinate.   
z  |  z  |  Length  |  z-coordinate.   
Area  |  Area  |  Length 2 |  Area of the water level.   
IsHydrostatic  |  IsHydrostatic  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables that the pore pressure distribution is hydrostatic. 
  * False  Disables that the pore pressure distribution is hydrostatic.

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

#  extrude (ex)

Extrudes an object along a vector. 

## Signature
    
    
    extrude <plx_obj>... [(dirx diry dirz)]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  PLAXIS object reference, Name of the objects that are to be extruded   
dirx  | float  |  x-value, vector giving the object's extruding direction   
diry  | float  |  y-value, vector giving the object's extruding direction   
dirz  | float  | z-value, vector giving the object's extruding direction   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Line](GUID-EA175FC9-E4E6-4FD3-97C0-4F1F3624D025.html), [Surface](GUID-064F8245-0453-4B36-B7F1-2D912DEAF9B3.html), [Volume](GUID-CDDE333E-8922-4FF5-B2DB-4B6B31644557.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Extrudes one or more objects along a specified vector. 

_Example:_
    
    
    extrude Point_1 1 0 5

Extrudes Point_1 in direction towards (1, 0, 5). 

_Example:_
    
    
    extrude Surface_1 (1 0 5)

Extrudes Surface_1 in direction towards (1, 0, 5). 

_Example:_
    
    
    extrude Point_1 Line_1 Surface_1 (1 0 5)

Extrudes Point_1, Line_1 and Surface_1 in direction towards (1, 0, 5). 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Extrudes one or more objects along a line or polycurve specifying the trajectory. 

_Example:_
    
    
    extrude Polygon_1 Line_1

Extrudes Polygon_1 along the trajectory specified by Line_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    extrude Polygon_1 Polygon_2 Polycurve_1

Extrudes Polygon_1 and Polygon_2 along the trajectory specified by Polycurve_1. 

## See also

[arrayr](GUID-898C143C-A722-48FA-983A-AE3EAEABCB07.html), [arrayp](GUID-99F68BB5-EAD3-44F9-9EFE-4F2EA293C752.html), [blendsurface](GUID-4BA95699-9B98-4A28-B7B6-0E1D03ED7590.html), [loft](GUID-7472E341-B258-4EE2-80CF-C60FAE0467C2.html)

#  echo ()

Displays the details of an object. 

## Signature
    
    
    echo [SoilTestRef | lst_obj]
    	SoilTestRef:  Triaxial | CycTriaxial | Oedometer | CRS | DSS | CDSS | PMT | General

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
Triaxial  | obj  |  Triaxial test   
CycTriaxial  | obj  |  Cyclic triaxial test   
Oedometer  | obj  | Oedometer test   
CRS  | obj  | Constant rate strain test   
DSS  | obj  | Direct simple shear test   
CDSS  | obj  | Cyclic direct simple shear test   
PMT  | obj  | Pressuremeter test (only for Hardening Soil model in drained conditions)   
General  | obj  | General, arbitrary test   
lst_obj  | obj  |  Listable reference. Name of the listable of which the objects are to be displayed   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
SoilTest  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays the details of the project. 

_Example:_
    
    
    echo

Displays the details of the project. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Displays the configuration details of a specified soil test. 

_Example:_
    
    
    echo Triaxial

Displays the configuration details of a Triaxial test. 

_Example:_
    
    
    echo Triaxial.Behaviour

Displays the type of Triaxial test, i.e. drained or undrained. 

_Example:_
    
    
    echo Triaxial.Results.MeanTotStress

Displays the results of the mean total stress for all steps of a Triaxial test. To retrieve the results the index command can be used (See also section). 

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Displays details of a specified object. 

_Example:_
    
    
    echo Tests

Displays all available tests.

#  EmbeddedBeamMat

Material set assigned to an embedded beam. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the embedded beam material.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the embedded beam material.   
Identification  |  Identification  |  \-  |  Identification of the embedded beam material.   
Colour  |  Colour  |  \-  |  Colour of the embedded beam material.   
MaterialNumber  |  Identification number  |  \-  |  Identification number of the embedded beam material.   
MaterialType  |  Material type  |  \-  | 

  * No material type  No material type selected. 
  * Elastic  Sets embedded beam material behaviour to elastic. 
  * Elastoplastic  Sets embedded beam material behaviour to elastoplastic. 

  
Gamma  |  γ  |  Force/Length 3 |  Unit weight of the embedded beam material.   
DampingMethod  |  Damping method  |  \-  | 

  * Direct  Allows to specify Rayleigh alpha and beta. 
  * SDOF equivalence  Single Degree of Freedom equivalent values 

  
RayleighAlpha  |  Rayleigh alpha  |  \-  |  Rayleigh alpha value.   
RayleighBeta  |  Rayleigh beta  |  \-  |  Rayleigh beta value.   
TargetDamping1  |  ξ 2 |  %  |  Damping target value 1.   
TargetDamping2  |  ξ 2 |  %  |  Damping target value 2.   
TargetFrequency1  |  f 1 |  Hz  |  Damping target frequency value 1.   
TargetFrequency2  |  f 2 |  Hz  |  Damping target frequency value 2.   
CrossSectionType  |  Cross section type  |  \-  | 

  * Predefined  Use one of the predefined cross section types. 
  * User-defined  Define a cross section by giving geometric values. 

  
PredefinedCrossSectionType  |  Predefined cross section type  |  \-  | 

  * Solid circular beam  Use a solid circular beam. 
  * Circular tube  Use a circular tube. 
  * Solid square beam  Use a solid square beam. 

  
Diameter  |  Diameter  |  Length  |  Diameter of a circular tube or solid circular beam.   
Thickness  |  Thickness  |  Length  |  Thickness of the wall of a circular tube.   
Width  |  Width  |  Length  |  Width of a solid square beam.   
A  |  Area  |  Length 2 |  Area of the cross-section of the embedded beam.   
I2  |  I 2 |  Length 4 |  Moment of inertia of the embedded beam over the second axis.   
I3  |  I 3 |  Length 4 |  Moment of inertia of the embedded beam over the third axis.   
E  |  Young's modulus  |  Force/Length 2 |  Young's modulus of the embedded beam material.   
YieldStress  |  YieldStress σ y |  Force/Length 2 |  Yield stress parameter for a beam.   
CriticalDirection  |  Critical yield local direction  |  Force/Length 2 | 

  * Local direction 2  Local axis direction 2. 
  * Local direction 3  Local axis direction 3. 

  
W2  |  W 2 |  Length 3 |  Plastic section modulus when the Yield direction is in local direction 2.   
W3  |  W 3 |  Length 3 |  Plastic section modulus when the Yield direction is in local direction 3.   
AxialSkinResistance  |  Axia skin resistance  |  \-  | 

  * Linear  The skin resistance is linearly distributed. 
  * Multi-linear  The skin resistance is multi-linearly distributed. 
  * Layer dependent  The skin resistance is layer dependent. 

  
TSkinStartMax  |  Max skin resistance start value  |  Force/Length  |  Max skin resistance value at the start of the embedded beam.   
TSkinEndMax  |  Max skin resistance end value  |  Force/Length  |  Max skin resistance value at the end of the embedded beam.   
MultiLinearAxialSkinResistance  |  Axial skin resistance multi linear  |  \-  |  Table showing variation of axial skin resistance with length for the embedded beam.   
TMax  |  Max skin resistance value layer dependent  |  Force/Length  |  Max skin resistance value for the layer dependent option of the embedded beam.   
Fmax  |  F max base resistance  |  Force  |  Maximum force allowed at the base of the embedded beam.

#  linedispl (lpd)

Adds line prescribed displacement features to lines. 

## Signature
    
    
    linedispl  <line> [line]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
     line:{<startpoint> <point> <point> |  ln_obj |  polyc_obj}
    	startpoint: (x y z) | pt_obj
    	point:	{"absolute" {(x y z) | pt_obj}} | {"relative" (x y z)} | {"angles" (Ang Ang) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj }} | {"vector" (dirx diry dirz) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj}}
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [LineDisplacement](GUID-E98B6295-F43A-4B3C-AAFC-A9881964D867.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the start or end point of the LineDisplacement or Name of the points between which the LineDisplacement should be created   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference, Name of the line to which a LineDisplacement object should be added or Name of the line to which the created LineDisplacement should snap   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Polycurve object reference, Name of the polycurve to which a LineDisplacement object should be added   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which the created LineDisplacement should snap   
slvol_obj  | obj  | Soil volume object reference, Name of the soil volume to which the created LineDisplacement should snap   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference, Name of the volume to which the created line LineDisplacement should snap   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or angle ("angles")   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
z  | float  | z-coordinate ("absolute"), distance ("relative") or vector length ("angles")   
dirx  | float  |  Vector component ("vector")   
diry  | float  |  Vector component ("vector")   
dirz  | float  | Vector component ("vector")   
Ang  | float  | Angle of the line with respect to the reference axis  
Len  | float  |  Vector length ("vector")   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [LineDisplacement](GUID-E98B6295-F43A-4B3C-AAFC-A9881964D867.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [LineDisplacement](GUID-E98B6295-F43A-4B3C-AAFC-A9881964D867.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[LineDisplacement](GUID-E98B6295-F43A-4B3C-AAFC-A9881964D867.html), [Point](GUID-B66BC755-E798-4237-AA8F-FC607481D430.html), [Line](GUID-EA175FC9-E4E6-4FD3-97C0-4F1F3624D025.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds line prescribed displacement features to one or more lines in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    linedispl Line_1

Adds a line prescribed displacement feature to Line_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedispl (Line_6 Line 4)

Adds line prescribed displacement features to Line_6 and Line_4.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedispl (1 4 0) (2 3 0)

Creates a new line between three points with coordinates (1, 4, 0)and (2, 3, 0)  and adds a line load feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedispl Point_1 Point_2 (4 5 0)

Creates a new line between Point_1, Point_2 and a point with coordinates (4, 5, 0) and adds a line prescribed displacement feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedispl Polycurve_1

Adds a line prescribed displacement feature to closed Polycurve_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedispl 1 2 0 "relative" 3 4 8

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 0) to another new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y- and 8 in the z-direction from the first point at (4, 6, 8). Creates a line from coordinates (1, 2, 0) to (4, 6, 8) and adds a line prescribed displacement feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedispl Point_1 "relative" 3 4 8 -5 -9 10 "angles" 0 30 16

Creates a line from Point_1 (1, 2, 0) to a new point which is 3 in the x-, 4 in the y-, and 8 in the z-direction from the first point at (4, 6, 8). From that new point a line is created to another new point which is -5 in the x-, -9 in the y-  and 10 in the z-direction from the previous point at (-1, -3, 18). From that point a new line is created which has an angle of 0 degrees with respect to the xy-plane, an angle of 30 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 16. This line ends at coordinates (12.86, -3, 26). Adds line prescribed displacement features to all lines.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedispl (1 2 3) "angles" 45 50 10 "absolute" (4 5 6)

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 3) which has an angle of 45 degrees with respect to the xy-plane an angle of 50 degrees with respect to the xz-plane and a length of 10. Then creates a line from the end point of the first line to a new point with coordinates (4, 5, 5) and adds line prescribed displacement features to all lines. 

_Example:_
    
    
    linedispl Group_1

Adds line prescribed displacement features to all structural surfaces in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only surfaces. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds line prescribed displacement features to one or more existing lines in the geometry and directly set their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    linedispl Line_1 "Displacement_x" "Fixed"

Adds a line prescribed displacement feature to Line_1 and sets the x- horizontal component to Fixed.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedispl (Line_1 Line_3) "Displacement_x" "Fixed"

Adds a line prescribed displacement feature to Line_1 and Line_3 and sets the x- horizontal component to Fixed for both line prescribed displacements.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedispl Point_1 (5 6 0) "Displacement_x" "Fixed"

Creates a new line between Point_1 and a new point with coordinates (5, 6, 0), adds a embedded beam feature to it and sets the x- horizontal component to Fixed.

_Example:_
    
    
    linedispl 1 2 0 "relative" 3 4 8 "Displacement_x" "Fixed"

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 0) to another new point which is 3 in the x-, and 4 in the y- and 8 in the z-direction relatively to the first point, adds a line prescribed displacement feature to it and sets the x- horizontal component to Fixed.

## See also

[line](GUID-A7671899-36CF-4CF1-B1EA-D8C754F013BB.html)

#  soillayer (sl)

Adds a soil layer. 

## Signature
    
    
    soillayer <h> | <bh_obj> <h>

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
h  | float  |  Height of the soil layer that should be created   
bh_obj  | obj  |  Name of the borehole where the soil layer should be created   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[soillayer](GUID-B506C082-E520-4470-9193-776CDB2EA363.html#GUID-B506C082-E520-4470-9193-776CDB2EA363)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a soil layer with a specified height at z=0 or underneath the last soil layer when it is not the first soil layer. 

_Example:_
    
    
    soillayer 3

Adds a soil layer with a height of 3.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds a soil layer at a specified borehole with a specified height at z=0 or underneath the last soil layer when it is not the first soil layer. 

_Example:_
    
    
    soillayer Borehole_14 3

Adds a soil layer at Borehole_14 with a height of 3.

#  clearmaterial (cm)

Clears the assignment of the Material property of any Soil or Structure object in any mode. 

## Signature
    
    
    clearmaterial <geo_obj>... [phase_ref]...
    	geo_obj: {sl_obj | st_obj}
    	phase_ref: {ph_obj | ph_obj_lst}

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
sl_obj  | obj  |  Soil object reference. Name of object whose Material assignment should be cleared.   
st_obj  | obj  |  Structure object reference. Name of object whose Material assignment should be cleared.   
ph_obj  | obj  |  Phase object reference. Name of the phase in which the material should be cleared.   
ph_obj_lst  | list  | Phase object reference list. Name of the group containing phases in which the material should be cleared.   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures | Mesh, Flow conditions, Staged construction |  Feature | Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Clear the assignment of the Material property for multiple Soil objects in Structures mode. 

_Example:_
    
    
    clearmaterial Soil_1

Clear the assignment of the Material property for multiple Soil objects in Structures mode.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Clear the assignment of the Material property of a Structure object in Structures mode. 

_Example:_
    
    
    clearmaterial Plate_1 Plate_2

Clear the assignment of the Material property of a Structure object in Structures mode.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Clear the assignment of the Material property of a Structure object in Staged construction mode. 

_Example:_
    
    
    clearmaterial Soil_1_2 Phase_1

Clear the assignment of the Material property of a Soil object in Staged construction mode.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Clear the assignment of the Material property of a Soil and Structure object in multiple phases in Staged construction mode. 

_Example:_
    
    
    clearmaterial (Soil_1_2 Plate_1_1) (InitialPhase Phase_1)

Clear the assignment of the Material property of a Soil and Structure object in multiple phases in Staged construction mode. 

## Alternative 5

_Purpose:_

Clear the assignment of the Material property of a Soil and Structure object in multiple phases in Staged construction mode. 

_Example:_
    
    
    clearmaterial (Soil_1_1 EmbeddedBeam_1_1) (Group_1)

Clear the assignment of the Material property of a Soil and Structure object in multiple phases in Staged construction mode.

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14).

## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---

## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Saves the project in a previously determined location. The project must have been previously saved.

Saves the project at C:\PLAXIS3D\Projects with the filename embankment.p3d.

#  set ( )

Sets one or more properties of one or more objects 

## Signature
    
    
    set <plx_obj> | <Num> | <I> | <str>

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  Name of the object from which the properties should be copied.   
Num  | float  |  New value of the property that should be changed.   
I  | int  |  New value of the property that should be changed.   
str  | str  |  New value of the property that should be changed.   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
\-  |  Object, Numerical property, Integer property, Text property   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Copies the properties of one object to another. 

_Example:_
    
    
    set Plots[-1] Plots[0]

Copies the properties of Plots[0] to Plots[-1].

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Changes a numerical property of an object. 

_Example:_
    
    
    set Plots[-1].Scalefactor 50

Changes the scale factor of Plots[-1] to 50.

_Example:_
    
    
    set Plots[-1].ScaleFactor Plots[0].ScaleFactor

Changes the scale factor of Plots[-1] to the scale factor of Plots[0].

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Changes an integer property of an object. 

_Example:_
    
    
    set Plots[-1].LegendSettings.Intervals 5

Changes the intervals for legend settings of Plots[-1] to 5.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Changes a text property of an object. 

_Example:_
    
    
    set Plots[-1].ProjectDescription "Excavation"

Changes the project description of the last created plot to 'Excavation'.

#  count ()

Displays the number of objects of a specified type that are present. 

## Signature
    
    
    count <{plx_obj | lst_obj}>... [cond]
    	

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  Objects. Objects which should be reported   
lst_obj  | obj  | Listable object reference   
cond  | str  | Condition. The condition that the objects should fulfill to be counted   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Listable | Global | Any   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays the number of objects of a specified type that are present. 

_Example:_
    
    
    count Points

Displays the number of points that are present.

_Example:_
    
    
    count Materials

Displays the number of materials that are present.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Displays the number of objects of a specified type that are present and which fulfill a certain condition. 

_Example:_
    
    
    count Point_1 Point_2 Point_7 Point_8 Point_9 Point_11 "x>0"

Displays the number of points from the listed points that have an x-coordinate larger than 0.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Displays the number of objects of a specified type that are present and which fulfill a certain condition. 

_Example:_
    
    
    count Points "x>0"

Displays the number of points that have an x-coordinate larger than 0.

_Example:_
    
    
    count Lines "Length>2"

Displays the number of lines that have length larger than 2.

_Example:_
    
    
    count FlowFunctions "Period<3"

Counts head functions, which period < 3.

_Example:_
    
    
    count Surfaces "Area<0.05"

Displays the number of surfaces that have an area smaller than 0.05.

## See also

[filter](GUID-24A1FE60-435E-48CE-90FF-9355CD8EF775.html), [tabulate](GUID-66D40011-D90C-40FB-975C-766676D853ED.html)
