#  apply (map)

Applies a command to multiple objects at once. 

## Signature
    
    
    apply <lst_obj> <cmd> [Param]...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
lst_obj  | obj  |  Listable object reference. Name of the listable to which the command should be applied   
cmd  | str  | Command that should be applied to the listable   
Param  | any  | Parameter(s) for the command that should be applied   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None | Object 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Applies a command to multiple objects at once. Every time a command is applied to an object an undo-able action is created. 

_Example:_
    
    
    apply Points "setproperties" "x" 3

Sets the x-coordinate of all points to 3. 

_Example:_
    
    
    apply Phases "setproperties" "Solver" 1

Sets the solver type for all phases to 'Pardiso'.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Applies a command to multiple objects at once. Every time a command is applied to an object an undo-able action is created. 

_Example:_
    
    
    apply NodeToNodeAnchors "sps" "AdjustPrestress" Phase_1 True

Sets the option to adjust the prestress force for all node-to-node anchors in phase 1 to true.

## See also

[group](GUID-E7423CC3-36C2-4A67-AC5E-B18D4CCC0FFD.html), [groupfiltered](GUID-2DC88566-CB97-4417-8D16-CA6D05A0E98C.html)

#  cuboid ()

Creates a cuboid. 

## Signature
    
    
    cuboid <SideLength>... [Coords]
    	Coords: (x y z) | {(x y z) (dirx diry dirz)}

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
SideLength  | float  |  Desired side length of the cuboid   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
dirx  | float  |  x-value of the vector giving the direction in which the cuboid should be pointing   
diry  | float  |  y-value of the vector giving the direction in which the cuboid should be pointing   
dirz  | float  | z-value of the vector giving the direction in which the cuboid should be pointing   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Volume](GUID-CDDE333E-8922-4FF5-B2DB-4B6B31644557.html), [Soil](GUID-12538F90-AAA2-4AE4-841C-1390CE850761.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a cuboid with side length at the origin (0, 0, 0). 

_Example:_
    
    
    cuboid 2

Creates a cuboid with a side length of 2 at the origin (0, 0, 0). 

_Example:_
    
    
    cuboid 2 3 5

Creates a cuboid with a side lengths 2, 3 and 5 at the origin (0, 0, 0).

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a cuboid with a side length and at a specified location (x, y, z). 

_Example:_
    
    
    cuboid 2 (1 2 3)

Creates a cuboid with a side length of 2 and at coordinates (1, 2, 3). 

_Example:_
    
    
    cuboid 2 3 5 (1 2 3)

Creates a cuboid with a side lengths 2, 3 and 5 at coordinates (1, 2, 3).

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Creates a cuboid with a side length at a specified location (x, y, z) in a specified direction described by a vector. 

_Example:_
    
    
    cuboid 2 (1 2 3) (5 7 12)

Creates a cuboid with a side length 2 and at coordinates (1, 2, 3) pointing in direction (5, 7, 12). The direction of the vector is perpendicular to the bottom and goes through its center point. 

_Example:_
    
    
    cuboid 2 3 5 (1 2 3) (5 7 12)

Creates a cuboid with a side lengths 2, 3 and 5 at coordinates (1, 2, 3) pointing in direction (5, 7, 12). The direction of the vector is perpendicular to the bottom and goes through its centerpoint.

## See also

[cone](GUID-4D1F32CF-5EEF-4049-AD1A-C5D83F1A31F0.html), [cylinder](GUID-0E0DFF88-BB0E-4010-AD68-F9C9C666293C.html)

**Parent topic:** [ Input commands reference ](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html)

#  symmetricclose (sycl)

Closes a polycurve symmetrically. 

## Signature
    
    
    symmetricclose [B]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
B  | bool  |  Boolean value indicating the use of last point for symmetry axis. True moves the symmetry axis to the last point of the polycurve if it is not located there, false sets that the last point of the polycurve must be located on the local second axis of the polycurve   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Polycurve   
  
## Objects created

[Segment](GUID-FA4769B6-2597-4755-A7B4-299E6345B4F1.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Closes a polycurve symmetrically over the second local axis of the polycurve by adding copies of the existing segments in opposite order. The last point of the polycurve must be located on the local second axis of the polycurve. 

_Example:_
    
    
    symmetricclose Polycurve_4

Closes Polycurve_4 symmetrically by adding copies of the existing segments in opposite order.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Closes a polycurve symmetrically by adding copies of the existing segments in opposite order. 

_Example:_
    
    
    symmetricclose Polycurve_2 true

Closes Polycurve_2 symmetrically over the second local axis of Polycurve_2 by adding copies of the existing segments in opposite order. If the last point of Polycurve_2 is not located on the local second axis of Polycurve_2 the symmetry axis will be moved to the last point.

_Example:_
    
    
    symmetricclose Polycurve_4 false

Closes Polycurve_4 symmetrically over the second local axis of Polycurve_4 by adding copies of the existing segments in opposite order. The last point of Polycurve_4 must be located on the local second axis of Polycurve_4.

## See also

[add](GUID-AC7505C5-468F-4CD8-AA35-1914733B4B80.html), [close](GUID-C3151C98-F172-4FC6-9FF7-BA0048761D92.html), [extendtosymmetryaxis](GUID-33E3208E-1ABC-470D-949C-FDC2BBD409BE.html), [insert](GUID-459B7791-2B87-4746-946E-511420D77945.html), [polycurve](GUID-D7BBD382-3935-4DBC-A019-11A7CE5413DB.html), [reset](GUID-277D26FE-EB41-4B67-A841-24A92E59B22B.html),

## GUID-BBC657F3-9398-421D-884F-B41964BF7092.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  regenerate (regen)

Regenerates the staged construction properties of objects in particular phases. Regeneration consists of two steps: determining which properties in which phases should be reset, followed by finding out what the new values should be and applying those values.

## Signature
    
    
    regenerate {<ph_obj> | <plx_obj... ph_obj...>}

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
ph_obj  | obj  |  Phase object reference, name of the phase in which the phase settings should be regenerated   
plx_obj  | obj  |  PLAXIS object reference, name of the object of which the phase settings should be regenerated   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Flow conditions, Staged construction |  Object   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Regenerates the phase settings in one or more staged construction phases. 

_Example:_
    
    
    regenerate (Geogrid_1 Geogrid_2) (Phase_1)

Regenerates the phase settings of Geogrid_1 and Geogrid_2 in Phase_1.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Regenerates the staged construction properties of an object in a particular phase.

_Example:_
    
    
    regenerate Volume_1 Phase_1

Regenerates the phase settings of Volume_1 in Phase_1.

## See also

[phase](GUID-3B4FEA05-9544-4360-AA95-14EE8C6217DE.html)

#  pointdispl (ppd)

Adds point prescribed displacement features to points. 

## Signature
    
    
    pointdispl <point> [point]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
    	point: (x y z) | pt_obj
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [PointDisplacement](GUID-A7F8AC84-97C7-4D5F-9345-036314FC9249.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Name of the point to which a point prescribed displacement feature should be added   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [PointDisplacement](GUID-A7F8AC84-97C7-4D5F-9345-036314FC9249.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [PointDisplacement](GUID-A7F8AC84-97C7-4D5F-9345-036314FC9249.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[PointDisplacement](GUID-A7F8AC84-97C7-4D5F-9345-036314FC9249.html), [Point](GUID-B66BC755-E798-4237-AA8F-FC607481D430.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds point prescribed displacement features to one or more existing points in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    pointdispl (5 6 7)

Creates a new point at (5, 6, 7) and adds a point prescribed displacement feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    pointdispl Point_1

Adds a point prescribed displacement feature to Point_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    pointdispl Point_2 Point_3

Adds point prescribed displacement features to Point_2 and Point_3. 

_Example:_
    
    
    pointdispl Group_1

Adds point prescribed displacement features to all points in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only points.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds point prescribed displacement features to one or more existing points in the geometry and directly set their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    pointdispl (5 6 7) "Displacement_x" "Fixed" "Displacement_y" "Prescribed" "Displacement_z" "Free"

Creates a new point at (5, 6, 7), adds a point prescribed displacement feature to Point_1 and sets the Displacement_x to "Fixed", the Displacement_y to "Prescribed" and the Displacement_z to "Free".

_Example:_
    
    
    pointdispl Point_1 "Displacement_x" "Fixed" "Displacement_y" "Prescribed" "Displacement_z" "Free"

Adds a point prescribed displacement feature to Point_1, sets the Displacement_x to "Fixed", the Displacement_y to "Prescribed" and the Displacement_z to "Free"

_Example:_
    
    
    pointdispl (Point_1 Point_2) "Displacement_x" "Fixed" "Displacement_y" "Prescribed" "Displacement_z" "Free"

Adds point prescribed displacement features to Point_1 and Point_2, sets the Displacement_x to "Fixed", the Displacement_y to "Prescribed" and the Displacement_z to "Free" for both point prescribed displacements.

## See also

[point](GUID-24E81355-9B0D-4CCF-AA5B-B50FDB985916.html)

#  slice ( )

Selects results from a list of objects with a specified criterion. 

## Signature
    
    
    slice [I] | {[I] [I]}

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
I  | int  |  Start index for selecting results from a list | End index for selecting results from a list   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
\-  |  PlxValues   
  
## Objects created

PlxValues 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Copies full list of values from the object and creates a new object. 

_Example:_
    
    
    slice Utot_Phase_1_Soil_1

Copies the entire list of values and creates a new object. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Selects results from a list of objects starting from a specified index. 

_Example:_
    
    
    slice Utot_Phase_1_Soil_1 10

Selects results from a list of objects starting from index 10.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Selects results from a list of objects with a specific range of indicies. 

_Example:_
    
    
    slice Utot_Phase_1_Soil_1 1 3

Selects results from a list of objects from the index 1 up to 3\. 

## See also

[plxvalues](GUID-837BF12E-577D-4975-971D-A9719C3ADA8F.html)

---|---|---

## Scope

---|---

## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Reverses the last action.

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

#  NURBSSurface

NURBS surface. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the NURBS surface.   
TypeName  |  TypeName  |  \-  |  TypeName of a NURBS surface.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on a NURBS surface.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the subsection of a NURBS surface.   
Parent  |  Parent  |  \-  |  Name of the parent object of a NURBS surface.   
Generator  |  Generator  |  \-  |  Generator of the NURBS surface boundary level.   
BoundingBox  |  Bounding box  |  \-  |  Coordinates of the diagonal defining the bounding box for the NURBS surface.   
x  |  x  |  Length  |  x-coordinate.   
y  |  y  |  Length  |  y-coordinate.   
z  |  z  |  Length  |  z-coordinate.   
AxisFunction  |  AxisFunction  |  \-  | 

  * Automatic  The first axis of the local coordinate system of the NURBSSurface is in the direction of the NURBSSurface. The second and third axis are defined automatically according to the global coordinate system. 
  * Manual  The first axis of the local coordinate system of the NURBSSurface is in the direction of the NURBSSurface. The second axis is defined manually, the third axis is defined automatically according to the right hand rule. 

  
AxisVectorX  |  Axis vector X  |  \-  |  Vector defining axis X.   
AxisVectorY  |  Axis vector Y  |  \-  |  Vector defining axis Y.   
AxisVectorZ  |  Axis vectorZ  |  \-  |  Vector defining axis Z.   
NurbsMinDegree  |  NURBS minimum degree  |  \-  |  The minimum degree of the polynomials.   
NurbsMaxDegree  |  NURBS maximum degree  |  \-  |  The maximum degree of the polynomials.   
GridPointCountRow  |  Grid point count row  |  \-  |  The number of grid rows where the point cloud is sampled.   
GridPointCountColumn  |  Grid point count column  |  \-  |  The number of grid columns where the point cloud is sampled.   
Continuity  |  Continuity  |  \-  |  Continuity   
Status  |  Status  |  \-  |  The status reported by the generator tool.

## GUID-BD3CEE00-EAC7-43D0-890E-FA23C9CEC95B.html

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  reinforcement (rif)

Adds reinforcements to a polycurve chain. 

## Signature
    
    
    reinforcement <{geo... | polycch_obj}> [PropName PropValue]...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
geo  | obj  |  Geometric entity, name of the geometric entity on which reinforcements have to be created   
polycch_obj  | obj  |  Polycurvechain object reference, name of the polycurvechain to which reinforcements are to be added   
PropName  | str  | Property name   
PropValue  | str | float  | Property-value pair   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Reinforcements](GUID-FAF51C48-81C3-48C1-AE96-0C6B69B7604D.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds reinforcements to one or more segments in a tunnel. 

_Example:_
    
    
    reinforcement Tunnel_1.SliceSurfaces[0]

Adds reinforcements to Tunnel_1.SliceSurfaces[0].

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds reinforcement elements to a polycurve chain. 

_Example:_
    
    
    reinforcement PolycurveChain_1

Adds reinforcements to PolycurveChain_1.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Adds reinforcements to one or more segments in a tunnel and changes the specified properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    reinforcement Tunnel_1.SliceSurfaces[0] "Comments" "anchor"

Adds reinforcements to Tunnel_1.SliceSurfaces[0] and changes the "Comments" parameter.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Adds reinforcements to a polycurve chain and changes the specified properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    reinforcement PolycurveChain_1 "Name" "New_reinforcement_name"

Adds reinforcements to PolycurveChain_1 and changes its name to "New_reinforcement_name".

## GUID-BD6D83FA-FD49-4A93-A025-081068B6A766.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  movepoint ()

Moves a point of a polygon or water level without any connected features. 

## Signature
    
    
    movepoint <pt_num> <x y z>

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_num  | obj  |  Number of the point that should be moved. The numbering of points is 0-based, so the first point has number 0.   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures, Flow conditions |  Polygon | Water level   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Moves a point of a polygon to another location. 

_Example:_
    
    
    movepoint Polygon_1 4 (1 2 3)

Moves the point at index 4 of Polygon_1 to the location with coordinates (1, 2, 3) 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Moves a point of an existing water level to another location. 

_Example:_
    
    
    movepoint UserWaterLevel_1 4 (1 2 3)

Moves the point at index 4 of UserWaterLevel_1 to the location with coordinates (1, 2, 3)

#  commands (cms)

Displays available commands and their signatures. 

## Signature
    
    
    commands [{ptcmd | lst_obj | lst_obj ptcmd}]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
ptcmd  | str  |  Part of the commands to be displayed   
lst_obj  | obj  |  Listable object reference, name of the listable of which the objects are to be displayed   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global, Any   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays all available global commands for the current working mode with their corresponding signature(s). 

_Example:_
    
    
    commands

Displays all available global commands for the current working mode with their corresponding signature(s).

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Displays the signatures of one or more global commands. 

_Example:_
    
    
    commands "undo"

Displays the signatures of the command "undo".

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Displays all available commands for an object with their signatures. 

_Example:_
    
    
    commands Point_1

Displays all available commands for Point_1 with their signatures.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Identifies commands by part of their name and display the signatures of a specific command. 

_Example:_
    
    
    commands Point_1 "m"

Displays the signatures of the commands of Point_1 containing "m".

[__dump](GUID-2CFFCF5F-847B-4F78-A4E2-A19A6E2DD8DD.html), [echo](GUID-4705E5FE-361C-46CF-AD52-4B7F134430F6.html), [info](GUID-9790EC03-2243-4E80-AB61-3A935B32EE97.html)

## GUID-BF26857F-15EC-435A-99E3-31BBFC2899BF.html

#  Dynamics

Dynamics is a staged construction feature. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
BoundaryXMin  |  Xmin boundary  |  \-  | 

  * None  The Xmin boundary of the model is set to none. 
  * Viscous  The Xmin boundary of the model is set to viscous. 
  * Free field  The Xmin boundary of the model is set to free field. 

  
BoundaryXMax  | Xmax boundary  | \-  | 

  * None  The Xmax boundary of the model is set to none. 
  * Viscous  The Xmax boundary of the model is set to viscous. 
  * Free field  The Xmax boundary of the model is set to free field. 

  
BoundaryYMin  |  Ymin boundary  |  \-  | 

  * None  The Xmax boundary of the model is set to none. 
  * Viscous  The Xmax boundary of the model is set to viscous. 
  * Compliant base  The Xmax boundary of the model is set to compliant base. 

  
BoundaryYMin  | Ymin boundary  | \-  | 

  * None  The Xmax boundary of the model is set to none. 
  * Viscous  The Xmax boundary of the model is set to viscous. 
  * Free field  The Xmax boundary of the model is set to free field. 

  
BoundaryYMax  | Ymax boundary  | \-  | 

  * None  The Ymax boundary of the model is set to none. 
  * Viscous  The Ymax boundary of the model is set to viscous. 
  * Free field  The Ymax boundary of the model is set to free field. 

  
BoundaryZMin  |  Zmin boundary  |  \-  | 

  * None  The Zmin boundary of the model is set to none. 
  * Viscous  The Zmin boundary of the model is set to viscous. 
  * Compliant base  The Zmin boundary of the model is set to compliant base. 

  
BoundaryZMax  |  Zmax boundary  |  \-  | 

  * None  The Zmax boundary of the model is set to none. 
  * Viscous  The Zmax boundary of the model is set to viscous. 

  
AllNodeFixities  | All node fixities  | \-  | 

  * None  All node fixities of the model are set to none. 
  * Fixed in x-direction  All node fixities of the model are set to be fixed in x-direction. 
  * Fixed in y-direction  All node fixities of the model are set to be fixed in y-direction. 
  * Fixed in z-direction  All node fixities of the model are set to be fixed in z-direction. 

  
NormalRelaxCoeffC1  |  Boundary C1  |  \-  |  Relaxation coefficient used to improve the wave adsorbent boundaries. This corrects the dissipation in the direction normal to the boundary.   
TangentialRelaxCoeffC2  |  Boundary C2  |  \-  |  Relaxation coefficient used to improve the wave adsorbent boundaries. This corrects the dissipation in the tangential direction.

## GUID-BF30A182-10C2-4583-8015-D9997574D427.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  importtrajectory (itr)

Imports a polycurve as the trajectory of a tunnel. The polycurve can only contain lines and arcs, and they should be positioned on the XY-plane. 

## Signature
    
    
    importtrajectory <tn_obj> <File> [{PropName PropValue}...]
    	PropName: ["Scale"] ["Tolerance"] ["Segments"] ["SegmentsOrigin"]
    	PropValue: Depends on PropName. See below for details.
    		if "Scale" : Scale_Factor
    		if "Tolerance" : Tolerance
    		if "Segments" : Segment_Number(s)
    		if "SegmentsOrigin" : StartEnd_Segment_Number {"StartPoint" | "EndPoint"}

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
tn_obj  | obj  |  Tunnel object reference, Name of a tunnel object   
File  | str  |  File name of the object that should be imported as tunnel trajectory   
Scale_Factor  | float  |  Property value when "Scale" is specified. The scaling factor applied to the imported trajectory   
Tolerance  | float  |  Property value when "Tolerance" is specified. The tolerance value for adjacent points to be merged of the imported trajectory   
Segment_Number(s)  | int  |  Property value when "Segments" is specified. The number of segments to be imported as trajectory   
StartEnd_Segment_Number  | int  |  Property value when "SegmentsOrigin" is specified. The number of segment indicating the start or end of the trajectory   
"StartPoint" | str  | Property value when "SegmentsOrigin" is specified. Indicates that the selected segment will be the start of the trajectory   
"EndPoint" | str  | Property value when "SegmentsOrigin" is specified. Indicates that the selected segment will be the end of the trajectory   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Polycurve](GUID-1CDD88A0-44E8-4D70-8502-5D3B2D1FADEB.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Imports a polycurve as the trajectory of a tunnel. 

_Example:_
    
    
    importtrajectory Tunnel_1 "D:\PLAXIS\shapes\mypolycurve.dxf"

Imports the polycurve in file mypolycurve.dxf as the trajectory of Tunnel_1.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Imports one or more polycurves into the cross-section of a tunnel considering additional settings. 

_Example:_
    
    
    importtrajectory Tunnel_1 "D:\PLAXIS\shapes\trajectory.dxf" "Scale" 2.0 "Tolerance" 1.0E-4 "Segments" (2 3 4) "SegmentsOrigin" (2 "StartPoint")

Imports contents of the file trajectory.dxf into Tunnel_1 as trajectory. The scaling factor is set to 2.0, merge points tolerance is equal to 1.0E-4, segments 2, 3 and 4 will be imported, the start of the trajectory will be defined at the start point of segment 2 (alternatively "EndPoint" keyword can be used). Note that depending on the provided segment for the "SegmentsOrigin" parameter, objects included as "Segments" may be skipped.

## GUID-BF60F423-93C6-4891-8BBD-6A036B1B4153.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  import ()

Imports one or more points, lines, polycurves, polygons or waterlevels. The following file formats are supported: dxf, step, stp, brep. In case of a dxf import, it is important to set 'INSUNIT' global variable in the dxf file to the desired unit. 

## Signature
    
    
    import <File> [{PropName PropValue}...]
    	PropName: ["ImportType"] ["ImportFilter"] ["Scaling"] ["AxisTransformation"] ["Offset"] ["Files"]
    	PropValue: Depends on PropName. See below for details.
    		if "ImportType" : "structures" | "soilvolume" | "soilsurfacetop" | "soilsurfacebottom"
    		if "ImportFilter" : "points", "lines", "polycurves", "surfaces", "volumes" or a combination of these separated by | character.
    		if "Offset" : (x y z)
    		if "Scaling" : ScalingValue
    		if "AxisTransformation" : {"x" | "y" | "z"} | {"xm" | "ym" | "zm"} | {"xs" | "ys" | "zs"} | {"xms" | "yms" | "zms" | "xsm" | "ysm" | "zsm"}
    		if "Files" : File...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
File  | str  |  Full path of the file that should be imported   
"structures","soilvolume" | "soilsurfacetop" | "soilsurfacebottom" | str  | Property value when "ImportType" is specified.   
"points", "lines", "polycurves", "surfaces", "volumes" or a combination of these  | str  | Property value when "ImportFilter" is specified. The value "points" can be specified when only points are to be imported. The value "lines" can be specified when only lines are to be imported. The value "polycurves" can be specified when only polycurves are to be imported. The value "surfaces" can be specified when only surfaces are to be imported. The value "volumes" can be specified when only volumes are to be imported. A combination of these values separated by the | character will consider the corresponding geometric entities to be imported.   
ScalingValue  | float  | Property value when "Scaling" is specified. The value is the scaling factor to be considered.   
"x", "y", "z" | float  | Property value when "AxisTransformation" is specified. The value "x" will consider the x-axis as the source vertical axis. The value "y" will consider the y-axis as the source vertical axis. The value "z" will consider the z-axis as the source vertical axis. The default value is "z".   
"xm", "ym", "zm" | float  | Property value when "AxisTransformation" is specified. The value "x" will consider the x-axis as the source vertical axis and having the Swap x-axis and y-axis option selected. The value "y" will consider the y-axis as the source vertical axis and having the Swap x-axis and y-axis option selected. The value "z" will consider the z-axis as the source vertical axis and having the Swap x-axis and y-axis option selected. The default value is "z".   
"xms", "yms", "zms", "xsm", "ysm", "zsm" | float  | Property value when "AxisTransformation" is specified. The value "x" will consider the x-axis as the source vertical axis, having the Mirror y-axis and the Swap x-axis and y-axis options selected. The value "y" will consider the y-axis as the source vertical axis, having the Mirror y-axis and the Swap x-axis and y-axis options selected. The value "z" will consider the z-axis as the source vertical axis, having the Mirror y-axis and the Swap x-axis and y-axis options selected. The default value is "z".   
x, y, z  | float  | Property value when "Offset" is specified. The values are x-, y-, z-coordinates specified.   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

PlxObject 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Imports all objects from a specified location into the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    import "C:\PLAXIS\geometry_file.dxf"

Imports all geometry from a specified location C:\PLAXIS\geometry_file.dxf.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Imports geometric objects from a file into the geometry using specific import configuration. 

_Example:_
    
    
    import "C:\PLAXIS\geometry_file.dxf" "ImportType" "structures" "ImportFilter" "surfaces|volumes" "Scaling" 1.5 "Offset" (-1 2.5 0.0) "AxisTransformation" "zms"

Imports only surfaces and volumes from a specified location C:\PLAXIS\geometry_file.dxf into the geometry with scaling of 1.5, with an offset of (-1 2.5 0.0), sets the axis deformation to z-axis, activates the mirror y-axis and swap x-axis and y-axis. Options for "ImportType" are "structures" "soilvolume", "soilsurfacetop" and "soilsurfacebottom" and it defaults to "structures". Options "ImportFilter" are subset of "point|polycurve|surface|volume" and it defaults to importing everything. The "Scaling" defaults to 1.0. The "Offset" defaults to (0.0 0.0 0.0). The "AxisTransformation" can have values of "x", "y", "z", "xm", "ym", "zm", "xs", "ys", "zs", "xms", "yms", "zms", "xsm", "ysm", "zsm", and it defaults to "z". The "NurbsGrid" for conversion to NURBSsurface is disabled by default if nothing is specified. The "IFCFilteringParameters" can have value of "ifcpile ifcslab ifcwall ifcplate ifcfooting ifcroof ifcbeam ifccolumn" and defaults to importing everything. 

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Imports all objects from multiple files. 

_Example:_
    
    
    import "Files" ("C:\PLAXIS\geometry_file.dxf" "D:\import\polygon.dxf")

Imports all geometry from a multiple files C:\PLAXIS\geometry_file.dxf and D:\import\polygon.dxf.

## See also

[importfielddata](GUID-0D320A2E-E1F8-418E-9FAE-277D2E44A1FA.html), [importifc](GUID-21F409F6-15B6-4DF4-AEFC-24B063BA7536.html), [importpointcloud](GUID-7F121703-D18A-4263-B9A4-8C95E1EA4F9B.html)

#  PlateMat

Material set assigned to a plate 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the plate material.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the plate material.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the plate material object.   
Identification  |  Identification  |  \-  |  Identification of the plate material   
Colour  |  Colour  |  \-  |  Colour of the plate material.   
MaterialType  | Material Type  | \-  | 

  * No material type  No material type selected. 
  * Elastic  Sets anchor material behaviour to elastic. 
  * Elastoplastic  Sets plate material behaviour to elastoplastic. 

  
Gamma  |  γ  |  Force/Length 3 |  Unit weight of the plate material.   
DampingMethod  |  Damping method  |  \-  | 

  * Direct  Allows to specify Rayleigh alpha and beta. 
  * SDOF equivalence  Single Degree of Freedom equivalent values 

  
RayleighAlpha  |  Rayleigh alpha  |  \-  |  Rayleigh alpha value.   
RayleighBeta  |  Rayleigh beta  |  \-  |  Rayleigh beta value.   
TargetDamping1  |  ξ 2 |  %  |  Damping target value 1.   
TargetDamping2  |  ξ 2 |  %  |  Damping target value 2.   
TargetFrequency1  |  f 1 |  Hz  |  Damping target frequency value 1.   
TargetFrequency2  |  f 2 |  Hz  |  Damping target frequency value 2.   
PreventPunching  |  Prevent punching  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables prevent punching option. 
  * False  Disables prevent punching option. 

  
E1  | E 1 | Force/Length  |  Young's modulus in first axial direction.   
E2  | E 2 | Force/Length  |  Young's modulus in second axial direction.   
StructNu12  |  ν 12 |  \-  |  Poisson's ratio.   
d  | d  | Length  | Thickness of the plate   
G12  |  G 12 |  Force/Length 2 |  In-plane shear modulus.   
G13  |  G 13 |  Force/Length 2 |  Out-of-plane shear modulus related to shear deformation over first direction.   
G23  |  G 23 |  Force/Length 2 |  Out-of-plane shear modulus related to shear deformation over second direction.   
YieldStress11  |  Yield stress σ y,11 |  Force/Length 2 |  Yield stress parameter in the first axial direction.   
YieldStress22  |  Yield stress σ y,22 |  Force/Length 2 |  Yield stress parameter in the second axial direction.   
W11  |  W 11 |  Length 2 |  Plastic section modulus in the first axial direction.   
W22  |  W 22 |  Length 2 |  Plastic section modulus in the second axial direction.

#  pointload (pld)

Adds point load features to points. 

## Signature
    
    
    pointload <point> [point]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
    	point: (x y z) | pt_obj
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [PointLoad](GUID-857F809A-D43C-4831-AE65-988AA5D3DF1A.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Name of the point to which a point load feature should be added   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [PointLoad](GUID-857F809A-D43C-4831-AE65-988AA5D3DF1A.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [PointLoad](GUID-857F809A-D43C-4831-AE65-988AA5D3DF1A.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[PointLoad](GUID-857F809A-D43C-4831-AE65-988AA5D3DF1A.html), [Point](GUID-B66BC755-E798-4237-AA8F-FC607481D430.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds point load features to one or more existing points in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    pointload (5 6 7)

Creates a new point at (5, 6, 7) and adds a point load feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    pointload Point_1

Adds a point load feature to Point_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    pointload Point_2 Point_3

Adds point load features to Point_2 and Point_3. 

_Example:_
    
    
    pointload Group_1

Adds point load features to all points in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only points.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds point load features to one or more existing points in the geometry and directly set their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    pointload (5 6 7) "Fx" -10 "Fy" -50 "Fz" -100

Creates a new point at (5, 6, 7), adds a point load feature to Point_1 and sets the Fx to -10, the Fy to -50 and the Fz to -100.

_Example:_
    
    
    pointload Point_1 "Fx" -10 "Fy" -50 "Fz" -100

Adds a point load feature to Point_1, sets the Fx to -10, the Fy to -50 and the Fz to -100

_Example:_
    
    
    pointload (Point_1 Point_2) "Fx" -10 "Fy" -50 "Fz" -100

Adds point load features to Point_1 and Point_2, sets the Fx to -10, the Fy to -50 and the Fz to -100 for both point loads.

## See also

[point](GUID-24E81355-9B0D-4CCF-AA5B-B50FDB985916.html)

#  close (cpc)

Closes a polycurve. 

## Signature
    
    
    close ["Line"] | {["Arc" R]}	
    

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14).

---|---|---

---|---

Segment

    close Polycurve_6 "Line"

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

_Example:_
    
    
    close Polycurve_4 "Arc" 5

#  WaterConditions

Water conditions of a soil volume. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the water conditions.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the water conditions.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the water conditions.   
Conditions  |  Conditions  |  \-  | 

  * Global level  The pore pressure distribution is hydrostatic and it is automatically calculated from the global water level. 
  * Custom level  The pore pressure distribution is hydrostatic and it is automatically calculated from a custom water level. 
  * Head  The pore pressure distribution is hydrostatic and defined by giving the z ref . 
  * User-defined  The pore pressure distribution is defined manually by giving the z ref , p ref and p inc . 
  * Interpolate  The pore pressure distribution is linearly interpolated from the pore pressures of the adjacent soil layers. 
  * Dry  The pore pressure in the soil layer is equal to zero. 

  
RefPos  |  z ref |  Length  |  z-coordinate where the pore pressure is equal to zero.   
Pref  |  p ref |  Force/Length 2 |  Reference pressure.   
Pinc  |  p inc |  Force/Length 2 /Length  |  Pressure increment.   
Level  |  Level  |  \-  |  Name of the water level from which the pore pressure distribution is calculated.

#  waterlevel (wl)

Creates a new water level with one or more points at a specified location. 

## Signature
    
    
    waterlevel <(x y
    				zref)> ... | <(x y zref p_inc> 

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  |  z-coordinate where the pore pressure is equal to zero   
p  inc | float  |  Pressure increment   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Flow conditions |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[waterlevel](GUID-C363A369-F5DC-42B8-82C1-3868777F6090.html#GUID-C363A369-F5DC-42B8-82C1-3868777F6090)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a new water level with a point at a specified location (x, y) and a zref. 

_Example:_
    
    
    waterlevel (6 4 1) (8 5 2) 

Creates a new water level with a water point at location (6, 4) with a zref of 1 and a water point at location (8, 5) with a zref of 2.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a new water level with a point at a specified location (x, y), a zref and a pinc

_Example:_
    
    
    waterlevel (6 4 1) 2

Creates a new water level with a point at location (6, 4) with a zref of 1 and a pinc of 2.

## See also

[addpoint](GUID-28FC204C-9A94-4B53-8630-C356010C2793.html), [addwaterpoint](GUID-FF782741-C125-42E6-8D10-EA49AE0ADECC.html), [deletepoint](GUID-00824185-7952-4620-8BC0-B1D81873A84F.html), [insertpoint](GUID-9B27B028-581D-442B-B2AC-F573D38FDA25.html), [insertwaterpoint](GUID-DF90D7DE-CEDE-44E4-9922-D113DA524827.html), [movepoint](GUID-BD6D83FA-FD49-4A93-A025-081068B6A766.html)

#  checkgeometry (cg)

Checks geometry consistency with a default tolerance value of (0.005 * diagonal of the model) or with an optional tolerance parameter. Checks if objects overlap or are adjacent and then returns the objects with the distance between them. 

## Signature
    
    
    checkgeometry [Num]
    

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
Num  | float  |  Tolerance value for checking geometry   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures, Mesh |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Checks geometry consistency with a default tolerance value of (0.005 * diagonal of the model). Checks if objects overlap or are adjacent and then returns the objects with the distance between them. 

_Example:_
    
    
    checkgeometry

Checks geometry consistency with a default tolerance value of (0.005 * diagonal of the model) and returns the objects with the distance between them.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Checks geometry consistency with a tolerance. Checks if objects overlap or are adjacent and returns the objects with the distance between them. 

_Example:_
    
    
    checkgeometry 0.1

Checks geometry consistency with a tolerance of 0.1 length units and returns the objects with the distance between them.

## See also

[mergeequivalents](GUID-3B1F977D-186A-4DC1-97BC-6A7DE3463AF8.html), [snap](GUID-39377F5D-B810-400C-BCEB-8A1BC776BF8A.html), [snaplinear](GUID-A535292D-AD0B-474E-92F1-2BA80534982D.html)

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
bh_obj  | obj  |  Name of the borehole that should be deleted   
sll_obj  | obj  |  Name of the soil layer that should be deleted   
fd_obj  | obj  |  Name of the field data object that should be deleted   
pt_obj  | obj  |  Name of the point that should be deleted   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Name of the line that should be deleted   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Name of the polycurve that should be deleted   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Name of the surface that should be deleted   
vol_obj  | obj  |  Name of the volume that should be deleted   
tn_obj  | obj  |  Name of the tunnel that should be deleted   
seg_obj  | obj  |  Name of the segment that should be deleted   
sub_pol_obj  | obj  |  Name of the polycurve subsection that should be deleted   
tn_part_obj  | obj  |  Name of the tunnel part that should be deleted   
tn_part_curve_obj  | obj  |  Name of the tunnel part curve that should be deleted   
mat_obj  | obj  |  Name of the material that should be deleted   
mltpl_obj  | obj  |  Name of the multiplier that should be deleted   
tb_row  | int  |  Index of the row that should be deleted. The numbering of rows is 0-based, so the first row has number 0.   
fl_func  | obj  |  Name of the head or discharge (flow) function that should be deleted   
plx_feat  | obj  |  Name of the PLAXIS feature that should be deleted   
ph_obj  | obj  |  Name of the phase that should be deleted   
wl_obj  | obj  |  Name of the water level that should be deleted   
con_obj  | obj  |  Name of the connection that should be deleted   
mov_func  | obj  |  Name of the movement function that should be deleted   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Tunnel | Table | Tunnel part | Tunnel parts | Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Deletes one or more objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    delete Borehole_1

Deletes Borehole_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    delete Borehole_1 Borehole_2 Borehole_3

Deletes Borehole_1, Borehole_2 and Borehole_3.

_Example:_
    
    
    delete Point_1 Line_1 Volume_1

Deletes Point_1, Line_1 and Volume_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    delete (Tunnel_1.CrossSection.Segments[0] Tunnel_1.CrossSection.Segments[1])

Deletes the segments with the index 0 and index 1 of Tunnel_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    delete Tunnel_1.CrossSection (Tunnel_1.CrossSection.Subsections[1] Tunnel_1.CrossSection.Subsections[2])

Deletes the sub sections with the index 1 and index 2 for the cross section of Tunnel_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    delete Materials[-1] Materials[-2]

Deletes two materials from the group of material objects (last and the second last).

_Example:_
    
    
    delete (Plate_1 Geogrid_2)

Deletes Plate_1 and Geogrid_2.

_Example:_
    
    
    delete UserWaterLevel_1 UserWaterLevel_2

Deletes UserWaterLevel_1 and UserWaterLevel_2.

_Example:_
    
    
    delete TunnelPart_3 (TunnelPartCurve_1)

Deletes TunnelPartCurve_1 from TunnelPart_3.

_Example:_
    
    
    delete TunnelParts_1 (TunnelPart_3)

Deletes TunnelPart_3 from TunnelParts_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    delete Connection_1 Connection_2 Connection_3

Deletes Connection_1, Connection_2 and Connection_3.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Deletes only one single object. 

_Example:_
    
    
    delete Soillayer_1

Deletes Soillayer_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    delete Tunnel_1

Deletes Tunnel_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    delete LoadMultiplier_1

Deletes LoadMultiplier_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    delete DisplacementMultiplier_1.Table 2

Deletes the row at index 2 from the table of DisplacementMultiplier_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    delete HeadFunction_1

Deletes HeadFunction_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    delete Phase_4

Deletes Phase_4.

_Example:_
    
    
    delete MovementFunction_3

Deletes MovementFunction_3.

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  validate (val)

Checks the Material parameters for invalid inputs. 

## Signature
    
    
    validate <mat_obj> [type]
    	type: "errors" | "warnings" | "all"

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
mat_obj  | obj  |  Material object reference to be validated. The default name is Material.   
"errors" | str  | Validation will only show the errors. Skipping this parameter will show both errors and warnings.   
"warnings" | str  | Validation will only show the warnings. Skipping this parameter will show both errors and warnings.   
"all" | str  | Validation will show both errors and warnings. Skipping this parameter will show both errors and warnings.   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
SoilTest  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Checks if the parameters of the material are valid, displays errors and warnings if there are any. 

_Example:_
    
    
    validate Material

Checks if the parameters of SoilMat1 are valid, and displays errors and warnings if there are any. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Checks if the parameters of the material are valid, displays only the errors if there are any. 

_Example:_
    
    
    validate Material "errors"

Checks if the parameters of Material are valid, and displays only the errors if there are any. 

## See also

[echo](GUID-B2A809C6-AD6F-4A9B-8F10-9DAC79E4DB3C.html)

## GUID-CC6B7728-8E76-46C3-B4E7-CD780E473F0C.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  multiply (mul)

Multiplies properties of objects with a specified factor. 

## Signature
    
    
     multiply <mul_obj> <Num>
    	mul_obj: {prop_ref | obj_ref | list_ref}
    		prop_ref: <PropName>... [ph_obj]
    		obj_ref: <plx_obj>... <Param>
    		list_ref: <lst_obj> [Param]...
    

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
Num  | float  |  Number. Factor by which the values of the object properties should be multiplied   
PropName  | str  |  Property name. Name of property that should be multiplied   
ph_obj  | obj  |  Phase object reference. Name of the phase in which the object is to be multiplied   
plx_obj  | obj  | PLAXIS object reference. Plaxis object to be multiplied   
Param  | str  | Parameter. One or more parameters for the command that should be applied   
lst_obj  | obj  | Listable object reference. Name of the listable to which the command should be applied   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Object | Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Multiplies properties of objects with a specified factor. 

_Example:_
    
    
    multiply PointLoad_1 4

Multiplies components of PointLoad_1 with a factor of 4. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Multiplies properties of objects with a specified factor. 

_Example:_
    
    
    multiply LineLoad_1_1 "qy_start" Phase_3 2

Multiplies qy_start component of LineLoad_1 in Phase_3 with a factor of 2.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Multiplies properties of objects with a specified factor. 

_Example:_
    
    
    multiply (LineLoad_1 PointLoad_2.Fy) 2

Multiplies LineLoad_1 with a factor of 2 and the Fy component of PointLoad_2 with a factor of 2.

_Example:_
    
    
    multiply (PointLoad_1 PointLoad_2) "Fx" "Fy" 2

Multiplies Fx and Fy components of PointLoad_1 and PointLoad_2 with a factor of 2.

_Example:_
    
    
    multiply (PointLoad_1_1 PointLoad_2_1) "Fy" InitialPhase 2

Multiplies Fy component of PointLoad_1 and PointLoad_2 in the Initial phase with a factor of 2.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Multiplies properties of objects with a specified factor. 

_Example:_
    
    
    multiply (LineLoad_1 PointLoad_2) 2

Multiplies components of LineLoad_1 and PointLoad_2 with a factor of 2.

## Alternative 5

_Purpose:_

Multiplies properties of objects with a specified factor. 

_Example:_
    
    
    multiply (PointLoad_1 PointLoad_2) "Fy" 2

Multiplies components of LineLoad_1 and PointLoad_2 with a factor of 2.

#  sliceunmerge (slcunm)

Unmerges specific slicing groups in a tunnel

    sliceunmerge <Slice_Group>...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14).

## Scope

## Objects created

None

#  decomposesrf (desf)

Decomposes one or more volumes or structural surfaces into separate surfaces. 

## Signature
    
    
    decomposesrf <srf_obj | vol_obj>...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface that should be decomposed into separate surfaces   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference, Name of the volume that should be decomposed into separate surfaces   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Surface](GUID-064F8245-0453-4B36-B7F1-2D912DEAF9B3.html), [Group](GUID-EF9C50AC-FE74-4B34-9A0D-D86ECCD825E1.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Decomposes an existing non-flat structural surface or volume into separate surfaces. The default tolerance angle is 30 degrees. 

_Example:_
    
    
    decomposesrf Polygon_1

Decomposes Polygon_1 into separate surfaces. 

_Example:_
    
    
    decomposesrf (Surface_2 Surface_3)

Decomposes imported Surface_2 and Surface_3 into separate surfaces. 

_Example:_
    
    
    decomposesrf Volume_1

Decomposes Volume_1 into separate surfaces.

## See also

[decomposeoutl](GUID-1DDC3CF9-FDC4-45D7-8CD9-31731FAD5FDC.html), [decomposepolycurve](GUID-F26648DC-6AD2-4AC0-A0D3-7686E49CFE9F.html)

#  zoom ()

Zooms in a plot. 

## Signature
    
    
    zoom [plx_obj] | [(x y z)] | [BoundingBox]
    	BoundingBox: (x y z) (x y z)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  Object to which the view is to be centered   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Output  |  Plot   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Zooms in a plot. 

_Example:_
    
    
    zoom Plot_1

Zooms into the Plot_1. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Zooms in a plot centering to a geometric object. 

_Example:_
    
    
    zoom Plot_1 Plate_8

Zooms into the Plot_1 and centers the view on Plate_8.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Zooms in a plot centering to a geometric object. 

_Example:_
    
    
    zoom Plot_1 Plate_8

Zooms into the Plot_1 and centers the view on Plate_8.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Zooms in a plot. The defined point specifies where the viewpoint should centre on while keeping the same distance from the mesh. 

_Example:_
    
    
    zoom Plot_1 (2 3 5)

Zooms into the Plot_1 centering to point (2 3 5).

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Zooms in a plot. The defined points specify a bounding box on which the viewpoint focuses. 

_Example:_
    
    
    zoom Plot_1 (2 3 5) (0 0 0)

Zooms into the Plot_1 in a bounding box specified by points (2 3 5) and (0 0 0).

## See also

[export](GUID-10502A00-9ACA-428A-A73D-61A51292AE3B.html)

#  tunnel (tu)

Creates a tunnel at a specified location. 

## Signature
    
    
    tunnel <(x y z)> [(OrientAxis1x OrientAxis1y OrientAxis1z) (OrientAxis2x OrientAxis2y OrientAxis2z)]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14).

OrientAxisz  | float  | Orientation z-axis 1 or 2   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Tunnel](GUID-C5510F06-51D9-4C27-87E9-E33A85B81292.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a tunnel at a specified location. 

_Example:_
    
    
    tunnel (6 2)

Creates a tunnel at point (6 2).

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a tunnel at a specified location and define the orientation axes. 

_Example:_
    
    
    tunnel (6 2 3) (1 0 0) (0 0 1)

Creates a tunnel at point (6 2 3) and sets the orientation axis 1 to x-axis and the orientation axis 2 to z-axis.

## GUID-D7BBD382-3935-4DBC-A019-11A7CE5413DB.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  polycurve (pc)

Creates a polycurve. 

## Signature
    
    
     polycurve <point> <point> <point> [segment]...
    	point: (x y z)
    	segment:	{"line" Ang1 Len | "Arc" Ang1 Ang2 R}

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
"line" | str  |  Adds a line segment to the polycurve   
Ang1  | float  | Increment of the slope of the new line section   
Len  | float  |  Length of the new line section   
"arc" | str  |  Adds an arc section to the polycurve   
Ang2  | float  | Central angle of the new arc section   
Radius  | float  | Radius of the new arc section   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Polycurve](GUID-1CDD88A0-44E8-4D70-8502-5D3B2D1FADEB.html), [Segment](GUID-FA4769B6-2597-4755-A7B4-299E6345B4F1.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a polycurve. 

_Example:_
    
    
    polycurve (4 5 6) (0 0 1) (1 0 0)

Creates a polycurve at coordinate (4, 5, 6) with a local first axis in the direction of the global z-axis and a local second axis in the direction of the global x-axis.. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a polycurve and add one or more segments to it. 

_Example:_
    
    
    polycurve (4 5 6) (0 0 1) (1 0 0) "line" 0 2 "arc" 45 90 3

Creates a polycurve at coordinate (4, 5, 6) with a local first axis in the direction of the global z-axis and a local second axis in the direction of the global x-axis. , adds a line segment with an increment of the slope of 0° and a length of 2 to it and adds an arc segment with an increment of the slope of 45°, a central angle of 90° and a radius of 3 after that.. 

## See also

[add](GUID-AC7505C5-468F-4CD8-AA35-1914733B4B80.html), [close](GUID-C3151C98-F172-4FC6-9FF7-BA0048761D92.html), [extendtosymmetryaxis](GUID-33E3208E-1ABC-470D-949C-FDC2BBD409BE.html), [insert](GUID-459B7791-2B87-4746-946E-511420D77945.html), [reset](GUID-277D26FE-EB41-4B67-A841-24A92E59B22B.html), [symmetricclose](GUID-BB96CF95-505C-4C0F-80FE-42752865EF4B.html),

#  CableMat

Material set that can be assigned to a cable. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the cable material.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the cable material.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the cable material.   
Identification  |  Identification  |  \-  |  Identification of the cable material.   
Colour  |  Colour  |  \-  |  Colour of the cable material.   
MaterialType  |  Material type  |  \-  | 

  * None  No material type selected. 
  * Elastic  Sets the cable material behaviour to elastic. 
  * Elastoplastic  Sets the cable material behaviour to elastic. 

  
LSpacing  |  L spacing |  Length  |  Distance between the cable s in the out-of-plane direction.   
CrossSectionType  |  Cross section type  |  \-  | 

  * Predefined  Use one of the predefined cross section types. 
  * User-defined  Define a cross section by giving geometric values. 

  
PredefinedCrossSectionType  |  Predefined cross section type  |  \-  | 

  * Solid circular beam  Use a solid circular beam. 
  * Circular tube  Use a circular tube. 

  
Diameter  |  Diameter  |  Length  |  Diameter of a circular tube or solid circular beam.   
A  |  Area  |  Length 2 |  Area of the cross-section of the cable.   
E  |  Young's modulus  |  Force/Length 2 |  Young's modulus of the cable material.   
NpComp  |  N p,comp |  Force  |  Maximum compressive axial force (without any acting bending moment) of the cable material.   
NpTens  |  N p,tens |  Force  |  Maximum tensile axial force (without any acting bending moment) of the cable material.   
KsBond  |  Shear stiffness k s |  Force/Length 2 | Stress dependent shear stiffness of the bond.   
FullyBonded  | Fully bonded  | \-  | 

  * True  No bond failure (plasticity) takes place. 
  * False  Bond failure (plasticity) can take place. 

  
BondStrengthDistribution  | Strength distribution  | \-  | 

  * Uniform  Sets the bond strength distribution to uniform. 
  * Multi-linear  Sets the bond strength distribution to multi-linear. 

  
CohesiveStrengthBond  | Cohesive strength  | Force/Length  | Bond cohesive strength   
PhiBond  | φ bond | °  | Bond friction angle   
FailureSurfacePerimeter  | Failure surface perimeter  | \-  | 

  * Predefined  The failure perimeter is calculated by default based on cable diameter, assuming that failure takes place at the cable circumference. 
  * User-defined  A value is required to directly define the failure perimeter. 

  
Perimeter  | Perimeter  | Length  | The value of the failure surface perimeter.   
  
## See also

#  Deformations

Deformations is a staged construction feature. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
BoundaryXMin  |  Xmin boundary  |  \-  | 

  * Free  The Xmin boundary of the model is set to free. 
  * Normally fixed  The Xmin boundary of the model is fixed in the X direction. 
  * Horizontally fixed  The Xmin boundary of the model is fixed in the X and Y direction. 
  * Vertically fixed  The Xmin boundary of the model is fixed in the Z direction. 
  * Fully fixed  The Xmin boundary of the model is fixed in all directions. 

  
BoundaryXMax  |  Xmax boundary  |  \-  | 

  * Free  The Xmax boundary of the model is set to free. 
  * Normally fixed  The Xmax boundary of the model is fixed in the Y direction. 
  * Horizontally fixed  The Xmax boundary of the model is fixed in the X and Y direction. 
  * Vertically fixed  The Xmax boundary of the model is fixed in the Z direction. 
  * Fully fixed  The Xmax boundary of the model is fixed in all directions. 

  
BoundaryYMin  |  Ymin boundary  |  \-  | 

  * Free  The Ymin boundary of the model is set to free. 
  * Normally fixed  The Ymin boundary of the model is fixed in the Y direction. 
  * Horizontally fixed  The Ymin boundary of the model is fixed in the Y and X direction. 
  * Vertically fixed  The Ymin boundary of the model is fixed in the Z direction. 
  * Fully fixed  The Ymin boundary of the model is fixed in all directions. 

  
BoundaryYMax  |  Ymax boundary  |  \-  | 

  * Free  The Ymax boundary of the model is set to free. 
  * Normally fixed  The Ymax boundary of the model is fixed in the Y direction. 
  * Horizontally fixed  The Ymax boundary of the model is fixed in the Y and X direction. 
  * Vertically fixed  The Ymax boundary of the model is fixed in the Z direction. 
  * Fully fixed  The Ymax boundary of the model is fixed in all directions. 

  
BoundaryZMin  |  Zmin boundary  |  \-  | 

  * Free  The Zmin boundary of the model is set to free. 
  * Normally fixed  The Zmin boundary of the model is fixed in the Z direction. 
  * Horizontally fixed  The Zmin boundary of the model is fixed in the X and Y direction. 
  * Vertically fixed  The Zmin boundary of the model is fixed in the Z direction. 
  * Fully fixed  The Zmin boundary of the model is fixed in all directions. 

  
BoundaryZMax  |  Zmax boundary  |  \-  | 

  * Free  The Zmax boundary of the model is set to free. 
  * Normally fixed  The Zmax boundary of the model is fixed in the Z direction. 
  * Horizontally fixed  The Zmax boundary of the model is fixed in the X and Y direction. 
  * Vertically fixed  The Zmax boundary of the model is fixed in the Z direction. 
  * Fully fixed  The Zmax boundary of the model is fixed in all directions.

## GUID-DA567E53-B25D-48C0-A08F-17036C9438A3.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  combine (cmb)

Combines many objects to create a new object. This is possible only with same objects, such as parametric-parametric or non-parametric-non-parametric, no mixed objects are allowed.

## Signature
    
    
    combine <ln obj | polyc_obj | srf_obj | vol_obj> [B]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference, Name of the line that should be combined   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Polycurve object reference, Name of the polycurve that should be combined   
srf_obj  | obj  | Surface object reference, Name of the surface that should be combined   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference, Name of the volume that should be combined   
B  | boolean  |  True enables the option to keep the original objects, False disables this option   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Line](GUID-EA175FC9-E4E6-4FD3-97C0-4F1F3624D025.html), [Polycurve](GUID-1CDD88A0-44E8-4D70-8502-5D3B2D1FADEB.html)[, Surface](GUID-064F8245-0453-4B36-B7F1-2D912DEAF9B3.html)[, Volume](GUID-CDDE333E-8922-4FF5-B2DB-4B6B31644557.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Combines two or more lines to create one new line. 

_Example:_
    
    
    combine (Line_1 Line_2)

Combines Line_1 and Line_2 into one new line. Line_1 and Line_2 will be deleted. E.g., if Line_1 has a LineLoad feature and Line_2 has a PrescribedDisplacement feature, then the new line has both features.. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Combines two or more surfaces to create one new surface and optionally keeps the original objects. If the original surfaces have features assigned to them, the new surface will also have them. 

_Example:_
    
    
    combine (Polygon_1 Polygon_2) True

Combines Polygon_1 and Polygon_2 into one new line but keeps the original lines. 

## See also

[intersectsegments](GUID-8CE56408-0270-4030-99FA-8CBF4AC028FB.html) [, intersect](GUID-578B164F-64A9-4253-AB25-E0AA306A029C.html)

#  addtunnelphaseroutine (atproutine)

Adds a phase routine to a tunnel sequence. 

## Signature
    
    
    addtunnelphaseroutine <tn_obj> 

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

No parameters 

## Scope

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
tn_obj  | obj  |  Tunnel object reference. Tunnel to be generated   
  
## Objects created

[Tunnel](GUID-C5510F06-51D9-4C27-87E9-E33A85B81292.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds a phase routine to a tunnel sequence. 

_Example:_
    
    
    addtunnelphaseroutine Tunnel_1.PhasesDefinition

Adds a phase routine to Tunnel_1.PhasesDefinition. 

## See also

[addtunnelphasestep](GUID-2237B2E6-E765-4975-8B41-69EE10E27054.html), [removetunnelphasestep](GUID-3B6027AA-8D1E-4FB1-A99B-5A3FB9E77366.html), [removetunnelphaseroutine](GUID-DF488BD8-C844-407D-BB5A-A49465B83E62.html).

#  embeddedbeammat (mem)

Creates an embedded beam material set. 

## Signature
    
    
    embeddedbeammat [{PropName PropValue}]...
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [EmbeddedBeamMat](GUID-15B679F7-7588-43C8-A9AB-F1B127AE8185.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
PropName  | str  |  Property name. Details on the available properties at object [EmbeddedBeamMat](GUID-15B679F7-7588-43C8-A9AB-F1B127AE8185.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  |  Property value. Details on the available properties at object [EmbeddedBeamMat](GUID-15B679F7-7588-43C8-A9AB-F1B127AE8185.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[EmbeddedBeamMat](GUID-15B679F7-7588-43C8-A9AB-F1B127AE8185.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates an embedded beam material set with no specified properties. It is not possible to calculate with this material before editing it to make its properties valid. 

_Example:_
    
    
    embeddedbeammat

Creates a new embedded beam material set.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates an embedded beam material set with specified properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    embeddedbeammat "Identification" "Piles" "MaterialType" "Elastic" "Gamma" 24 "E" 10000000 "Diameter" 0.25 "TSkinStartMax" 1 "TSkinEndMax" 100 "FMax" 100

Creates an embedded beam material set.

## See also

[embeddedbeam](GUID-886C96D7-3224-422C-903A-5F308D18323A.html)

**Parent topic:** [ Input commands reference ](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html)

#  removetunnelphaseroutine (rtproutine)

Removes a tunnel phase routine from a tunnel. 

## Signature
    
    
    removetunnelphaseroutine <Index>

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
Index  | int  |  Index of the tunnel phase routine that should be removed. The numbering of the values is 0-based.   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Removes a tunnel phase routine at a specified index from a tunnel. 

_Example:_
    
    
    removetunnelphaseroutine Tunnel_1.PhasesDefinition 2

Removes the tunnel phase routine at index 2 from Tunnel_1

[addtunnelphaseroutine](GUID-DE43A4DF-ECD5-41F7-BDC2-6302EF553AA6.html), [addtunnelphasestep](GUID-2237B2E6-E765-4975-8B41-69EE10E27054.html), [removetunnelphasestep](GUID-3B6027AA-8D1E-4FB1-A99B-5A3FB9E77366.html), [tunnel](GUID-D750CED7-5801-425F-BE0F-142EC33000B3.html)

#  insertwaterpoint ()

Inserts a new point to an existing water level. 

## Signature
    
    
    insertwaterpoint <pt_num> <point> <pinc>
    	point: point:	{(x y z)} | pt_obj	

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_num  | int  |  Number of the point before which the new point should be inserted. The numbering of points is 0-based, so the first point has number 0.   
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, point name   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate  
z  | float  | z-coordinate where the pore pressure is equal to zero   
pinc  | float  | Water pressure increment   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Flow conditions |  Water level   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Inserts a new point to an existing water level before a specified point of the water level. 

_Example:_
    
    
    insertwaterpoint UserWaterLevel_1 3 (2 6 4) -5)

Inserts a new point to UserWaterLevel_1 before the point at index 3 with coordinates (2, 6, 4) and a Pinc value of -5.

## See also

[addwaterpoint](GUID-FF782741-C125-42E6-8D10-EA49AE0ADECC.html), [insertpoint](GUID-9B27B028-581D-442B-B2AC-F573D38FDA25.html)

**Parent topic:** [ Input commands reference ](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html)

#  Connection

Connection between two objects. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the connection.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the connection.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the connection.   
CustomPart  |  Custom part  |  \-  |  Custom part of the two connected objects.   
ReferencePart  |  Reference part  |  \-  |  Reference part is the part to which it is connected.   
Rotation1  |  Rotation1  |  \-  | 

  * Free  The rotation in local direction 1 of the connection is set to free. 
  * Fixed  The rotation in local direction 1 of the connection is set to fixed. 

  
Rotation2  |  Rotation2  |  \-  | 

  * Free  The rotation in local direction 2 of the connection is set to free. 
  * Fixed  The rotation in local direction 2 of the connection is set to fixed. 

  
Rotation3  |  Rotation3  |  \-  | 

  * Free  The rotation in local direction 3 of the connection is set to free. 
  * Fixed  The rotation in local direction 3 of the connection is set to fixed. 

  
TransLation1  |  Translation1  |  \-  | 

  * Free  The translation in local direction 1 of the connection is set to free. 
  * Fixed  The translation in local direction 1 of the connection is set to fixed. 

  
TransLation2  |  Translation2  |  \-  | 

  * Free  The translation in local direction 2 of the connection is set to free. 
  * Fixed  The translation in local direction 2 of the connection is set to fixed. 

  
TransLation3  |  Translation3  |  \-  | 

  * Free  The translation in local direction 3 of the connection is set to free. 
  * Fixed  The translation in local direction 3 of the connection is set to fixed.

#  Plot

Result types for plot object 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
DrawFrame  |  DrawFrame  |  \-  |  Draw the frame containing information around the exported image.   
DrawProjectDirectory  |  DrawProjectDirectory  |  \-  |  Draw the directory where the project is located.   
DrawTitle  |  DrawTitle  |  \-  |  Draw the title bar.   
DrawLegend  |  DrawLegend  |  \-  |  Draw the legend.   
DrawRulers  |  DrawRulers  |  \-  |  Draw the rulers.   
DrawAxes  |  DrawAxes  |  \-  |  Draw the x, y and z axis.   
DrawLogo  |  DrawLogo  |  \-  |  Draw the company logo.   
ProjectDescription  |  ProjectDescription  |  \-  |  Set or edit the description of the project.   
ResultType  |  ResultType  |  \-  |  Controls what result type is shown in the plot.   
PlotType  |  PlotType  |  \-  |  Controls how the result is visualised (echo PlotTypes to get the list of possible values).   
Phase  |  Phase  |  \-  |  Define the phase for the exported image. Setting this will set Step to the last step of this phase.   
Step  |  Step  |  \-  |  Define the step for the exported image. Setting this will set Phase to the parent phase of this step.   
PhaseBehavior  |  PhaseBehavior  |  \-  |  Controls which phase/step the plot will use to render the image when using the export command. By default is set to plotphase and can be switched into projectphase.   
ScaleFactor  |  ScaleFactor  |  \-  |  Controls the deformation scale. When this is set, LogScaleFactor is ignored.   
LogScaleFactor  |  LogScaleFactor  |  \-  |  Makes the mesh use a logarithmic scaling instead of a linear one. When this is set, ScaleFactor is ignored.   
LegendSettings  |  LegendSettings  |  \-  |  Object to control the legend.   
MeshSettings  |  MeshSettings  |  \-  |  Object to control various visibility settings on the mesh.   
  
## See also

[ResultTypes](GUID-9D617F7E-FCE8-4CDC-A5EA-78FA423D3BD4.html)

#  projectpoints (projp)

Projects the points of a non-flat surface onto its plane. 

## Signature
    
    
    projectpoints

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

No parameters 

## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Polygon   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

If the plane definition of the surface is set to 'First points' the plane is defined by the first three points of the surface, if it is set to 'Best fit' all points are used to define the plane using the least squares method. This command projects the points of a surface onto the plane as defined above. 

_Example:_
    
    
    projectpoints Polygon_1

Projects the points of Polygon_1 onto the plane of Polygon_1.

## See also

[surface](GUID-60600C86-7D70-4160-997A-A81DB39A36DB.html)

**Parent topic:** [ Input commands reference ](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html)

#  __getnormal (__gn)

Displays the normal of a polycurve, planar surface or polygon. 

## Signature
    
    
    __getnormal [(x y z)]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Polycurve, Surface, Polygon  
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays the normal of a polycurve. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __getnormal Polycurve_1

Displays the normal of Polycurve_1.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Displays the normal of a surface or polygon at a specified point. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __getnormal Surface_1 (3 2 0)

Displays the normal of Surface_1 at a point on Surface_1 nearest to (3, 2, 0).

#  apply (map)

Applies a command to multiple objects at once. 

## Signature
    
    
    apply <lst_obj> <cmd> [Param]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
lst_obj  | obj  |  Name of the listable to which the command should be applied   
cmd  | str  |  Command that should be applied to the listable   
Param  | any  |  Parameter(s) for the command that should be applied   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Output  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Applies a command to multiple objects at once. Every time a command is applied to an object an undo-able action is created. 

_Example:_
    
    
    apply CenterLines "commands"

Displays available commands for all centerlines.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Applies a command to multiple objects at once. Every time a command is applied to an object an undo-able action is created. 

_Example:_
    
    
    apply CenterLines "setproperties" "Visible" False

Sets the visible property of all centerlines to False.

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

#  group (grp)

Creates a group of one or more objects. 

## Signature
    
    
    group <plx_obj>... [plx_feat]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  Name of the object that should be grouped   
plx_ref  | str  |  Name of the feature type that should be grouped, e.g., "EmbeddedBeam"  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
All  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Group](GUID-EF9C50AC-FE74-4B34-9A0D-D86ECCD825E1.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a group of one or more objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    group Volume_1 Point_1 Line_3

Creates a group of Volume_1, Point_1 and Line_3.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Groups specified features of one or more objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    group Line_1 Line_2 Line_3 "EmbeddedBeam"

Makes a group of the EmbeddedBeam features of Line_1, Line_2 and Line_3.

## See also

[ungroup](GUID-8B59A34A-780D-4B69-857D-BE8DE9B489F1.html)
