#  DisplacementMultiplier

Displacement multiplier. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the displacement multiplier.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the displacement multiplier.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the displacement multiplier.   
Name  |  Name  | \-  |  Name of the displacement multiplier.   
Signal  |  Signal  |  \-  | 

  * Harmonic  Sets the displacement multiplier signal to harmonic. 
  * Table  Sets the displacement multiplier signal to table. 

  
Amplitude  |  Amplitude  |  \-  |  Amplitude of the displacement multiplier when harmonic is used.   
Frequency  |  Frequency  |  Hz  |  Frequency of the displacement multiplier when harmonic is used.   
Phase  |  Phase  |  °  |  Phase of the displacement multiplier when harmonic is used.   
Table  |  Table  |  \-  |  Table with time and multiplier values when table is used.   
DataType  |  Data type  |  \-  | 

  * Displacements  Sets the displacement multiplier datatype to displacements. 
  * Velocities  Sets the displacement multiplier datatype to velocities. 
  * Accelerations  Sets the displacement multiplier datatype to accelerations. 

  
DampingRatio  |  DampingRatio  |  \-  |  The damping ratio is the amount of damping necessary to let a single degree-of-freedom system smoothly stop without rebouncing. Default value is 5. Range: 0-100   
ScalingType  |  ScalingType  |  \-  | 

  * Scaling factor (default)  All the multipliers are multiplied by the scaling factor (default = 1). 
  * Maximum multiplier  The scaling factor is determined as the ratio between the desired maximum value and the maximum value of the multiplier (in absolute value). Then, all the multipliers are multiplied by the resulting scaling factor. 

  
ScalingValue  |  ScalingValue  |  \-  |  The value of the scaling factor (1.0 by default).   
MaxMultiplier  |  MaxMultiplier  |  \-  |  The maximum value of the multiplier (in absolute value).   
MaxPeriod  |  MaxPeriod  |  \-  |  Max period value. Default value is 10. Range: 0.1-100.   
DriftCorrection  |  Drift correction  |  \-  | 

  * True  Enables the displacement multiplier drift correction when table is used. 
  * False  Disables the displacement multiplier drift correction when table is used.

#  count ()

Counts the number of values in an object. 

## Signature
    
    
    count<{plx_obj | lst_obj}>... [cond]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  Objects. Objects of which the values are to be counted   
lst_obj  | obj  | Listable object reference   
cond  | str  | Condition. The condition that the objects should fulfill to be counted   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Output  |  Listable   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Counts the number of values in an object. 

_Example:_
    
    
    count Uy_Phase_1_Soil_1

Counts the number of values in the Uy_Phase_1_Soil_1 object.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Counts the number of values in an object which fulfill a specified criterion. 

_Example:_
    
    
    count Phases "Info.Maxcores=4"

Counts the number phases with 4 maximum cores.

ForcesLoadsLoad  |  ForcesLoadsLoad  |  \-  |  Shows load forces.   
ForcesPresDisplLoad  |  ForcesPresDisplLoad  |  \-  |  Shows prescribed displacement forces.

NormalSoilStress  |  NormalSoilStress  |  \-  |  Shows normal soil stress.

ForcesAsForces  |  ForcesAsForces  |  \-  |  Enables the showing of direct forces.   
ForcesAsEquivalentForces  |  ForcesAsEquivalentForces  |  \-  |  Enables the showing of substitute forces for some structures.   
ForcesAsTotalForces  |  ForcesAsTotalForces  |  \-  |  Enables the showing of the summed forces.   
ForcesWaterPressureForce  |  ForcesWaterPressureForce  |  \-  |  Shows forces caused by water pressure.   
ForcesSoilStressForce  |  ForcesSoilStressForce  |  \-  |  Shows the soil stress forces.   
ForcesTotalStress  |  ForcesTotalStress  |  \-  |  Shows the total stresses.   
ForcesLoadsForce  |  ForcesLoadsForce  |  \-  |  Shows the forces caused by loads.   
ForcesPresDisplForce  |  ForcesPresDisplForce  |  \-  |  Shows the forces caused by prescribed displacements.   
CSElementContours  |  CSElementContours  |  \-  |  Shows element contours.   
StructureAxes  |  StructureAxes  |  \-  |  Shows local axes for certain structures.   
ClosedBoundary  |  ClosedBoundary  |  \-  |  Shows the closed boundary lines.   
SeepageBoundary  |  SeepageBoundary  |  \-  |  Shows the seepage boundary lines.   
FluxBoundary  |  FluxBoundary  |  \-  |  Shows the flux boundary lines.   
HeadBoundary  |  HeadBoundary  |  \-  |  Shows the head boundary lines.   
StructuresInCrossSection  |  StructuresInCrossSection  |  \-  |  Shows the structures intersected by a cross section view.

#  LineDisplacement 

Line prescribed displacement feature of a line. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the line prescribed displacement.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the line prescribed displacement.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the line prescribed displacement.   
Parent  |  Parent  |  \-  |  Name of the line where the line prescribed displacement feature is applied to.   
Displacement_x  |  Displacement x |  \-  | 

  * Free  The line can displace freely along the x-axis. 
  * Fixed  The line is fixed along the x-axis. 
  * Prescribed  The line has a prescribed displacement along the x-axis. 

  
Displacement_y  |  Displacement y |  \-  | 

  * Free  The line can displace freely along the y-axis. 
  * Fixed  The line is fixed along the y-axis. 
  * Prescribed  The line has a prescribed displacement along the y-axis. 

  
Displacement_z  |  Displacement z |  \-  | 

  * Free  The line can displace freely along the z-axis. 
  * Fixed  The line is fixed along the z-axis. 
  * Prescribed  The line has a prescribed displacement along the z-axis. 

  
Distribution  |  Distribution  |  \-  | 

  * Constant  The displacement value is constant over the entire line. 
  * Linear  The displacement value changes linearly along the line. 

  
ux_start  |  u x,start |  Length  |  x-component of the displacement at the start of the line.   
uy_start  |  u y,start |  Length  |  y-component of the displacement at the start of the line.   
uz_start  |  u z,start |  Length  |  z-component of the displacement at the start of the line.   
u_start  |  |u start |  |  Length  |  Absolute value of the displacement at the start of the line.   
ux_end  |  u x,end |  Length  |  x-component of the displacement at the end of the line.   
uy_end  |  u y,end |  Length  |  y-component of the displacement at the end of the line.   
uz_end  |  u z,end |  Length  |  z-component of the displacement at the end of the line.   
u_end  |  |u end |  |  Length  |  Absolute value of the displacement at the end of the line.

#  line 

Line object in the geometry. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the line.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the line.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  User Features of the line.   
BoundingBox  |  Bounding box  |  \-  |  Coordinates of the diagonal defining the bounding box for the line.   
First  |  First  |  \-  |  First point of the line.   
Second  |  Second  |  \-  |  Second point of the line.   
Length  |  Length  |  Length  |  Length of the line object.   
AxisFunction  |  AxisFunction  |  \-  | 

  * Automatic:  The first axis of the local coordinate system of the line is in the direction of the line. The second and third axis are defined automatically according to the global coordinate system. 
  * Manual:  The first axis of the local coordinate system of the line is in the direction of the line. The second axis is defined manually, the third axis is defined automatically according to the right hand rule. 

  
AxisVectorx  |  Axis2 x |  \-  |  x-component of the vector defining the second axis of the line.   
AxisVectory  |  Axis2 y |  \-  |  y-component of the vector defining the second axis of the line.   
AxisVectorz  |  Axis2 z |  \-  |  z-component of the vector defining the second axis of the line.   
  
## See also

[Beam,](GUID-EF04C65E-752F-4D44-9E64-47718CA07D4F.html)[EmbeddedBeam,](GUID-45C76C79-D6B5-4BD2-849A-24CA6C95A02E.html)[Discontinuity, ](GUID-7B0CA51C-56A9-44CA-982A-6D7BB0C1AD79.html), [LineDisplacement](GUID-E98B6295-F43A-4B3C-AAFC-A9881964D867.html), [LineDrain,](GUID-0E382614-6868-48F8-BFB5-682731D8188E.html) [LineLoad](GUID-20D78942-4E8C-4133-B6CA-5056C2257417.html), [NodetoNodeAnchor](GUID-98C932E3-CBFD-4C72-98E5-7E9DE218D959.html), [Well](GUID-0870CCD0-057B-4AF5-BF52-8FB26E9EFD8F.html)

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

#  getcurveresultspath (gcresp)

Displays results for curve points that have been previously selected for several different phases. 

## Signature
    
    
    getcurveresultspath <{Node | lst_obj}>... <{ph_obj ph_obj | step_obj step_obj}> <ResultType>

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
Node  | obj  |  Preselected node for retrieving results   
lst_obj  | obj  |  List of all results for the nodes and stress points   
ph_obj  | obj  | Phase object reference, the phase for which the calculation results should be displayed   
step_obj  | obj  | Step object reference, the step for which the calculation results should be displayed   
ResultType  | str  | Result type for which the calculation results should be displayed   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
\-  |  Global   
  
## Objects created

PlxValues 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays results for the curve points that have been previously selected for several different phases. 

_Example:_
    
    
    getcurveresultspath CurvePoints.Nodes[0] Phases[0] Phases[1] ResultTypes.Soil.Utot

Displays the curve results of displacement for Phases[0] and Phases[1] for soil nodes.

_Example:_
    
    
    getcurveresultspath CurvePoints[0] Phase_1 Phase_1 ResultTypes.Soil.Uy

Displays the curve results of displacement for Phase_1 for soil nodes.

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

#  setwaterdry (swdry)

Sets the pore pressure of one or more soil features to zero. 

## Signature
    
    
    setwaterdry <plx_obj>... [ph_obj]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
plx_obj  | obj  |  Name of the object(s) or phase(s) of which the pore pressure should be set to zero   
ph_obj  | obj  |  Name of the phase(s) in which the pore pressure should be set to zero   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Mesh, Flow conditions, Staged construction |  Object | Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Sets the pore pressure of one or more soil features to zero in a specified phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    setwaterdry BoreholeVolume_1_1 InitialPhase

Sets the pore pressure of BoreholeVolume_1_1 to zero in the initial phase.

_Example:_
    
    
    setwaterdry (BoreholeVolume_1_1 BoreholeVolume_2_1) InitialPhase

Sets the pore pressure of BoreholeVolume_1_1 to zero in the InitialPhase.

_Example:_
    
    
    setwaterdry Soil_1_1 InitialPhase Phase_1

Sets the pore pressure of Soil_1_1 to zero in the InitialPhase and Phase_1.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Sets the pore pressure of one or more soil features to zero in a specified phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    setwaterdry Soils (InitialPhase Phase_1)

Sets the pore pressure of all soils in the list of soils to zero in the InitialPhase and Phase_1.

## See also

[setwaterinterpolate](GUID-8F146C20-61AF-415F-AFED-BC965D0947A5.html), [setwaterlevel](GUID-0B60CE1E-E4A5-4FA1-8F4A-CE6043693C17.html)

**Parent topic:** [ Input commands reference ](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html)

#  decouplefromgenerator (dcfg)

Decouples one or more objects from the tunnel generator(s) into independent points, lines, polycurves, surfaces or volumes. 

## Signature
    
    
    decouplefromgenerator <Obj | CombiObj>...	
    	Obj: <pt_obj | ln_obj | polyc_obj | srf_obj | vol_obj | tn_obj >
    	CombiObj: combination of Obj

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point to be decoupled from generator   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference, Name of the line to be decoupled from generator   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Polycurve object reference, Name of the polycurve to be decoupled from generator   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to be decoupled from generator   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference, Name of the volume to be decoupled from generator   
tn_obj  | obj  | Tunnel object reference, Name of the tunnel to be decoupled from generator   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Decouples one or more geometry objects from the tunnel generator(s) into independent surfaces or volumes. 

_Example:_
    
    
    decouplefromgenerator Volume_1

Decouples Volume_1 from the tunnel generator. 

_Example:_
    
    
    decouplefromgenerator (Volume_1 Surface_14)

Decouples Volume_1 and Surface_14 from the tunnel generator.

## See also

[tunnel](GUID-D750CED7-5801-425F-BE0F-142EC33000B3.html)

**Parent topic:** [ Input commands reference ](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html)

## GUID-F192A9A8-B396-47A5-8E46-3A83F2177F25.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  contraction (ctr)

Adds contraction features to lines. 

## Signature
    
    
    contraction <surface> [surface]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
     surface:srf_obj | polyc_obj | {<startpoint> <point> <point>}
    	startpoint: (x y z) | pt_obj
    	point:	{"absolute" {(x y z) | pt_obj}} | {"relative" (x y z)} | {"angles" (Ang Ang) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj }} | {"vector" (dirx diry dirz) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj}}

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
PropName  | str  | Property name   
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value, property-value pair   
srf_obj  | obj  | Surface object reference, name of the structural surface to which a contraction feature should be added   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Polycurve object reference, name of the polycurve from which a contraction should be created   
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, name of the start or end point of the contraction   
"absolute" | str  |  Create a contraction by giving absolute coordinates   
"relative" | str  |  Create one or more contractions by giving relative coordinates   
"angles" | str  |  Create one or more contractions by giving two angles and a length per contraction   
"vector" | str  |  Create one or more contractions by giving a vector and a length or object to which the contraction should snap per contraction   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  |  z-coordinate   
slvol_obj  | obj  | Soil volume object reference, Name of the soil volume to which a line feature should be added   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference, Name of the volume to which a line feature should be added   
dirx  | float  |  Vector component in horizontal direction ("vector")   
diry  | float  |  Vector component in vertical direction ("vector")   
dirz  | float  | Vector component ("vector")   
Ang  | float  | Angle of the line with respect to the reference axis  
Len  | float  |  Vector length ("vector")   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

SurfaceContraction, Polygon

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds contraction features to one or more existing structural surfaces (which may either exist or will be created) in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    contraction Polygon_1

Adds a contraction feature to Polygon_1. 

_Example:_
    
    
    contraction Polygon_2 Polygon_3

Adds a contraction feature to Polygon_2 and Polygon_3. 

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface between three or more points and adds a contraction feature to it. 

_Example:_
    
    
    contraction Point_1 Point_2 (0 0 5)

Creates a structural surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a new point with coordinates (0, 0, 5) and adds a contraction feature to it. 

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface from a polycurve and adds a contraction feature to it. 

_Example:_
    
    
    contraction Polycurve_3

Creates a structural surface from Polycurve_3 and adds a contraction feature to it. 

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Adds contraction features to one or more existing structural surfaces in the geometry and directly sets their properties.

_Example:_
    
    
    contraction Polygon_1 "Distribution" "Axial increment" "C_inc_axial" 2.1

Adds a contraction feature to Polygon_1, sets the Distribution to "Axial increment" and the Cinc,axial to 2.1.

_Example:_
    
    
    contraction (Polygon_2 Polygon_3) "Distribution" "Axial increment" "C_inc_axial" 2.1

Adds contraction features to Polygon_2 and Polygon_3, sets the Distribution to "Axial increment" and the Cinc,axial to 2.1 for both contractions.. 

## Alternative 5

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface between three or more points (which may either exist or will be created), adds a contraction feature to it and directly sets its properties.

_Example:_
    
    
    contraction Point_1 Point_2 (1 0 5) "Distribution" "Axial increment" "C_inc_axial" 2.1

Creates a structural surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a new point with coordinates (0, 0, 5), adds a contraction feature to it, sets the Distribution to "Axial increment" and the Cinc,axial to 2.1.

## Alternative 6

_Purpose:_

Creates a structural surface from a polycurve and adds a contraction feature to it and directly set its properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    contraction Polycurve_8 "Distribution" "Axial increment" "C_inc_axial" 2.1

Creates a Creates a structural surface from Polycurve_8, adds a contraction feature to it, sets the Distribution to "Axial increment" and the Cinc,axial to 2.1.

## See also

[surface](GUID-60600C86-7D70-4160-997A-A81DB39A36DB.html)

# __dumpmeshes (__dms)

Displays the details of the mesh of a cut object. 

## Signature
    
    
    __dumpmeshes[B]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
B  | bool  |  True displays the details of the vertices and triangles, false does not display the details   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Staged construction |  Cut object   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays the number of vertices and triangles in the mesh of a cut object. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __dumpmeshes Volume_1_1

Displays the number of vertices and triangles in the mesh of Volume_1_1.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Displays the number of vertices and triangles in the mesh of a cut object and a list with all their details. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __dumpmeshes Volume_1_1 true

Displays the number of vertices and triangles in the mesh of Volume_1_1 and a list with all their details.

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14).

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  linevector (live)

Creates lines in directions specified using vectors. 

## Signature
    
    
    linevector <startpoint> <point> [point]...
    	startpoint: (x y z) | pt_obj
    	point:	{"absolute" {(x y z) | pt_obj}} | {"relative" (x y z)} | {"angles" (Ang Ang) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj }} | {"vector" (dirx diry dirz) {Len | ln_obj | srf_obj | slvol_obj | vol_obj}}

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference. Name of the point from which the line should start   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate of the point from which the line should start   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate of the point from which the line should start   
z  | float  | z-coordinate of the point from which the line should start   
Len  | float  |  Length. Length of the line that should be created   
ln_obj  | obj  |  Line object reference. Name of the line to which the created line should snap   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference. Name of the surface to which the created line should snap   
slvol_obj  | obj  | Soil volume object reference. Name of the soil volume to which the created line should snap   
vol_obj  | obj  | Volume object reference. Name of the volume to which the created line should snap   
dirx  | float  |  Vector component that defines the direction of the line that should be created (x-value)   
diry  | float  | Vector component that defines the direction of the line that should be created (y-value)   
dirz  | float  | Vector component that defines the direction of the line that should be created (z-value)   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Point](GUID-B66BC755-E798-4237-AA8F-FC607481D430.html), [Line](GUID-EA175FC9-E4E6-4FD3-97C0-4F1F3624D025.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates one or more lines from a point (which may either exist, or will be created) in a certain direction by giving a vector and a line length. 

_Example:_
    
    
    linevector Point_2 (6 4 8) 14

Creates a line from Point_2 in direction (6, 4, 8) with a length of 14.

_Example:_
    
    
    linevector (1 2 3) (5 4 6) 12 (9 7 8) 10

Creates a line from a new point with coordinates (1, 2, 3) in direction (5, 4, 6) with a length of 12 and a line from the end point of the previous line in direction (9, 7, 8) with a length of 10.

_Example:_
    
    
    linevector Point_5 (-1 2 3.2) Line_4

Creates a line from Point_5 in direction (-1, 2, 3.2) and snaps it to Line_4.

## See also

[line](GUID-A7671899-36CF-4CF1-B1EA-D8C754F013BB.html), [lineangles](GUID-A23CA42A-3B0B-4A96-A368-AB9BEB3403E7.html), [lineparallel](GUID-6014A769-1016-44A3-84F8-A63B9811C37B.html), [linerelative](GUID-4C2A32DC-946E-403D-9AF5-43CF9452D1B2.html)

Precipitation is a staged construction feature.

#  createreachedwlandcontinue (crwlcon)

Creates a new water level at the position reached at the end of the previous phase. The location of the water level in the current phase will change from that point on according to the flow function assigned to the original water level in the previous phase. 

## Signature
    
    
    createreachedwlandcontinue <wl_obj> <ph_obj>

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
wl_obj  | obj  | Name of the waterlevel from which a new water level is to be created   
ph_obj  | obj  |  Name of the phase after which a new water level is to be created   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Flow conditions, Structures |  WaterLevel   
  
## Objects created

[UserWaterLevel](GUID-EE2DDEB3-FC39-4E54-ADBB-F222E3EA73F8.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Creates a new water level at the position reached at the end of the previous phase. The location of the water level in the current phase will change from that point on according to the flow function assigned to the original water level in the previous phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    createreachedwlandcontinue UserWaterLevel_1 Phase_2

Creates a new water level at the position reached at the end of Phase_2. The location of the water level in Phase_2 will change from that point on according to the flow function assigned to the original water level in the previous phase. 

## See also

[createreachedwl](GUID-BFAA6402-70F7-4AE7-AB79-984E70354425.html)

#  DischargeFunction

Discharge function feature.

---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the discharge function.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the discharge function.

Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the discharge function.   
Signal  |  Signal  |  \-  | 

  * Harmonic  Sets the discharge function signal to harmonic 
  * Table  Sets the discharge function signal to table. 
  * Linear  Sets the discharge function signal to linear.

Time  |  Time  |  Time  |  Time for the signal when the discharge function is set to linear.

## GUID-F9DF871E-AAF5-4D68-889A-ACF084C156B7.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  meshd ()

Generates a mesh based on element dimension specified in length units rather than as a factor. 

## Signature
    
    
    meshd meshd_param
    	
    	meshd_param: {Num_ed | Num_ed B | Num_ed B Num_emr | Num_ed B Num_emr Num_min | Num_ed B Num_emr Num_min Num_psf | Prop}
    		Prop: {PropName PropValue}...

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
Num_ed  | float  |  Number. Element dimensions   
B  | bool  |  Boolean. Enhanced mesh refinements   
Num_emr  | float  |  Number. Global EMR scale factor   
Num_min  | float  |  Number. Minimum element size factor   
Num_psf  | float  |  Number. Proximity size factor   
PropName  | str  |  Property name   
PropValue  | any  |  Property value   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Mesh |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects. 

_Example:_
    
    
    meshd

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with specified element dimension. 

_Example:_
    
    
    meshd 0.1

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with an element dimension of 0.1 project length units.

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with specified element dimension and with enhanced mesh refinements. 

_Example:_
    
    
    meshd 0.1 True

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with an element dimension of 0.1 project length units and the enhanced mesh refinements is set to true.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with specified element dimension and with enhanced mesh refinements (EMR). 

_Example:_
    
    
    meshd 0.1 True 1.2

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with a relative element size factor of 0.075, enhanced mesh refinements is set to true, and global scale factor equal to 1.2

## Alternative 5

_Purpose:_

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with specified element dimension, enhanced mesh refinements, global scale factor, minimum size factor, and proximity size factor. 

_Example:_
    
    
    meshd 0.1 True 1.2 0.005

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with a relative element size factor of 0.075, enhanced mesh refinements is set to true, global scale factor equal to 1.2, and minimum element size factor of 0.005

## Alternative 6

_Purpose:_

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with specified element dimension, enhanced mesh refinements, global scale factor, minimum size factor, and proximity size factor. 

_Example:_
    
    
    meshd 0.1 True 1.2 0.005 0.2

Generates a mesh of the available meshable objects with a relative element size factor of 0.075, enhanced mesh refinements is set to true, global scale factor equal to 1.2, minimum element size factor of 0.005, and proximity size factor of 0.2.

## See also

[coarsen](GUID-F73E2CAB-014E-44FC-8667-0BF6500915D7.html), [refine](GUID-FE2E13E7-A6CD-43BB-AA7D-14DAF691FB12.html), [resetlocal](GUID-7C46C0F9-1B4A-41E1-AF5E-D23423CDD7F5.html), [viewmesh](GUID-5F7A1A3A-170E-4EEB-A598-8B696FABF695.html), [mesh](GUID-4174BEEB-F200-41E7-8979-60C95E86A807.html)

#  __getresults (__gres)

Displays calculation results. 

## Signature
    
    
    __getresults <ph_obj> <blc_obj> [value_id] [value_id]

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
ph_obj  | obj  |  Phase object reference. Name of the phase from which the calculation results should be displayed   
blc_obj  | str  |  Block object reference. Name of the block from which the calculation results should be displayed   
value_id  | int  |  Value index. Index of the value that should be displayed. The numbering of the values is 0-based   
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Flow conditions, Staged construction |  Global   
  
## Objects created

None 

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Displays the minimum and maximum value of the calculation results of a specified block in a phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __getresults InitialPhase "UTOT___R"

Displays the minimum and maximum or uniform value of the calculation results of block 'UTOT___R' in the initial phase (only for Gravity loading calculation type).

_Example:_
    
    
    __getresults Phase_2 "UTOT___R"

Displays the minimum and maximum or uniform value of the calculation results of block 'UTOT___R' in the Phase_2.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Displays a specific calculation result of a specified block in a phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __getresults InitialPhase "UTOT___R" 14

Displays the value at index 14 of the calculation results of block 'UTOT___R' in the initial phase (only for Gravity loading calculation type).

## Alternative 3

_Purpose:_

Displays all of the calculation results of column of a specified block in a phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __getresults Phase_2 "UTOT___R" "all"

Displays all calculation results of the first column of block 'UTOT___R' in Phase_2.

## Alternative 4

_Purpose:_

Displays the calculation results of row of a specified block in a phase. 

_Example:_
    
    
    __getresults Phase_3 "UTOT___R" "rows" 0 3

Displays the calculation results of the first row of block 'UTOT___R' in Phase_3.

#  Reinforcements

Reinforcements in the tunnel designer geometry. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the reinforcement.   
TypeName  |  TypeName  |  \-  |  TypeName of the reinforcement.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the reinforcement.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the reinforcement.   
Configuration  |  Configuration  |  \-  | 

  * Perpendicular  Configuration set to perpendicular. 
  * Umbrella arch  Configuration set to umbrella arch. 

  
NumberOfParts  | Number of parts  | \-  | Number of parts of the reinforcement, 1 part or 2 parts.   
TotalLength  | Total length  | Length  | Total length of reinforcements (read-only).   
Offset  |  Offset from segments  |  Length  |  Distance from the first tunnel point to the first reinforcement along the tunnel contour.   
Angle  |  Angle  |  °  |  Angle of reinforcement in an umbrella arch with respect to the out of plane direction. The angle of rock bolts for an umbrella arch can have values greater than 0° and lesser than 180°.   
ElementType  |  Element type  |  \-  | 

  * Rock bolt  Element type set to rock bolt element. 
  * Cable  Element type set to cable element. 
  * Node-to-node anchor  Element type set to node-to-node anchor element. 

  
Length  |  Length  |  Length  |  Length of the first and/or second part of the reinforcement perpendicular to the tunnel contour.   
RockBoltProperties  | RockBoltProperties  | \-  | Contains the Material and Apply strength reduction properties for the rock bolt element type assigned as reinforcement. For more information, check the [RockBoltProperties](GUID-3160EAAF-0234-4275-9077-B0A82AA53AED.html) object.   
CableProperties  | CableProperties  | \-  | Contains the Material and Apply strength reduction properties for the cable element type assigned as reinforcement. For more information, check the [CableProperties](GUID-43D17828-916C-4F66-8619-47D59088B534.html) object.   
AnchorProperties  | AnchorProperties  | \-  | Contains the Material and Apply strength reduction properties for the node-to-node anchor element type assigned as reinforcement. For more information, check the [AnchorProperties](GUID-0EC30877-F554-4FDC-B95A-A9292FC26EB8.html) object   
Material  | Material  | \-  | Material of the relevant reinforcement.   
ApplyStrengthReduction  |  Apply strength reduction  |  \-  |  Apply strength reduction option for the relevant reinforcement.   
Parent  |  Parent  |  \-  |  Name of the parent tunnel object.   
Breadth  |  Breadth  |  \-  |  Breadth object for the reinforcement. For details check the See also section.   
Depth  |  Depth  |  \-  |  Depth object for the reinforcement. For details check the See also section.   
  
## See also

[AnchorProperties](GUID-0EC30877-F554-4FDC-B95A-A9292FC26EB8.html), [Breadth](GUID-01D4966B-1B33-4138-83CC-CEF6295E7F54.html), [CableProperties](GUID-43D17828-916C-4F66-8619-47D59088B534.html), [Depth](GUID-8850A12F-29C3-4AC2-A378-1E48E549D450.html), [RockBoltProperties](GUID-3160EAAF-0234-4275-9077-B0A82AA53AED.html)

#  BeamMat

Material set that can be assigned to a beam. 

Property  |  Name in GUI  |  Unit  |  Description   
---|---|---|---  
Name  |  Name  |  \-  |  Name of the beam material.   
Comments  |  Comments  |  \-  |  Comments on the beam material.   
UserFeatures  |  UserFeatures  |  \-  |  UserFeatures of the beam material object.   
Identification  |  Identification  |  \-  |  Identification of the beam material.   
Colour  |  Colour  |  \-  |  Colour of the beam material.   
MaterialType  |  Material type  |  \-  | 

  * None  No material type selected. 
  * Elastic  Sets beam material behaviour to elastic. 
  * Elastoplastic  Sets beam material behaviour to elastoplastic. 

  
Gamma  |  γ  |  Force/Length 3 |  Unit weight of the embedded beam material.   
DampingMethod  |  Damping method  |  \-  | 

  * Direct  Allows to specify Rayleigh alpha and beta. 
  * SDOF equivalence  Single Degree of Freedom equivalent values. 

  
RayleighAlpha  |  Rayleigh alpha  |  \-  |  Rayleigh alpha value.   
RayleighBeta  |  Rayleigh beta  |  \-  |  Rayleigh beta value.   
TargetDamping1  |  ξ 2 |  %  |  Damping target value 1.   
TargetDamping2  |  ξ 2 |  %  |  Damping target value 2.   
TargetFrequency1  |  f 1 |  Hz  |  Damping target frequency value 1.   
TargetFrequency2  |  f 2 |  Hz  |  Damping target frequency value 2.   
CrossSectionType  |  Cross section type  |  \-  | 

  * Predefined  Use one of the predefined cross section types. 
  * User-defined  Define a cross section by giving geometric values. 

  
PredefinedCrossSectionType  |  Predefined cross section type  |  \-  | 

  * Solid circular beam  Use a solid circular beam. 
  * Circular tube  Use a circular tube. 
  * Solid rectangular beam  Use a solid rectangular beam. 

  
Diameter  |  Diameter  |  Length  |  Diameter of a circular tube or solid circular beam.   
Thickness  |  Thickness  |  Length  |  Thickness of the wall of a circular tube.   
Height  |  Height  |  Length  |  Height of a solid rectangular beam.   
Width  |  Width  |  Length  |  Width of a solid square beam.   
A  |  Area  |  Length 2 |  Area of the cross-section of the beam.   
I2  |  I 2 |  Length 4 |  Moment of inertia of the beam over the second axis.   
I3  |  I 3 |  Length 4 |  Moment of inertia of the beam over the third axis.   
E  |  Young's modulus  |  Force/Length 2 |  Young's modulus of the beam material.   
YieldStress  |  Yield Stress σ y |  Force/Length 2 |  Yield stress parameter for a beam.   
CriticalDirection  |  Critical yield local direction  |  Force/Length 2 | 

  * Local direction 2  Local axis direction 2. 
  * Local direction 3  Local axis direction 3. 

  
W2  |  W 2 |  Length 3 |  Plastic section modulus when the Yield direction is in local direction 2.   
W3  |  W 3 |  Length 3 |  Plastic section modulus when the Yield direction is in local direction 3.

## GUID-FF5D716F-297B-431F-8354-8FEE77644DFD.html

[![Logo](static/logo.png)](index.html)

# PLAXIS 3D \- Command Reference

JavaScript must be enabled in order to use this site.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser and refresh the page.

#  plate (pl)

Adds plate features tosurfaces. 

## Signature
    
    
    plate  <surface> [surface]... [{PropName PropValue}]...
     surface: {<startpoint> <point> <point> [point]...} | polyc_obj | srf_obj}
    	startpoint: {(x y z)} | pt_obj
    	point:	{(x y z)} | pt_obj	
    	PropName, PropValue: Details on the available properties at object [Plate](GUID-2CAAB714-BDA7-4A29-AC36-25F1D4C5CF4E.html)

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14). 



## Parameters

Parameter  |  Type  | Description   
---|---|---  
pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point(s) for which a Plate object should start or end   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Polycurve object reference, Name of the polycurve to which a Plate object should be added   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which a Plate object should be added   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [Plate](GUID-2CAAB714-BDA7-4A29-AC36-25F1D4C5CF4E.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [Plate](GUID-2CAAB714-BDA7-4A29-AC36-25F1D4C5CF4E.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Plate](GUID-2CAAB714-BDA7-4A29-AC36-25F1D4C5CF4E.html),  [Polygon](GUID-41820D20-39F0-4968-AC4B-FC589E7EB18E.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds plate features to one or more  surfaces in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    plate Polygon_1

Adds a plate feature to Polygon_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    plate (Polygon_6 Polygon_4)

Adds plate features to Polygon_6 and Polygon_4.

_Example:_
    
    
    plate (1 4 0) (2 3 0) (4 5 0)

Creates a new surface between three points with coordinates (1, 4, 0), (2, 3, 0) and (4, 5, 0) and adds a plate feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    plate Point_1 Point_2 (4 5 0)

Creates a new surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a point with coordinates (4, 5, 0) and adds a plate feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    plate Polycurve_1

Adds a plate feature to closed Polycurve_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    plate Group_1

Adds plate features to all structural surfaces in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only surfaces.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds plate features to one or more existing surfaces in the geometry and directly set their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    plate Polygon_1 "Material" Footing

Adds a plate feature to Polygon_1 and sets the material to Footing.

_Example:_
    
    
    plate (Polygon_1 Polygon_3) "Material" Footing

Adds a plate feature to Polygon_1 and Polygon_3 and sets the material to Footing for both plates.

_Example:_
    
    
    plate Point_1 Point_2 (5 6 0) "Material" Footing

Creates a new surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a new point with coordinates (5, 6, 0), adds a plate feature to it and sets the material to Footing.

## See also

[platemat](GUID-6683E25F-D53D-4F24-BBFC-17775EC11DBD.html), [surface](GUID-60600C86-7D70-4160-997A-A81DB39A36DB.html)

#  addwaterpoint ()

Adds a water point to a water level.

    	point:	{(x, y, zref) | pt_obj}

  * See [Signature conventions](GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE.html#GUID-ADADC8BC-1EEC-450B-8F28-D70C7B4936FE__SECTION_862267CED7C548978095BA5368191A14).

pt_obj  | obj  |  Point object reference, Name of the point(s) for which a Discontinuity object should start or end   
polyc_obj  | obj  | Polycurve object reference, Name of the polycurve to which a Discontinuity object should be added   
srf_obj  | obj  |  Surface object reference, Name of the surface to which a Discontinuity object should be added   
x  | float  |  x-coordinate   
y  | float  |  y-coordinate   
z  | float  | z-coordinate   
PropName  | str  | Property name. Details on the available properties at object [Discontinuity](GUID-7B0CA51C-56A9-44CA-982A-6D7BB0C1AD79.html)  
PropValue  | str | float  | Property value. Details on the available properties at object [Discontinuity](GUID-7B0CA51C-56A9-44CA-982A-6D7BB0C1AD79.html)  
  
## Scope

Mode  | Target   
---|---  
Soil, Structures |  Global   
  
## Objects created

[Discontinuity](GUID-7B0CA51C-56A9-44CA-982A-6D7BB0C1AD79.html),  [Polygon](GUID-41820D20-39F0-4968-AC4B-FC589E7EB18E.html)

## Alternative 1

_Purpose:_

Adds discontinuity features to one or more  surfaces in the geometry. 

_Example:_
    
    
    discontinuity Polygon_1

Adds a discontinuity feature to Polygon_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    discontinuity (Polygon_6 Polygon_4)

Adds discontinuity features to Polygon_6 and Polygon_4.

_Example:_
    
    
    discontinuity (1 4 0) (2 3 0) (4 5 0)

Creates a new surface between three points with coordinates (1, 4, 0), (2, 3, 0) and (4, 5, 0) and adds a discontinuity feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    discontinuity Point_1 Point_2 (4 5 0)

Creates a new surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a point with coordinates (4, 5, 0) and adds a discontinuity feature to it.

_Example:_
    
    
    discontinuity Polycurve_1

Adds a discontinuity feature to closed Polycurve_1.

_Example:_
    
    
    discontinuity Group_1

Adds discontinuity features to all structural surfaces in Group_1. Group_1 should consist of only surfaces.

## Alternative 2

_Purpose:_

Adds discontinuity features to one or more existing surfaces in the geometry and directly set their properties. 

_Example:_
    
    
    discontinuity Polygon_1 "Material" Footing

Adds a discontinuity feature to Polygon_1 and sets the material to Footing.

_Example:_
    
    
    discontinuity (Polygon_1 Polygon_3) "Material" Footing

Adds a discontinuity feature to Polygon_1 and Polygon_3 and sets the material to Footing for both discontinuitys.

_Example:_
    
    
    discontinuity Point_1 Point_2 (5 6 0) "Material" Footing

Creates a new surface between Point_1, Point_2 and a new point with coordinates (5, 6, 0), adds a discontinuity feature to it and sets the material to Footing.

## See also

[discontinuitymat](GUID-C1956259-C0BE-467B-B762-7A1B9F046FC0.html), [surface](GUID-60600C86-7D70-4160-997A-A81DB39A36DB.html)
